Reviews.Title: “The Dana on Mission Bay adds a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: GClementAZ
Reviews.Content: I went to The Dana for a business trip that happened to take place on my 20th wedding anniversary. The sales staff we worked with were very professional and accommodating. They even sent a cookie tray to my room and a card wishing me a happy anniversary. The hotel is in a beautiful location and the on sight restaurants are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for family or couples getaway”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: The Dana is the only palce we stay in San Diego after trying many other locations over the years. It is close to everything. The service is always prompt and courteous starting with the check in and all the way through the check out. You can't beat the view from the Bay rooms and from the pool and Firefly cafe. The food is always great as well. You will never stay anywhere else after one visit, I guarantee it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for families”
Reviews.Author: lightyearz
Reviews.Content: Exellent location for Sea World. Nice pools. Clean and professional. One minor problem: I reserved the hotel months in advance, checked inn late but the key was not ready and it took to long to get us into the room after a long day at Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Convenient to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_WYBikeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with the Marina View. The property is conveniently located to Sea World and offers a shuttle service which we used for one of our days. We enjoyed the hotel which offers 2 large swimming pools and hot tubs. If you like walking, there is a nice walk along Mission Bay. There are bike rentals by the Hotel if riding a bike is your enjoyment. You are not far from the beach and can ride a bike to and from the beach. Had I known, you can also fish off one of the piers. Not sure what one of the guests was catching, but they were releasing the fish and feeding a sea lion close by. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The desk staff was polite and helpful with ideas of what to see and do. We purchased our Seaworld and San Diego Safari tickets at the front desk. All around a great location with a view of the harbor and bay and attractive grounds. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, midsize hotel on the Bay near Sea World”
Reviews.Author: maroonedcrab
Reviews.Content: We had always stayed on Coronado Island when we were in San Diego, but this time we needed to be in town. On a recommendation from USD, we tried The Dana and were totally charmed. We stayed in a ground floor bay view room with a nice patio and a gate that exited right out onto the park for easy access to a path for walking and jogging. The room was large with 2 queen beds, small pullout sofa, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, safe, and free wifi. We ate dinner on the patio at the Firefly restaurant and the crispy pork belly sandwich was delicious, so we went back and had it again the second night! The Blue Pearl for breakfast was a pleasant space with acceptable food. Staff was pleasant and helpful and the grounds were beautifully landscaped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Very Nice Room, A Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: TheAnth
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the top floor of the 3-level buildings, and had an amazing view. And wow, what a view. My wife and loved our stay at the Dana - as much as we could. The restaurant is very nice. Stephanie in the restaurant is really a top star, as is John in the restaurant - super friendly and very enthusiastic. I remember tipping him almost half of the bill, just because he was both charming and on his game. The food was delicious. I was physically ill, unfortunately, during this trip. My wife was able to get some medicines from the gift shop (the lady in the gift shop was VERY nice and felt bad that I was sick!) - and I guess if you're going to be sick on vacation, being sick where there's a nice view is about as good as it can get. The room was comfortable, and the sunsets were beautiful. Even at my worst, I couldn't help but enjoy the view and the beauty of the property. The balcony was nice and spacious, and room service was friendly and the food - again - was good. Front desk was ok, but not very personable. I was surprised, and a little worried when checking in, but everyone else was nice. Additionally, $16. for parking is really ridiculous, and I think a little creepy after paying over $1000. for three nights. No amenities were considered, and no manager to discuss it with. I guess after $1000, who cares about another 1.6%, but after the fact, I just don't like the concept. It's like getting a hotel room only to find a pay toilet in the room. Who does that these days? Cheesy! One restaurant staff member on a particularly busy night, however, was very friendly and was willing to move his car so we could park. I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: msimyak327
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at The Dana. The rooms were affordable and right on the bay. The grassy area was a great place for taking walks, the balcony had a great view and mission beach was extremely close. We had a quick easy drive to get to the zoo, Coronado Island and downtown. The service at the hotel was awesome. The front desk was incredibly friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. Next time we are in San Diego we will be staying at The Dana.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: chitownrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here TWICE during a weeklong vacation and loved every bit of it. Starting with the staff, Jennifer K and the front desk, who all went well above and beyond the call of duty and addressed our every concern. The grounds were immaculate, the food terrific, and the sights and sounds very appealing. Whale watching etc. was right across the road. The rooms were very well designed and appointed and roomy and very well amenitized. A great location that appeals to travellers of all types. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at The Dana for three nights and really enjoyed it. Right on Mission Bay, high quality bedding, very nice pool areas for kids and adults (should have taken more advantage of these in fact - didn't realize they were going to be so nice), relaxing and stylish restaurant area with lovely outdoor seating. Dinner prices at the Firefly restaurant were quite reasonable although I expected lunch prices to be slightly more affordable based on that. All the employees with whom we interacted were very friendly with positive attitudes. Overall The Dana is a solid 4-star resort in the "great value, excellent location, and good night's sleep" category.

Reviews.Title: “Kid tested ... mom and dad approved!”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddypooh
Reviews.Content: Definitely a family favorite! We will definitely be staying at this property again! Wife and I took our two little ones (ages 2 & 5) to Sea World and Lego Land the week after Christmas and spent time efore the trip looking fo a place to stay. This is the closest hotel to Sea World. They even provide a free shuttle that takes you to the front gate. Our room faced the harbor, so we would waek up to ocean breazes. In the eveings we would go for nice quiet walks on the property grounds and drive to nearby family restaurants. Room had all amenities we needed, including mini-fridge and coffee maker. Not a cheap place to stay at but you definitely get what you pay for. This place really helped make our vacation a most memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Todd S
Reviews.Content: Although we had a few problems (broken shower faucet, no exhaust fan) The Dana is a great place to stay in that it was clean, convenient to nearly everything around San Diego, reasonable, and has excellent on site restaurants/grounds/facilities. It isn't five star by any means, but the rooms were very adequate for our family of four and the morning views were a great way to wake up. The breakfast credit makes the excellent breakfasts very affordable and it's only minutes from Sea World and the pacific beaches, shops, and amusement park. We would definitely consider staying there again. Oh, and the beds were very comfortable with excellent housekeeping service. We had a few late night requests and they were very accommodating. The only knock was with their wifi which is spotty at best, at least in the wing we were in.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't require a lot of service, it's PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: WineTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our recent visit to San Diego. It was one of those times when the hotel was just as good as we hoped! We weren't expecting a five-star luxury resort, but we still thrilled with it. We got a two-room suite (well, a bedroom and a sitting room with a faux kitchen and a good-sized bathroom) and it covered our needs quite well (two parents and two girls so we wanted some separate space). Everything was very clean and comfortable, we had a fabulous balcony/deck looking towards Mission Bay, and the staff responded quickly the couple of times we had minor needs. Bear in mind that the hotel rooms open to the outside, not an enclosed hallway - not a problem, just thought you should know. We were very happy with it and will most likely stay there again next time we visit SAN (it is located about three minutes from Sea World).

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break stay”
Reviews.Author: StillAqua
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for a week of Spring Break vacation and enjoyed the hotel very much. We rented a car for our stay through the front desk and saw most of the sights of southern California.Our room was a third floor king suite with a view of the park and Bay in the newer section of the hotel. It was clean and well decorated with free wieless internet access, fridge, microwave, coffee maker for two, and a nice balcony with a couple deck chairs. Never could figure out how to shut the air conditioning off at night so we could sleep with the balcony door open for fresh air. Staff were very friendly and helpful with places to go, tickets, etc. Pool and jacuzzi were lovely for an after dinner dip. We would definitely recommend the Dana to our friends as it's a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done by Everyone at The Dana”
Reviews.Author: Janis M
Reviews.Content: A great big "JOB WELL DONE" everyone at The Dana!! It was a fantastic location for our daughter's wedding. We were so excited about having the ceremony outside at the beautiful spot by Mission Bay. Small problem arose with the arrival of one of the worst winter storms in 10 years - pouring rain and gusting winds. Keith Robinson and the entire Banquet crew transformed the ballroom from beautiful chapel to a fantastic ballroom for the reception. Excellent food...excellent Service and a fun time was had by all! The wedding was all we had imaged. Everyone from the front desk to house keeping were friendly and helpful. Anna in the Blue Pearl put together a fabulous breakfast buffet for us the next day. We enjoyed the views from our Mission Bay rooms. Great having bar sink, refrig, & microwave. Great patio too. It was a great location for all of the out of town guests to see the San Diego sights.

Reviews.Title: “Waterside Resort”
Reviews.Author: revmom1023
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana recently for a seminar that was held on site. The hotel has a shuttle from the airport for a reasonable fee making a rental car unnecessary for me which was a plus. Because of it's location, you will need to use the city shuttle to head downtown or to other locations although it is walking distance from Sea World. The rooms are very comfortable and homey and the staff was very responsive. I ate at one of the restaurants and the food was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: WyomingTrogon
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed there for the San Diego Birding Festival. We were pleased with the very friendly staff, clean rooms and good rate. The only negative thing I would have to say is that in the late evening a few people were rather "very noisy" at the swimming pool and the jacuzz . We phoned the front desk and they immediately took care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTim
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via hotwire for just under $100. This hotel has 2 areas, one of them is 3 stories with views of Mission Bay and the other which have garden views. The garden view rooms are the ones we got but we were on the ground floor with a nice patio. These rooms are like motel style rooms in which you enter the room from an outside walkway. The actual rooms are very nice and clean. The A/C unit is very loud but I used to sleeping with white noise so it did not bother me at all. The location was excellent, next door to Sea World and a 20 minute walk to Mission Beach. Just know that parking is $18 per night but almost every hotel in San Diego charges. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful first impressions”
Reviews.Author: Skelshy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a series of muddy brown, two story square buildings built around a garden and pool area. It is located on the mission bay lagoon but not on mission beach. Restaurant choices within walking distance are limited and no stores nearby. Bus to mission beach and old town every 20/30 minutes. Parking is $18. When we landed at the airport we had to take a cab because the advertised hotel shuttle did not operate after 8 pm. We checked in and noticed the room was cold. There was an AC remote but it did not work. We had a really cold night. Next day we found out you had to crawl under the side table and manually turn on the unit. The wifi did not work. I think the room had been smoked in or the building must be fairly old - it has the "musty old hotel room" odor. Rooms are nicely furnished, gardens are lovely, staff friendly. Overallj an OK hotel but I'd probably look elsewhere if I was to return to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “I wols return”
Reviews.Author: Cricket808285
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire and after reading all the reviews I was a bit leery. I did get an older room and thought it was fine. It was nothing special but adequate for my needs. It is not a bright room but did have a sliding glass door to a small patio with a table and 2 chairs overlooking the pool area. I had some trouble with the bathtub drain but the maintenance people were very prompt in fixing it. I resented paying for parking and was told it was to keep others from using their parking area. However, the parking is gated and you need a room key to get in, so that is not true. The grounds were nice and had a walking trail along the water. There is a park next door. My only complaint with housekeeping is that one day I returned to find a pile of someone's dirty sheets n front of my TV. I ate at the restaurant and the food was good and the portions plentiful. I would return to the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!!”
Reviews.Author: kerry t
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at The Dana this past weekend and loved it! We got a bay side room and our young daughter loved looking out at the boats. Our room was clean and comfortable, the staff was so friendly and helpful (they always stopped to help me carry things when I was walking around the property with the baby) and the jacuzzi was perfect after our day at Seaworld. The free shuttle service there was a really nice touch, especially with the kids in tow. I was really happy with the kitchenette, it is a must whenever we stay in a hotel. Oh, and the pillows were so comfy!! I bring my own pillow when we stay at hotels, but this time I didn't even need it. Amazing!! Happy hour at the Firefly was wonderful, great service and our picky teenage son liked the food, which rarely happens, so we were pleased. On Sunday we had breakfast at the Blue Pearl, which was also really good- I have dietary restrictions which they were happy to accommodate. My husband and I are planning on returning for our anniversary in May. Hopefully for a longer stay, 2 nights was not enough!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VIEW”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: we were out to san diego to visit our son and stayed at the dana. our room was on the bay side and the view was awesome! so quiet and relaxing while watching boats and rowing teams out on the bay from our balcony. we even got to see seals swim by. the room was awesome along with the pool and restaurants right on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “California Dreamin'”
Reviews.Author: Megan H
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Dana was excellent. From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out the staff was very courteous and professional. Our room was very modern and the view of the bay was absolutely beautiful. We were lucky enough to have gorgeous weather and spent all day lounging on our balcony. We had appetizers and wine at the firefly(?), all was exceptional. In the morning our room service was quick and fresh. I will definitely recommend the Dana to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “NICE Hotel on Bay”
Reviews.Author: Samantha S
Reviews.Content: It was far from the city center, but still very nice. We loved being able to walk along the bay every night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: Critical V
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, relatively new, the bathroom and bedroom are spacious. The harbor view is beautiful, the grounds are clean and in excellent condition. There are some trouble spots, the poured cement balcony is angled incorrectly causing water to pool at the sliding glass doors. The rug inside the door shows evidence of water damage. Secondly the internet wireless signal is too weak to use. The cable for a wire connection is hidden behind the couch causing a call to customer service. Customer service was courteous and prompt, finding the connection and sticking around to assure that it connected. After browsing the web, I found that email would not send although it would receive. I’ve had this type of problem before with hotel connections and just didn’t want to go in and change a bunch of settings in hopes that I could get it to work and then need to change everything back at the next hotel. This really bugs me because the first two hotels on this trip were no problem at all and then this hotel is nothing but internet problems. I’m guessing this would be blamed on the hotels internet provider, his tools and program setup. The internet here was free. Used the guest laundry, and had difficulties there as well. The washing machines took nothing but quarters, $1.50 per load, a few loads of washing and drying used up a $10 roll of quarters. The dollar changer did not work prompting a fairly long walk to the office to get change. The office was apologetic and provided the change but all in all it was an unnecessary hassle and the high price of the machines provided no feeling of quality. The two restaurants on the grounds were very good. The Fire Fly and the Blue Pearl had excellent service and very friendly staff. The Fire Fly is a sort of sports bar / restaurant. It has generous area heaters on the outside seating, good food and a friendly staff. Remember to check your bill total before leaving the restaurant as it appeared to me that their adding machine had a problem and charged twice for one of the drinks. Breakfast at the Blue Pearl was great, generous portions, plenty of coffee refills and good food. The staff there were friendly and bent over backwards to serve. This restaurant is located at the far end of the parking lot, a bit of a walk depending on your room location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: angelinapink
Reviews.Content: Having transferrred here from a hotel in downtown San Diego, the feel was very much of a resort hotel. It was lovely to be so close to the water and to see all the boats. The lobby area was nice, and the girls on reception went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Customer service was seond to non.Very impressive, and a great first impression. Our room was in the old wing, so not great views and decor a little tired looking, but still very nice.New rooms have fab views overlooking the bay, and despite sending an email requesting a by view room unfortunately we didnt get one. I found it very noisy one night when person outside our room talking on a mobile phone at 2am- yes, you guy from Northern Ireland talking to Catherine back home! The hotel was great. Breakfast in the Blue Pearl was lovely, thanks to Jim our delightful waiter. Eggs Benedict California style was superb. Great orange Juice,and great coffee. Had dinner in the Firefly one night, very good.HappyHour great too. I was disappointed that there was nothing much within walking distance. We did walk over the bridge to Mission Beach, looking for another bar or restaurant, but it was all a bit tacky. I preferred the Downtown Gaslamp Area. But. perfect location if you have kids and want to visit Seaworld. I did like the two swimming pools at the Dana. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “room quality”
Reviews.Author: 4joe4
Reviews.Content: i took a bay side view and its really nice they have a little kitchen there i really enjoyed it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: cmstein
Reviews.Content: Very clean and wonderful location. Great ameneties and views are awesome. The staff was very nice and even upgraded us to a bay view. The location is close to all the major attractions in San Diego; sea world, beaches, the zoo, downtown, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service ever.”
Reviews.Author: thomasena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Dana for 3 nights. The people were very friendly. We walked to Sea World. We had breakfast at The Blue Pearl and it was very good and not bad prices for a hotel. The room was very clean. The grounds are very nice. The rooms were a little above average. So if you can get a discount it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: kayMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my family, husband and 2 young sons. Check in was a breeze. Our room was ready for us at 12:30. We were in room 2200 which was a corner Premium Bay Side Suite on the second floor. When entering the room you enter into the bedroom which is very nice and stylish. In that room to the left is a good size closet, sitting chair, and a huge set of windows. Also in the bedroom area is a dresser with tv, huge mirror, and a small size window. The beds were very comfortable, however I didn't care for the pillows. Down the hall to the right is a big mini bar area with mini fridge, microwave, sink, coffee pot, silver wear, plates, and the safe. They supplied it with a roll of paper towels and dish soap. It also has lots of cabinet and drawer space which made it perfect for storing extra things. On the left hand side is a nice big bathroom with plenty of counter space and even a few shelves for storage. At the end of the hall is the living room. It has a pocket door to separate the rooms. Their was a couch that pulled out to a bed, chair, coffee table, two end tables, a small round table with 3 chairs, and another dresser with tv. The best part of that room was the whole back wall was the balcony doors and windows that covered the whole room. The balcony was huge. A small table with four chairs and also a lounge chair. They have two pools. The one we used was big and nice and warm. They had plenty of lounge chairs, 2 cabanas, and a hot tub. We tried both restaurants. The firefly had a nice atmosphere. I felt it was a tad expensive for the quality. We only went to the Blue Pearl for breakfast and felt the value was good. I've read many people where charged $18 a night for parking. When making reservations they gave me a rate of $8. Maybe because we were staying for 7 nights. When entering the parking lot you must scan your room key which can be stubborn. It took me 12 scans once before the gate would open. I really have no complaints. You for sure need a car to stay here, IMO. However I felt it was centrally located. Most places we went to were a short 5-10min drive. I choose this hotel for the extra green space that it gave my boys for running around and the suite style rooms and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: maltesefalcon54
Reviews.Content: The setting is out of this world. the location is great. The pools are beautiful. The room we had had a patio with a gate to the pool. AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: YEGirl
Reviews.Content: We (my husband & I, and our toddler) enjoyed five nights at the Dana. We picked it for it's proximity to Sea World, although we ended up just enjoying the area beaches instead. The lobby area is modern, with a small gift shop tucked around the corner from the front desk. Check in was slow, although we seemed to have arrived at a busy time. Our room was a ground floor, two queen, marina-facing one. It is good if you have a car and small children, as we could park right in front of our room. (Although beware the parking fee as previously mentioned!) The room was very clean, with a small area just outside the bathroom that had a mini fridge, microwave, sink and counter. We prepped a lot of meals/snacks in the room, due to having a tight budget and a picky toddler. However, we did have breakfast most mornings at the Blue Pearl restaurant. The Blue Pearl was great, the food was well done and very reasonably priced, they are very accommodating to children (always had the crayons and colouring sheets ready!) and service was friendly and fast. My husband especially loved the huevos rancheros. The grounds were nice, with lots of plants and trees. There was a grassy area near our room that was good for playing on, and I saw other guests playing badminton there. There's a nice walking path that takes you from the marina, around the point, and on down the beach. We enjoyed walking it every day, although we did see homeless people sleeping in the park area beside the highway. The location is great, there is a shuttle to SeaWorld if you are going, and a quick drive (or medium walk) over the bridge to the beaches on the other side. All the staff were friendly and accommodating, especially the housekeeping staff. The biggest downside for us was the sound of doors closing in adjoining suites was loud and would shake the walls. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Planet Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: crashchristy
Reviews.Content: Our check-in at the Dana Hotel went smoothly, via a friendly & helpful clerk. Be warned there may be overnight parking fees to contend with, ours were waived apparently after we checked our bill. The room was hard to find due to the way the buildings are marked but we were pleasantly delighted to find our room was on the top of a 3-floor building and our bedroom/balcony had a fantastic view of the Mission Bay just yards away. The entire wall is windowed, with movable shutter doors to block light or open to the panorama. Teak furnishings, large bath, and comfy bed, clean & tidy, sofa bed with coffee table as well as a small eating table & 2 chairs. Very small food prep area with only a sink, cabinets, small microwave, and dorm size frig (no freezer) but there are 2 restaurants on site. This was a hotel room, not a condo, but the kingsize bed & furnishings were well placed and roomy. Ice machine down the walkway outside room, elevator is handy for unloading car. We took our bikes and they were welcome, as you can bike everywhere, along the bays, parks, marinas, and only 1/2 mile to Mission Beach & the boardwalk strand there. Fish the bay, or charter a boat, there is lots of activity on the bay waters (gulls, pelicans, coots, ducks, etc) or take the short hop to Mission Beach and walk along the shore, we spotted dolphins out jumping beyond where the surfers were waiting for the next ride in. The Sea World exit is only a 1/2 mile in the other direction. After a busy day, you can come back to the Dana and have a swim in the heated pool overlooking the bay/marina area. Heaven.... What a wonderful 3 day trip from our desert dwelling to light, surf, water, wind, and sealife!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: jcali25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I try to go to San Diego once a year. When we do go we have to stay at The Dana. They have a very friendly staff and you can't beat the views of Mission Bay. We look forward to next time!

Reviews.Title: “well pleased”
Reviews.Author: Beverly P
Reviews.Content: Our son and his family took us to San Diego for a long weekend as a Christmas gift. The Dana was the right place for us to stay. The rooms were clean, the room service was wonderful. Quiet and beautiful view. We would go back in a heartbeat. Thank you Dana

Reviews.Title: “Welcomes Univ of San Diego parents and visitors”
Reviews.Author: Gidg11
Reviews.Content: I am a return guest, the parent of USD students. Thanks to the generosity of the Dana's owner, a USD alum, when you visit there is a USD rate and special extras. Be sure to check it out. But that is not the reason I return, the hotel is situated along the bay, with pretty grounds, two great pools, clean, well appointed rooms and the very very best staff I have experienced in my travels. A shout out to Anna at the Firefly, whose "good morning!" sets the tone of your day. Samantha at the front desk is also a big help, and the wait staff, front desk, reservations, are always helpful and friendly. You will see me again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beautiful location on the marina”
Reviews.Author: AL85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights but the rooms were really clean and fairly modern, they had a nice summery feel to them even though it was winter. There are many rooms as part if the complex surrounded by nice green plants and the boats in the marina are a nice backdrop. You can walk or catch a bus down to pacific beach and it doesn't take long at all. There is a free shuttle which takes you to seaworld which is basically next door. They also have us a $20 credit to use at the hotels restuarant for us to put towards breakfast and the menu had a lot of options to choose from. The staff at check in were very helpful. There are a few buses which go to other areas, although we had a car so was easier to get around.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Gem on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: StevieD63
Reviews.Content: Three things I dread about hotels as a frequent traveller are 1) check-in, 2) check-out, and 3) the hotel restaurant. Not at The Dana. Check-in and check-out were seamless and quick, and the restaurant, Firefly, was creative and a lesson in perfect service. Special kudos to the chef who took time to come to our table and answer a question about how he prepared a fantastic panna cotta. Additionally, our room, with a spectacular view of Mission Bay, was uniquely appointed and impeccably clean. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting on our veranda with a glass of wine, watching the sailboats and plethora of wildlife go about their daily routine. Especially enjoyable is the convenience of the Activity Center, where we rented bikes to ride the 20+ miles of Bay trails and the Pacific Beach Boardwalk. They also have kayaks, sailboats, etc. -- a fantastic service! There are 2 beautiful pools with 2 accompanying hot tubs, both with very unique views. If you are looking for an experience which whisks you away from the drudgery of trains, planes and automobiles, The Dana will exceed even the loftiest of expectations.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: Best service , awesome location, amazing food. Super clean and friendly staff goes above and beyond for you every step of the way. Love love love this place and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: MonicaArr
Reviews.Content: Great view,very clean, nice pool area, staff was extremely helpful, other hotel visitors seemed as happy as my family and I were (everyone was friendly, guessing because they were relaxed and having a positive experience as well) amazing location, nice sheets-pillows-towels-robes etc., nothing unpleasant about my stay

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Victoria G
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best hotel that I have stayed in San Diego. The view was spectacular, the staff was friendly, and the room was ultra comfortable. There is nothing better than waking up in a comfortable bed and looking out into the beautiful bay. The staff in particular impressed me with their work ethic and friendly smiles. The dana forever!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, amazing staff, amazing experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here and were blown away by how nice the room alone was! We had an amazing view, and everything was spotless when we got in! We really felt like we were living the high life. On top of all that the location is great - it is easy to get around and get to major places in San Diego. The staff treated us wonderfully and helped us with all the questions we had. We ended up going kayaking, using the hotels services. We saw three seals who came right up to us! I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone, it is family friendly and a perfect place for friends to go take a trip or for couples to get away. I will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, fantastic room, can't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: AlanaS
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful, if too short, stay at the Dana on 1/10. We booked through hotels.com and got a ridiculously good rate. I was not expecting much, to be honest! Boy, were we pleasantly surprised! First, let me comment on the grounds and location. It reminded me of a tropical resort in layout -- similar to properties I have stayed at in Hawaii and the Dominican Republic. The location is perfect, quiet and on the bay, but convenient to everything San Diego has to offer. When we checked in, we were greeted warmly at the desk. We were early, so only one of our rooms was available. The clerk upgraded us to a superior room, in one of the newer buildings. It was a beautiful and exceptionally comfortable room. Tons of fluffy towels, cozy down comforter on the bed, lots of pillows. The small kitchen area was great, especially given that we had a toddler in tow. We had a lovely view of the bay from our nicely sized balcony, and we spent awhile just soaking in the sun and beautiful weather while waiting for the second room to be ready (they told us it should be ready by 4pm). We left the hotel, and came back at 4:15. The other room was not ready, but they upgraded my parents to a suite! Seriously, these people know customer service. The suite was an enlarged version of our room, with a separate living room and large patio. Very nice! Before checking out, we had breakfast at the Blue Pearl restaurant. The food was tasty, and prices were very reasonable, For a $3 fee and 18% gratuity, you can have anything off the menu delivered at regular menu prices. Fantastic room service policy. The real highlight of our trip was the customer service. My daughter left her blankie in our room. We realized our error when we were almost back to Los Angeles. I called and left a message for Ted, the person in charge of lost and found. He called me back in the morning, located the blanket, and had it in the mail to us that day. So easy, so understanding, and so kind and polite. We travel down to San Diego a few times a year, but usually try to avoid the hassle of getting a hotel by driving back the same day. The Dana is the excuse we've been looking for to extend our stays. Looking forward to visiting again in May, so we can try out the beautiful pool!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families..... walk to Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: Kazegirl
Reviews.Content: The Dana was the perfect retreat after a hectic week in Anaheim. Rooms aren't the flashes but they are clean and with a water view! Walk to Sea World and watch the fire works from your front door!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: whiteaway
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice on-site restaurant, just a shame noisy neighbour that security were unable/unwilling to deal with for first night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in San Diego EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen R
Reviews.Content: A very good friend of mine (a San Diego native) recommended that my friends and I should book our mid week vacation stay at The Dana on Mission Bay, due to it's great location. The hotels proximity to Sea World, great restaurants and shopping strip by the beach allowed my friends and I explore the beautiful city more than we thought we could. The rooms are beautifully decorated, well kept and spacious, we were lucky enough to get a room that had a nice balcony that faced the marina. I know that the next time I'm planning a trip to San Diego I'll be staying at The Dana on Mission Bay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Momcat55
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the close proximity to Sea World. The grounds were very lush and nicely landscaped. One room opened to a garden patio area; the other faced the marina across the parking lot. The rooms were a bit on the small side and somewhat dated, but still comfortable enough. Each room had a small fridge and microwave. The shuttle to Sea World was nice and saved us the parking fees, but there were only a few daily runs. I wish we had had more time to explore the place, as I enjoy landscaping and the water with all the birds, but we were too busy trying to pack in a lot of stuff. The pool looked nice, but again no time. We did have two incidents worth mentioning. One room smelled rather musty; we were given a different room. We had a problem with the Internet not working. After repeated calls to the front desk when we were told it would be fixed shortly, we finally gave up after 3 hours of empty promises. It was fixed the next day, and management did give us a partial room credit for our inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: cc1567
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to San Diego to visit some friends for a few days and needed a place to stay. A friend of ours recommended we stay at the Dana and we are very happy to have listened to her suggestion. It is such a beautiful hotel with wonderful scenery! My favorte part was the lovely view of the marina from our patio area. The room and bathroom were extremely clean and well stocked with necessities. They provided a microwave, small coffee machine, large television, alarm clock with an iPod connection, as well as Wi-Fi.The service was also great and were very helpful. I honestly have nothing bad to say about our stay at The Dana. The only thing I regret is not taking advantage of the pool and hot tub. I had a wonderful time and hope to stay there again whenever I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jdichosa
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego for 3 days, 2 nights and decided to stay at the Dana on Mission Bay because of its proximity to Sea World San Diego. It did not disappoint. We did not take advantage of all of the amenities, but will be sure to do so next time. They have two pools on site, and being the middle of winter we did not think to bring out bathing suits, but little did we know that the pool was heated and children and adults were swimming late into the evening (9pm). We also had breakfast at one of their on-site restaurants, The Blue Pearl, and were pleasantly surprised with their breakfast menu and prices. I traveled with my wife and two kids (3 years old and 4 months) and had a room with 2 queen size beds. The room was a bit small but came with everything needed (with exception of a DVD player for the 3 year old). The refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker were a pleasant surprise. We did not take advantage of the Sea World shuttle because they had three departure times and three arrival times from the hotel, none which fit in our schedule, so we decided to drive (literally a mile or so) to Sea world instead. The only draw back with this site is that parking is 18 dollars a day, but other than that the grounds are well taken care of and the location is prime.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RosebudMapleRidge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from spending two weeks at The Dana on Mission Bay. We chose this hotel because of the favourable reviews that we had read. We decided not to rent a car so we could make a concentrated effort to walk on a daily basis. The hotel is right along the beautiful marina and a launch site. The grounds themselves are immaculate and well designed. I was hard pressed to find a weed or anything out of place. The plants chosen added a tropical feel and made me think of Hawaii. We initially were placed in ground level suite in the 400 block. We found the room to be on the small side and the layout itself felt cramped and poorly designed. We were shocked to find that there was no safe even though in the literature stated that they were in all the rooms. It turns out that they no longer have safes and are not planning on any in the near future. The lady at the front desk was not even sure what was going on with that. She did offer us the use of a tiny locker behind the desk or have our valuables locked in the office. We were not happy with either choice and ended up carrying all our valuables including our passports everywhere. The other problem with the room was the noise factor. These are two story buildings and the floor between is poorly insulated. We could hear everything from the family upstairs, it was like living below a bowling alley. At one point my husband got so frustrated that he banged a couple of times on the ceiling. One minute later there was a phone call from the front desk with a noise complaint about us. We finally asked to be moved to the second floor which they kindly did. What would have happened if the hotel was full? The move made all the difference in the world and we were able to relax and enjoy ourselves. On a more positive note the beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows and the rooms themselves were very clean. The two restaurants were nice. The Blue Pearl had great breakfast food and the staff were warm and friendly. The more upscale Firefly is trying to be trendy with a higher end menu. We found the food to be very hit or miss. Some of the food was very good while other things were just plain bizarre.Overall there were better places to eat that cost less than the Firefly. I don't know if we will be back since we chose this hotel partly because it was within walking distance to SeaWorld. Sorry to say but we hated SeaWorld. We found it to be way too commercial and tacky. Other than a few exhibits it was not worth going to. I can see children liking it if they have had little exposure to animals and there are some good rides.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJC48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the newer section of the hotel in a queen/queen suites. I thought the room would be bigger, but it served the purpose. The room was clean and towels were stocked daily. Our room was close to the lobby, and pool area. It was a long walk to get breakfast however. The pool and grounds were clean. Hot tub was great. The hotel offered airport service at a charge. Check with the front desk regarding transfers they only operate at certain times. I thought the hotel was a little bit overpriced for the time that we were there (off season). Location was fine, somewhat of a walk if you wanted to go to the beach. Again, overall it was a slightly better than average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Stay on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: happyincharlietown
Reviews.Content: The Dana was less than expected for a few very good reasons. Although the location was excellent, the bay beautiful, the service, food, and amenities were lackluster. Our room was so below our expectations as we paid four star prices for nothing better than what an economy hotel would offer for half the price. Other than the heated pool and courtesy shuttle, we wished for better food, service, and a big enough room to fit both ourselves and our luggage. The restaurant service was slow and the food was bland. The breakfast was Denny's quality and the menu very limited. We ended up eating in Old Town each evening. Also, the noise level was that of college dorms late into the evening. They do not enforce quiet hours, nor do they police the grounds. We saw public drunkeness and other nonsense at night-not exactly what I would call family-friendly or romantic. It was definately econo-lodge with a view of a pretty marina. We will not be staying here again. Our extended family fared better at a three star. Dana needs new management!

Reviews.Title: “A great View and Comfy Room Near Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Garethmb
Reviews.Content: Located in beautiful San Diego, on scenic Mission Bay, the Dana Hotel is the perfect home away from home for visitors of this gorgeous city. After a whirlwind visit that contained a very hectic schedule of hotel, attractions, and convention coverage it was extremely comforting to relax and unwind in this beautiful hotel for our final night. We were very impressed with beautiful decorated lobby and the very fast check-in by the accomodating staff. Upon checking into our room we were both very happy with the very comfortable and modern decor as well as the beautiful view of the bay. The room contained all the amenities you expect in a hotel as well as free Internet, a flatscreen TV, microwave, mini fridge, and an extremely comfortable bed. Shortly after arrival we were treated to an order of cookies from one of the hotel’s restaurants which were absolutely amazing and a gracious welcome from the hotel. The Dana has a very large complex that is separated in two, one on either side of the lobby. The hotel has two pools and also has bike and watercraft rentals available. Guests may also take advantage of a nearby exercise facility for a nominal fee. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport, cruise terminal, and train station for departing and arriving guests. It is roughly a 15 min. walk to and from Sea World and there's also a shuttle available for guests. Several restaurants are within a 1 mile walking distance but guest will be happy to know that the Dana has two restaurants, the Firefly and the Blue Pearl for all of your dining needs. The Firefly is a contemporary restaurant and bar that offers cuisine unique to Southern California. Many of their menu items are designed to be shared and the amazing view only enhances an already impressive facility. The Blue Pearl is a more casual dining facility that offers breakfast lunch and dinner favorites that the whole family will enjoy. The hotel also has a reasonable room service menu with an impressive selection as well as a pool bar for guests looking for some refreshment in the sun. I wish our schedule allowed us more time to take in this wonderful facility as well as more time to sample the cuisine. The Dana also has a very nice convention facility and his popular site for weddings and receptions. The helpful staff can also arrange tours, reservations, and other necessities during your stay. Secure, private parking is available and we were able to park easily near our room which honestly resembled a condo more than it did a hotel room. From the obliging staff to the spacious and comfortable rooms, I highly recommend this beautiful facility and look forward to spending more time there on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good hotel. Nice location. Walking distance to seaworld and the beach. Even though it is located near to a main road you should not be put off as the remainder of the surrounding area is really nice and peaceful. There are a couple of pools and reataurants on site. Our room was okay though a bit cramped and the bathroom was too small. I had hoped that the style of the main building/receiption area would run through to the rooms, but this was not the case. Generally though, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angela613
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend. We initially were going to stay for one night, but switched hotels and ended up staying for 2 nights. We had booked a King Suite, but got upgraded to a 2 Queen suite overlooking the bay. The suite was *huge*, had a bedroom with 2 queen beds, a large kitchen area, and then a large living room with a gorgeous view of the bay. the Living room can be closed off from the rest of the suite with a sliding glass door. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We missed the Sea World shuttle because we couldn't find it, but the driver came back and took us anyways. it was a little noisy because there was a wedding over the weekend. Also, you enter the suite through the bedroom, and so you can hear hallway noise through that door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: choomc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over Thanksgiving week. I had read previous reviews about this hotel and knew to book a deluxe bay view room to get the best room. We were not disappointed! We stayed in the 2000 building on the second floor and had a great view of Mission Bay from our balcony. The grounds of the hotel make you feel like you are on a tropical island with all the palm trees and tropical plants. The bathroom and kitchenette have granite counters and looked very stylish. There is a safe and mini refrigerator in these rooms along with a coffeemaker. There are 2 restaurants on the property. The Firefly (closest to the main lobby and bay view rooms) does not serve breakfast. We ate dinner there our last night and the menu is not that extensive and a bit pricey. You can also eat outside by the pool if you so wish. The Blue Pearl is on the opposite end of the property from the lobby and takes about 5 mins to walk to. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. We had breakfast there each morning and were happy with the meals. You can charge your meals to your room. Parking costs $18/night but we were charged $9/night because we received a "discount." Not sure why but it was fine with us. The hotel offers a shuttle to Sea World but we could never find where the shuttle picked up in the Sea World parking lot due to lack of signage. We ended up walking both ways and it takes about 10-15 mins to arrive at Sea World's main gate. My advice when walking to Sea World...make sure you walk on the left side of the road after crossing at the light (not the black bike path) because you can cut across the parking lot and get to the gate faster. We, unfortunately, chose the bike path and had to back track to the main gate because an 8 ft. fence prohibited us from crossing into the parking lot. This made our walk to Sea World much, much longer. Tickets for Sea World and the San Diego Zoo can be purchased from the front desk at a discount. If you choose to visit the Zoo, take a brochure from the lobby and use that discounted coupon to purchase your ticket at the main gate. It turned about to be cheaper for us that way. The Zoo and Balboa Park are about a 10 minute drive from the hotel. The SD airport was about a 15 minute drive which was very nice. We would definitely stay here again if we were to return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere but the new section along the bay”
Reviews.Author: mikegodphx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again and were put in a non-water view room in the old section of the hotel. Wow, does it need some upgrading in a big way. The room smelled musty and the bathroom was horrible. The air conditioner rattled so loud that we had to turn it off just to get to sleep. They really need to shut this part of the hotel down and rebuild all the rooms. They need to be less dark and dingy on the inside. The place is in San Diego and it felt so depressing to be in the room. I have stayed here several times but always in the newer bayside area and I did not know how bad the rest of the hotel was. It is a shame that one half is so nice and the other is so terrible. Make sure that when you book you are getting a room in the new section. As always, this place is in a great location right by Sea World and up the street from Mission Beach. I think if they can just improve the 2/3 of the facility that is run down so you do not have to play roulette trying to get a sopt in the new section we would stay here more, however we have moved our regular spot to the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge right on the beach and ten minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but look out for upgrades”
Reviews.Author: LAtogo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful compound, wonderful service. Only complaint is I was "upgraded" from a marina view to a bay view...of the public bathrooms/homeless persons camp. Luckily I was too busy to spend much time out on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ryan c
Reviews.Content: We booked a marina view room at The Dana in early June. After an early morning drive from the Phoenix area, we arrived in San Diego to a traffic nightmare. A marathon was occuring right in the area of the hotel! After 1.5 hours on the freeway wihin 500 yards of our exit we made it to the beutiful grounds of The Dana. We were hoping they had a room available for early check-in and the girl at the counter did'nt dissapoint. We were given a secong floor marina view room in the original section of the hotel. The rooms are very small when configured with two beds like ours was. But we knew we would be out playing in the great San Diego weather and did'nt let it bother us. The room was clean, well kept, updated and cozy. The beds were very comfortable .This hotel property is one of the best locations in all of San Diego. The Dana is directly across the street from Sea World, and easily walkable with kids. You are also right near freeway interchanges which makes getting to other areas incredibly easy. Mission beach is located right down the street, and their are plenty of good places to eat nearby. Our experience here was great and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tomishy
Reviews.Content: Nov 1, 2011 saw us spending two nights at the dana - we arrived there after a 17hr flight and 3 hr drive. 1. The room was ok but there was no milk - this isnt provided, 2 tea bags and 1 coffee and 2 cups even though our room was booked for four people. We were told to try the restaurants for some milk. 2. No where was it advertised that you will be charged for parking and this cost was $18/dayor was i informed upon check in. 3. We inadvertently left our aussie adaptor plugged into the kitchenette with an iphone plug and this was taken as when the hotel was rung a few hours later they informed me it was not found by cleaners and the room could not be checked until the following tuesday. It was the following friday night that they rang me and said it could not be found. 4. The door to the bathroom fell off the top hinge after the first 24hrs it wasnt able to close properly. Overall, our stay here was disappointing :( Out of everywhere we stayed this was the worst and it wasnt even that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rh-chi
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a 4-day summer vacation, and we loved it. The location was great: right on the bay and close to all the sights we visited. The price was great compared to other hotels in the area. The room was also big enough for 5 of us to stay in (2 kids). The on-site restaurant was mediocre. The fresh seafood at the boathouse across the street was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Comprehensive Review and Guide to the Dana”
Reviews.Author: Brice L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our 10 year anniversary at The Dana on Mission Bay. I want to review the hotel based on my experience trying to pick the hotel for our trip. I think this will help those of you looking at this hotel, but not sure if the rooms are nice or if you should up grade or not. ROOMS The Dana can be broken down into two parts: The older section and the newer section. As you may have noticed, many people love the newer section. I decided to take a chance and stay in the older section (even though many people said it was terrible). We stayed in the Marina Bay rooms, although ALL the standard rooms would be the same (you just would not have the same view). Despite what people have said, these rooms are EXACTLY as pictured. They were small, but very well kept and clean. I would not hesitate to stay in them again. Don't be afraid to get the standard rooms, unless space is an issue. If you want lots of room, then go with the deluxe rooms. Since we were gone all day anyways, the room was not an issue for us. HOTEL The hotel itself was beautiful. It had two good size pools and hot tubs. We found it very enjoyable to walk around the hotel grounds during the evening. It is also a 15 minute walk to Sea World, which was awesome. The entire staff was great to work with. The Blue pearl restaurant was very reasonable and had great food (we ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner, each one time). Overall, the hotel was perfect. Just what we wanted. Some have mentioned that the hotel walls are very thin and you can hear everything. I had not such experience. I heard the other people's door shutting, but that was it. It is a HOTEL, not a single family home. Not sure what some people expect.... Wi-Fi is free and easy to access. It is great to check e-mail and other quick things, but not much else. I assume they keep slower for a reason. Extra Charges / fees Some things to note: -They charge 9 dollars per person to use their shuttle from the airport. If you have a group of 3 or more, it would be cheaper to just take a taxi. Plus, since the taxis are right at the air port, and you don't have to wait for them, you would get their faster. My wife and I had a real problem with this. I think a small charge is reasonable, but 18 to get us to THEIR hotel was pretty ridiculous. Most hotels don't do that (atleast the ones I stayed at) -They also charge 20 dollars a night to park. There are other parking lots/streets around, but I am not sure if I would trust them (especially since we had a rental). Our first two nights we did not have a car. Then we got a car the last two nights we were there. Not sure how, but they did not charge us for parking. Not sure if they just missed it or what. I was kind of glad since I think that is pretty ridiculous. Food If you want to save money on buying food, there is a small bait shop / fishing store right by the hotel. They have sandwiches, chips, cereal, etc. It is a little bit pricey. Your best bet is a target store about 1.5 miles up the road. Easy to get too and can save you some money. Within 3-4 miles you have just about ANY restaurant you would want. Transportation As people have stated, there is a public transportation bus stop right in front of the hotel. We found that very useful to get to old town. It is only a ten minute right straight to the hub and old town is right across the train tracks. I had originally planned using the bus to get to other locations like the LDS temple, USS Midway, and Zoo. However, I found it would have taken 1-2 hours EACH WAY using the bus. That is assuming you get off at the right spot. Since I did not know much about San Diego, I decided not to use the bus to go very far. As stated it will take you anywhere, but I think it takes more time than it is worth. It cost less than 50 dollars for a rental car for 2 days. Well worth, since we drove to Universal Studios our last day their. My overall impressions are good. The hotel itself is fantastic and exactly as pictured on their website. Don't be afraid to stay in the standard rooms, as long as you don't want lots of room. Try and avoid the extra fees of the shuttle and parking if you can. If you are going to sea world, don't rent a car that day. It can save you on parking. You will enjoy your stay at the Dana. We plan on taking the kids to Sea world next year, and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: patsy324
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite places to visit in the States is San Diego. Over the years we have stayed at various locations in San Diego. This year we stayed at the Dana. Are we ever glad we did. Great location, great amenities and great staff. Loved being on the Bay - so relaxing and peaceful - especially after a busy day at Sea World, the zoo, etc. This will be our choice from now on when we come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Annual Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chris d
Reviews.Content: For the past 30 years, my wife and I have spent at least one week a year in San Diego. And probably for the past 20 years we've stayed at The Dana. It has a very relaxed and secluded feel about it while still being only a short distance from all of the area's major attractions. For me, it's Mission Beach being only a few blocks away that counts. The complex is beautifully kept, the rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished and the staff is always friendly and helpful. And with the hotel management so eager to make sure we're happy with our stays, we'll continue to make this an annual destination. Thank you Jennifer!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: scrappintam
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from an absolutely amazing 4 night stay at the Dana! To begin with, we were blessed with an outstanding rate from Jennifer Kietzke for a deluxe room with a beautiful view of Mission Bay. Our room had two queen bed, a pullout couch, small table and 2 chairs, as well as small fridge, micro and sink. The bathroom was very nice, with plenty of counter space as well as a lighted make up mirror. Little details, like two robes and swim towels folded on the bed each day were impressive. The view from our room was spectacular, with a large sliding door leading out onto our own balcony with several chairs, overlooking Mission Bay and the marina. We enjoyed watching the 7 and 9 person kayaks early in the morning out on the bay. The resort has two heated pools, one with a small sand area, complete with sand toys for the kids. Although the weather was cool during our stay, our kids still enjoyedswimming each evening and building sandcastles on the "beach". Everyone we encountered at the resort went above and beyond to make our stay one to remember! There are two restaurants onsite, but we only ate at one of them; The Blue Pearl, where we had breakfast twice and ordered carryout pizza once. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the service was incredibly fast! Our first morning there, we informed our waiter we were hoping to catch the resort shuttle to Sea World, so he put a rush on our meal. We couldn't believe it when breakfast for 5 showed up in less than 5 minutes!! NEVER have we had such quick service in a restaurant!! And this waiter was the most cordial man ever! Unfortunately, I didn't get his name. Although we had a little trouble getting to the resort on our first attempt, it truly is right across the road from Sea World's parking lot. We'd stay there again, in a heartbeat, and recommend it to anyone! With great staff like Jennifer and the Blue Pearl waiter, I have no doubt you'll be treated well!!

Reviews.Title: “Make your own vacation....it's all about the view and location”
Reviews.Author: BKDKC
Reviews.Content: After traveling almost all of my life as a flight attendant, I've found that you have to make your own vacation....the room is for recharging and getting ready for another day! The Dana's employees, rooms, location, and views were perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiece”
Reviews.Author: eglide00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana for eight days. I enjoyed every day of my stay. I was in room 819, which overlooked the bay with the myriads of boats, birds,blue water and the lovely clouds. I will try to go in details now: The bathroom was small but clean, it had plenty of towels and high quality soaps. However, it was not like a Mariott bathroom. Excellent coffee! Wolgang Puck brand, I loved it. I'd brew the coffee each morning and enjoy it. I would sip my coffee and visit Dana landing, just a small walk, where I'd order an egg/cheese sandwich and watch the gorgeous bay. By the way the sandwich was only 3.99. I also got my beer from the Dana landing . Dana Landing also rents all kinds of sea sports/ fishing goods. It also has a good deli and cold cuts department. Fresh! You could rent a bike and ride it for miles on the beautiful bay, or rent a boat at Paradise point. The room was not grand. It was more like a Days Inn kind but the bed was excellent and the furnishings good . TV was a flat panel. Staff was very friendly. The lawns were manicured. I enjoyed the foliage. The high point was the FireFly cafe. You must at least go there once and try the chowder. I loved the chowder so much that I ate it every day. It is a better chowder than you can get in San Francisco. It was the location. Heaven on earth! Will go there again. It is great for families with young kids who want to visit the Balboa park, Zoo and the Sea World. Location, Location, Location. Free shuttles to Sea World . Taxi is $20 to airport. Shuttle is $9. M Khan

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chirs284
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, was greeted by staff member who was very friendly, we have originally booked a room without view that was located by the café but my girlfriend wanted a view by the marina, the staff member said their was a room available and without any hesitation upgraded our room without charging extra and she also did not charge us 18 dollars day for parking the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jonsey112
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, location great everything else terrible. vending machines didn't work, room was dirty, only two buildings have bay views the rest are parking lots and even when you request a bay room that doesn't mean they will accommodate.. loud, can hear your neighbors like they are in your room. Renting bikes is so expensive considering they offer for half price across the road. Take it from other not so wonderful reviews...besides the nice staff and the nice location its not worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Bayside sweet surprise”
Reviews.Author: PriyankaG
Reviews.Content: This place is in a very good location. near the sea world and the beach, away from the down town hustles, quiet and well maintained premises. I have to specially commend on the restaurants they have, the breakfast place for awesome( try getting the complimentary breakfast deal, it's worth the effort), and the firefly( an ideal dinner place by the pool when you are too tired to go out). The rooms were in good shape, nothing special , cleaned everyday and there was a nice flatron tv where you can directly add movies and watch immediately using the hotel intranet.The movie bill gets added towards you hotel bill. There are various onsite activities like volleyball, and table tennis and water sports and cycling.Not to forget the jaccuzis and pools open 24 hrs. There is also a free shuttle to the seaworld and lots of other pamphlets and deals available at the reception.All in all a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: TheCkings2005
Reviews.Content: For $200 a night, we expected a room that didn't have a window air conditioner that tripped the breaker every few seconds. Our first room stayed about 80 degrees so we moved to another room. This room at least had a working window unit but took several hours to cool down (and remove the musty warm smell). Dinner at Blue Pearl was pretty nice, breakfast (after the SeaWorld rush) took about an hour and a half to two hours. They were very sorry though. Definitely not worth the money overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gennie L
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in September. We loved it! We will definatly be going back. With 2 young children the shuttle to SeaWorld was great and the hotel was only a 10 min walk to SeaWorld if you didn't want to take the shuttle. Also the staff was very nice and helpful and the grounds of the hotel where beautiful. We ate at the Blue Pearl everyday of our stay and loved the food and the prices were very reasonable. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay...as long as it's a Deluxe Room”
Reviews.Author: DEK2000
Reviews.Content: A word of advice if you are booking rooms at this property...make sure you understand just exactly what you are getting. By this I mean that there are Standard rooms and there are Deluxe rooms and the difference between the two is night and day. I know this only because I stayed here three nights recently with several other families. My family was "upgraded" to a deluxe room simply because we needed the pullout couch for sleeping. The other families were put in the standard rooms. Note: these rooms were booked through Disney as part of a vacation package. Shame on Disney for putting people in the standard rooms. The pictures on the website are misleading and even the pictures of the standard rooms make them look much nicer than they actually are. Since I stayed in the Deluxe room, I'll base my stay off that, but I'd like to give a brief review of both. Standard Rooms: This part of the complex looks like it was built in the 1970's as the buildings look dated and the rooms do as well. The two standard rooms I went in both had a terrible musty smell and they are much smaller than the deluxe rooms. The carpets were stained and had numerous ripples in them. I was hesitant to even let my kids sit on the floor since they looked so dirty. The only thing that looked updated in the entire room was an LG flatscreen TV. One person demonstrated the large gap under the entry door by pushing a roughly one-quarter inch thick stick under the door! Everything down to the quality of sheets was even different than what is in the deluxe rooms. My only other comment on this area was would have to be the rat trap that was visible under one of the stairwells. Deluxe Rooms: These rooms are obviously in a newer area of the complex. The rooms are large and feature a small kitchenette area with a small sink, microwave and fridge. Everything appears to be updated. Our room featured two queen beds and a small sofa that was a pullout. The room we stayed in backed up to a large park area, which didn't really allow for much privacy for sitting on the patio area. There were large groups of people either picnicking or playing soccer directly outside our back door. Room service was great and they left lots of towels, including towels for the pool. The complex does have two outdoor pools that are nice. There is also a restaurant near the lobby that always appeared busy. I did not eat there, but it looked somewhat upscale. I did read comments about high fees for parking vehicles, but we were not charged to park our two vehicles. We were also given an access code for free internet access. I was unable to access using my wifi, but was able when I hooked up the supplied ethernet cable. Overall, I did enjoy my stay, but if I would have been stuck in a standard room, my rating would have been much lower. I did hear one other family in the lobby complaining about the standard room they were put in. I heard the guy saying the room looked nothing like the pictures on the website and all the lady at the front desk kept telling him was there was nothing she could do because he booked through a third party internet service. I'm guessing this is a common complaint from guests and it's somewhat deceiving by this hotel. For the extra fifty-dollars a night, pony up and get the Deluxe room

Reviews.Title: “serene yet kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: mytimemama
Reviews.Content: We went to the Dana in july 2011. Being by the bay was so peaceful! We are from the east coast so when my little ones would rise rather early we would walk the boardwalk there. Rooms were clean and the pools were great! They also have bike/kayak rentals on site. Free shuttle to sea world and you can see the fireworks at night. Central location. You do get whacked with a $20 parking fee per nite! - the only negative

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...roach.”
Reviews.Author: LiliyG
Reviews.Content: We were there last weekend for the San Diego Bay Fair Boat Races (Go Crackers!) and we needed rooms for Friday and Saturday night. At $189 on hotels.com I expected a more upscale environment. The locatoin is great but the hotel is old and it shows it. Patched holes on the doors and worn carpets are dead give-aways. The dinner house was fantastic ($$$) and I highly reccomend the martinis. A midnight visit to the restroom had me face to face with Mr. Cucaracha and even though he was small, a roach is a raoch is a raoch. Our friends stayed at the Bay Inn ($89) across the way, the only thing they had to run from were the strippers at the club across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: OregonWheels
Reviews.Content: We were receltnly at The Dana for a 3 day stay, which just happened to coincide with the unprecidented blackout in multiple States including southern California. Forst, we arrived and our roopm was waiting for us. Now... if you need wheelchair access a standard room is NOT for you. Very cramped and small with no maneuverability. After rearranging the furnature we made it work. We had a pool side room... awesome! Small private patio with a gate directly to the pool. Each night at the pool the Hotel was showing a Disney Movie. Rooms were very clean and anything you needed the staff delivered in record time! During the blackout there was no food anywhere because stores had no way to sell the food. The Dana pulled out mac and cheese, pasts dishes, fresh fruit, drinks, veggies, and anything else they could manage to put together and serve for free to those staying at their facility. It was served at no cost. In addition, once it got dark they had countless employees wandering the grounds with flashlights helping escort people from place to place, and get settled in their rooms. I was very impressed with the service! As a result of the inconvenience from the blackout, the hotel waived the parking fees for our stay. The drawback... the Dana has limited handicap parking. In fact they have a serious parking shortage. Pool is a little cool and could be warmed up a bit. Positives... pretty much everything!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Setting, excellent location to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: ccrawf8749
Reviews.Content: The Dana Mission Beach is HUGE. Big deal for families because of the location to Sea World and Mission Bay. Located right on Mission Beach, you can watch boats going by, people riding bikes, jogging, walking their dogs. They have rentals available on property. The grounds are very tropical. Firefly restaurant for dinner very good. More adult than kids. Our waiter, John was excellent, he knew the menu and was right on with his suggestions. Blue Pearl restaurant more for families, loud, kids running around, screaming. The Dana has a shuttle that takes you to Sea World and will pick you up. Suggest paying more for an ocean view room, less likely there won't be a lot of children. Great Place. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: SteveGriff123
Reviews.Content: Were back at the Dana over Labor Day Weekend. Fantastic 3rd floor room with a fantastic Bay view. Wonderful staff, clean rooms. Can't say enough about the guys at the Water Sport Rental. Our family really loves to spend the day on the Bay. We have enjoyed The Dana for several years now. Looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Playing house on mission bay..”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBird
Reviews.Content: Very large, comfy room steps to mission bay. Nice bathroom, updated fixtures, small kitchette with microwave, small fridge, stocked cabinets had plates, bowls & utensils. Bedding was very nice, used pool towls were left on patio (possibly from a neighbor as everything else was very nice & clean) Did not use pools or spa areas, but they looked nice and are open till 11pm. Parking is limited and filled up quickly. The room overall was impressive in size, my opinion, one of the largest standard rooms on the water. Beautiful location on the bay with grassy park setting & gorgeous views of sailboats, jet skiers and sunset. It was had a wonderful home feel with shutters, sofa seating area, small table & chairs and hd tv. Check in felt a bit rushed even though I was the only guest in the lobby. Great value for family, friends & locals..

Reviews.Title: “beautiful bay!”
Reviews.Author: US9
Reviews.Content: Walked across the street to bay docks, after walking along bay same side as hotel! rooms are not bran new, but all amenities are up to date and clean! Close to Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: mommalina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newer section and it was great! I reserved a King and they upgraded us to a two queen suite right by the bay. It was beautiful. Beds and pillows were OK. There were small sugar ants in the bed nearest the window. Pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: sfimple89
Reviews.Content: Stayed in here in august right on the bay where there are also boat and kayak rentals. We had a suite with a balcony and the view was amazing. Would go here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great location. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: petesmom1
Reviews.Content: Just spent labor day wknd here. Stayed in newer section of hotel. Had bay view suite. Spacious two room. 2 queen beds in one room. Couch, tv, table in other. Large corner patio. Small frig, coffee maker, counter space. Nice shower tub etc. Great value for money. Kids enjoyed pool. We did not eat at the grill by the pool as there was a wedding reception going on. Didn't bother us. Ate in nearby little Italy that night. Used shuttle to go to sea world. Rented jet skis from marina just steps in front of hotel. Overall a fantastic experience. My kids didn't miss the waterside at the hyatt one bit. Recommend room in newer section. Older section looked smaller, older and closervtogether.

Reviews.Title: “great service great family time,we'll be back soon”
Reviews.Author: lak721
Reviews.Content: great accommodation's,with pool and room keeps the kids very bussy,food service by the pool and in the restaurant very good and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Kcindy2000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Dana. The shuttle the hotel sent to pick us up at the airport arrived quickly after we notified them of our arrival, the room was beautiful even though we chose the non-view option with our package, and the on-site restaurant The Blue Pearl was great!

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is an excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tipsythom
