Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: fashiond81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled to San Diego to see a reggae concert at The Wave House. We went in late August and the weather was just fantastic. We stumble upon The Dana b/c we got a discount seeing as the concert was associated with The Wave House. When we arrived we had thought the transfer to/from the airport was included but it was not...no biggy , I think we were charged $15 each way? Please note that there are 2 sections to this hotel, a newer one and an older one. Both sections were neat, clean, and comfortable. The hotels is approx. 1 mile to the beach, we did not rent a car and walked it everyday, otherwise a cab will cost about $7. The transportation system in San Diego is very user friendly and we used it to go to the Gas Lamp District. The hotel had kayaks, and other equipment for rent at a reasonable price, we took the kayaks out and cruised around the bay. Also the restaurant at the hotel (the blue oyster maybe) had good food, friendly service. If you had any questions about travel and things to do do not hesitate to ask the concierge - she was wonderful, and knew everything about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 3-Star Hotel but felt like 5-Stars”
Reviews.Author: Marites8
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Diego, choose The Dana based on the reviews shown here at Trip Advisor (was in SD from Feb 11 to Feb 14). No regrets but the rooms whether you choose the non-view or courtyard were average. They both needed upgrading. Upside - beds very comfortable, it was great to have a microwave and refrigerator, spacious rooms, 2 huge, heated and clean pools (great for kids), $16 parking fee but it was good for us as our rental car from Enterprise for only $18. Downside, TV remote was useless, very limited TV channels, walls too thin so expect to hear every sounds (banging doors, arguments, loud noises). The property is near the marina so excellent for families to rent bicycles and boats and go for rides during the day. Only a 15-minute walk to SeaWorld and we did walk it both ways. It was a nice, safe leisurely walk, don't have to pay parking at SeaWorld or use the hotel's limited shuttle service. The Dana was very close to most amenities ie. major attractions, grocery stores, pharmacy, mall, beaches. Yes we will return to The Dana with no hesitation. The hotel was 3-star hotel but because the customer service was excellent it felt like a 5-star hotel to us. Staff were friendly, accommodating, understanding, speedy, efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: gardnerchuck
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! Cant say enough about the staff. Smiles all around. The location next to the water is great. Easy access to Mission Beach and Sea world. Clean all over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place unless you want to be connected”
Reviews.Author: tbrooksher
Reviews.Content: We just finished staying at the Dana for four nights. It's a nice hotel, very friendly staff, good restaurant, overall a very good experience EXCEPT there's virtually no AT&T cellphone coverage--regular or 3G, and virtually no Verizon wireless data coverage. They have wireless internet but charge handsomely for it. So if you're looking for a place to get away, this is the place. If you need to be connected, you'll be very frustrated.

Reviews.Title: “A nice break at Chrismas”
Reviews.Author: asfarasicango
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana on 12/23 and had a n enjoyable time. The pool was heated, the food was good and we got a great package called What Ales you.

Reviews.Title: “The Quiet Giant”
Reviews.Author: droid10
Reviews.Content: From the moment I made my reservation, the staff was perfect, response via email was perfect, check-in was on time, the room was beautiful, as was the view, it was very quiet and the location is the best.....many attractions nearby, close to freeways (without the noise!) and good restaurants on and off property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, attractive hotel, good all-around-value.”
Reviews.Author: agkhayyam
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here while attending a social dance event in the conference center on Mission Bay, just a ten-minute walk away. We stayed in the "Water's Edge" building in a Deluxe Premium Bay view room on the first floor, and we were both very happy with it. The restaurant on the grounds is excellent, we both enjoyed our meals. The pool and hottub looked quite nice, but we didn't use them. The downsides (all minor) - There is a public path that goes between the Water's Edge rooms and the waterfront. Not a problem, but something to be aware of. The room does not have a stocked mini-fridge - they had not promised or indicated that there would be one, but it is something that I enjoy having available. There is a vending machine near the rooms, however. Lastly, as is unfortunately the case with many hotels, the Dana charges for wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, if a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bbdayday
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice weekend getaway to San Diego from Los Angeles with my wife. We stayed at the Dana on Mission Bay and enjoyed ourselves very much. We had a bay view deluxe room. The room was quite spacious and attractive, and the view was beautiful. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was very good, with everything we wanted to visit being within 15 minutes driving distance. Pool and Jacuzzi were quite lovely. Only complaint is that the walls were a bit thin and noise was an issue with some late-returning neighbors and one that snored very loudly. But, other than that, it was very nice and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hahenkka
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon The Dana hotel on mission bay, and it was just exellent two weeks. the Staff was very nice and helpfull when needed. Our room was with Bay wiew and the wiew was perfect.Also our room was clean. Location was very good, walking distance to beaches and Sea World and easy to get the highways. Definetely going back to San Diego and US- some day. Winter Greetings from Finland! Henri.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a gorgeous water view!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love_2_Travel1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Mission Bay, close to beaches, night life and great restaurants. Our room overlooked the bayside where we woke up with coffee on our balcony. We loved our stay and would reccomned this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking !!!”
Reviews.Author: CLEMAUD
Reviews.Content: We have booked with expedia 2 rooms with view but when we are arrived, the rooms with view were full !! then, they would like to give us rooms without view for the same price !!! Not communication with the employies, they told us for a free night and when we cheek out, they didn't accept what they said one day before... not writing !!! they lie... Then, do very becareful with the staff Advive: Please, do write what they promise !!!

Reviews.Title: “fun holiday night”
Reviews.Author: timsd
Reviews.Content: We had our holiday party at the Dana. The ballroom and food were nice. We stayed the night after a good bit of celebrating. We stayed in the white tower, ( I believe the newer part of the Hotel) The room was wonderful. In the morning we awoke to a beautiful view of the bay. We had coffee on the balcony and enjoyed a peaceful morning sans kids. Much nicer than being in the multi story downtown hotels. Would highly recommend the property to anyone visiting San Diego or natives that just need a night away.

Reviews.Title: “THE Park and Cruise Choice for Long Cruises & SeaWorld combination.”
Reviews.Author: bfrazier
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent park and cruise deal here - with a fantastic 5 star room. Here's what we did: we reserved one of the newer rooms in the buildings called "Bayside". It came with free shuttle to and from the cruise ports and FREE parking for the duration of our 12 day cruise. The Dana at Mission Bay is adjacent to Sea World and a 15 minute shuttle ride to the cruise terminal, but most hotels near the ports either jack up the price of a park and cruise or start charging your parking after 7 days, and they mostly have poor reviews and shoddy rooms for the price. If you were to need a day or two at SeaWorld before or after your longer cruise this would absolutely be the perfect choice - and Mom's and Dad's will feel like heroes for this selection if this is the situation you are in. In our situation the cost of parking nearer to the cruise terminal for our 12 day cruise would nearly pay for the room. If your cruise is short, or you flew in, there is that much less incentive to stay here. It might still be my choice if I flew in because the shuttle does the airport, the cruise terminal and Seaworld. We read all the reviews - they are so mixed I was sort of worried, but here's exactly what you need to know. Older rooms are rooms 101 to 829 - we didn't see any of them but understand they are older but remodeled. For under 100 dollars I'd guess they may be just fine, most overlook a parking lot and will feel much more like any older motel. The new very nice rooms are in two adjacent curved buildings, each 3 floors tall. Again, they call these "Bayside".The first building (rooms 1100-1320 are more pointed towards a park with the bay being to the left and beyond that, a distant overpass. I would probably avoid these rooms as well. The second new building (rooms 2100 to 2320) are where you want to be, and I'd especially request a third story room as they overlook a lovely bay. The room number would then start with 23XX (second building third floor) The first floor does not have private balconies, but the second and third floors do. There is a nice elevator. The rooms are exquisite, really they are, and along the lines of any 5 star resort. You can read about all the amenities at their web site but we didn't really use any of them. I feel certain that cars are safe here - hotel parking is gated but the long term is not, still, it's location makes it seem safe. People were friendly, the shuttle clean, the directions clear, the lobby beautiful, the room exquisite, and I got the free parking in writing due to some other reviews here but it was never questioned. No bad surprises - and isn't that what you love about TripAdvisor?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: CDOTR
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Dana for just two nights. We booked this hotel after a recommendation of a family member. The hotel was quite nice, we had a Bay View Room with a King sized bed in the newer buildings. The property was nicely situated near Sea World, and was fairly quiet. My complaints: - The staff could have been a bit more friendly, in particular front desk staff. They were ok to deal with. - The carpet in our room needed to be stretched as there were some wrinkles in it. - Very early in the morning city/park staff were using ride-on lawn mowers to cut the grass in a park that is off-property. Nothing staff could do, it was a slight annoyance, but a necessary evil. I would have hoped that the city/park staff would have realized they were 50-100 ft from a hotel with guests who may have been resting. Beyond these items I thought the hotel was quite nice and would most likely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great room Great price”
Reviews.Author: DebCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the older section but the rooms were wonderful. nice decor, good size room, plenty for 4 people. sink outside bathroom. clean room, comfortable beds, fluffy towels, everyone very pleasant. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana did not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: sully1971
Reviews.Content: The Dana is one of the nicer hotels that I have stayed in and I have travelled extensively. I think it is due to the portion of the hotel we stayed, which was the newer section and had ocean view. It was clean, crisp and full of great ammenities. The pool, spa and Firefly bar and rest were awesome....the older section did not look as appealing, but I heard it was fine. Staff is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Really loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Helenabombana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days after spending five nights in downtown San Diego. It was a beautiful spot to stay, very peaceful and we really enjoyed it. We stayed in the new wing, the room was big and we had a balcony with a beautiful view of the bay. We booked the new wing as we wanted a water view and I would definitely recommend that people do that. The Firefly restaurant was amazing. The food is fantastic and it was almost empty, we ate in there every night. For a hotel restaurant it was very unexpected and very enjoyable, they have a great wine list too.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Look Like The Pictures and Needs to be Remodeled and Management”
Reviews.Author: MarcyTexas
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed. The hotel looks and smells old and does not come close to looking like the pictures posted here or perhaps it looked like that once upon a time. The location is great but this place is in need of a makeover. We had to wait five minutes with water running to get hot water and then it only lasted a few minutes before it turned cold. Too bad for the second person. Towels were scratchy and used looking. Noisy a/c units too but I like a motor running when I sleep so it did not bother me at all. We were weary from a long drive and hungry but refused to eat at the Blue Pearl once we strolled over for dinner. It was very old, run down and gross. Decided not to eat there and chance the pizza to go. The pizza was made with fake cheese, was greasy, too thick and left the two of us with the worst stomach cramps and diarreah, one toilet and a six hour business meeting to be to by 8 am where we had hoped to be our best.= Your Worst Nightmare! P.S. Walked the grounds three times with map and never could find that fitness room. Gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: the_beach_911
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana in the middle of September for a week. We had a great time and did not have to leave property to have fun. We rented bikes on one day from their rental shop and rode around the bay. I wish they had segways! They have two pools, but we only used the jacuzzis. We had breakfast at the Black Pearl a couple times and it was really good! Try the Dana omelet! We had drinks and dinner once at the Firefly and the food was superb- the ceviche is amazing. They even had a drink that tastes like a creamsicle! We also used the complimentary shuttle to sea world which saved us a parking fee over there (the Dana does charge for parking, but it's pretty much standard now all over the city, even here in LA). We stayed in a bay view room and it was spacious and appointed well. Great view from the room! Overall we had a great stay, the staff was friendly and willing to help. The housekeepers did a great job cleaning the room every day. We will definitely return! I wish I could escape the LA smog every other week!

Reviews.Title: “Gross. What is that on the bed?”
Reviews.Author: FF6699
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it said the rooms had been renovated. Well I guess not all of the rooms had been renovated because ours was digusting. We booked a Marina View room with a king size bed. The room smelled like a wet dog. Rolled off the comforter to find something disgusting on the bed sheets. The imprint of a body of the previous user was still on the sheets along with some peeled dry skin pieces. We immediately asked for a different room. They moved us to a smaller room with 2 queen beds. The comforters in this room had white stains all over them. It was an uncomfortable night to say the least. They did not offer us any discount or anything. Glad we only stayed one night.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dipaulino
Reviews.Content: The Dana is my #1 choice in San Diego! This is our second there. My son lives in San Diego, and I always stay at the Dana when visiting him (I'd much rather get a room than stay at the "Bachelor Pad", then all I would do is clean for them!) The staff is awesome, just love those guys! They are very accomendating in every aspect! It's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cocoquiles
Reviews.Content: Rooms are newly renovated. Great grounds, activities for family, friendly and knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff- Beautiful View-Friendly and clean...Better than Bahia.”
Reviews.Author: DANALOVER
Reviews.Content: This Resort is paradice. The view is great. You can basicly walk out your door and touch the bay on the view suites. At night you can see the Seaworld Fireworks. Shuttle Service to and from the Airport and To seaworld and Padres. Overall Great stay cant wait to come back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but rooms need updated.”
Reviews.Author: redrdr
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay is in a nice location. Great views of the bay, close to Sea World, downtown SD, and the beach. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and the service was great! The only thing is that the rooms need to be updated. You can tell that the hotel has been there for a long time and the rooms need a make over. There is not much space to move around in the room as the furniture is too big. You are definitely paying for the location and views and not the rooms. Overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: toykar
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and sometimes we enjoy an over night stay on the beautiful San Diego Bay. We have stayed at this resort a few years ago but they now have new rooms overlooking the bay. Do stay in the Premium Bayside Rooms. A very large room with a pull out couch, desk, flat screen TV and most of all a large granite tile bathroom. The room also had a microwave, small refrigerator and a wet bar. We especially loved the comfort of the pillowtop kingsized bed, that we ordered one from Sears when we got home. Since we live in San Diego, we were able to bring our boat and they had a guest slip for us. We ate at the Blue Pearl most of the time and enjoyed the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Rooms, but very crowded.”
Reviews.Author: kdblev
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newer park view suites. Room was quite large and very nice. We had 5 of us in the room, so had to use the sofa bed, and it was decent enough for the week stay. Bathroom was well appointed and large. The main beds were very nice and had nice linens. A few dishes were provided in the kitchenette. The service in the room was wonderful. Our maid went above and beyone to make sure our room was nice each day. Even arranged some of the kids dolls on the pillows each day. We she noticed we had been saving napkins from eating out, she left us a roll of paper towels. A nice touch that many hotel staff would not have bothered with. However, the hotel is quite busy. Parking is always just at capacity in the evenings. They hosted 2 weddings while we were there and that really makes it hard to check in and get around the property. It was still worth it, but be warned that the park adjacent to the hotel is used for all sorts of gatherings and there are lots of people out there at all times of day. The outdoor pool was quite frigid although it was advertised as heated.

Reviews.Title: “More Like a Motel”
Reviews.Author: eternitey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a wedding we were attending. The hotel is in a great location! Close to shopping, restaurants and right on the marina. The room we stayed in was nothing special, was more like a motel and very cheap looking. Bathroom was dirty and has missing tiles. There are lots of hotels in this area. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There are two parts to this motel/hotel”
Reviews.Author: dennyjo
Reviews.Content: Trust me, what you see online is NOT what you get. This property REALLY needs to tell prospective guests that there are two sections of this establishment, the motel side and the hotel side. The motel side is called Marina Cove. It is VERY old, run down, dumpy and about the size of my closet. It has an a/c unit stuck in the wall and smells so incredibly musty that everything you own will need to be aired out. This is where we were orginally placed(TRUST ME...the online pictures are not what you get and the price is SO NOT WORTH IT). There was NO way I was going to stay here with my kids, and asked the front desk if we could get out of our reservation. This is where this place excels. Their customer service is OUTSTANDING. The woman at the front desk immediatly apologized and asked if she could move us to the newer part of the property at a discounted price(to upgrade it was only $30 a night instead of $60...still...I shouldn't of paid what I did in the first place). The newer part of the property is the Water's Edge. These are actual hotel rooms that are sized the way a room should be sized and even had a patio. MUCH NICER. Bottom line, the outstanding customer service is still not enough for me to ever stay here again. Overall, the property is dumpy and dirty. The location is great, but I would shop around before I booked a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view - Affordable Price - Excellent Staff - Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: hkempston
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location, beautiful view, and decent price then you've found the right place. The Dana is a fabulous vacation spot. I've stayed there during 2 different vacations now and had a wonderful experience each time. I would recommend The Dana hands down over any other hotel in San Diego!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to enjoy San Diego weather.”
Reviews.Author: LangleyRVers
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in a Bay View room with an excellent view of the Bay and Marina. Clean rooms, friendly staff, nice pool. Concierge staff very helpfull with sightseeing options and information. The Blue Pearl Resturant waiters and chefs very nice even when we "shared" menu items. We will reccommend the Dana and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “For the past eight years this is our home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: tipsythom
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the clean, beautiful rooms. The view of the bay is spectacular. Our kids love the ping pong table, and the pool area. My husband and I enjoy cocktails at the Firefly restaurant. Every weekend we are there and the facilty hosts a wedding which says alot about the hotel and its amenities. Its quiet, close to the beach and Sea world, have a wonderful walking trail around the bay, and has bike and water toy rentals for an extra value. The price has always been right and we have truly enjoyed our stay. we have returned eight years in a row and will continue to only stay at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “very wonderful hotel, don'y plan on staying at any other wheni revisit san diego”
Reviews.Author: jaredm62
Reviews.Content: my spouse and i visit san diego maybe three to four times a year and this has by far been our best experience. it was our first time staying at this hotel and we absolutely loved it. this is the only hotel we will be staying at from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: friday0621
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Dana for 4 nights in a Premium Bay View Room. The room was spacious, the bathroom was beautiful, huge balcony overlooking the bay, very convenient access to everything. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Leisure at affordable pricing”
Reviews.Author: trash1
Reviews.Content: Everything you need is nearby or on the property. Beautiful rooms with modern amenities. Lovely balcony bay views. From simple walks to bicycle rides. Wonderful dining with a relaxed atmosphere. Beach in walking distance. Property is large and there is allot to do. Marina is there and fishing gear easy to purchase. With the exception of a day trip, we really did not find it necessary to leave the property.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: Banjoburger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used this hotel as a base for our visit to Southern California (and in particular San Diego) towards the end of September for a total of 10 nights, and came away with the impression that it served its purpose but wasn’t anything spectacular. When we booked this hotel we got a great rate through Hotels.com amounting to a 50% discount which we thought was a steal. Having stayed there now we feel that was probably a fair price. Had we paid full price I think we’d have been disappointed. We booked a deluxe bay view suite so were accommodated in the newer section of the resort. We did have a quick look at the rest of the accommodation and would agree with most of the other posts on here that the bay view rooms are the best bet. Our room was on the ground floor (1st floor for all you yanks reading this) so we would also say that if you can request one on the 2 floors above this you’ll get the best return. The location of the hotel is also very good, not far from the airport, right next to Seaworld and very accessible. It’s also right on the bay so the surroundings are very pleasant. When we checked in we were told that there was a ‘fan’ in our room as the carpet has been cleaned but would be removed shortly. As it turned out it was gone when we got to the room but unfortunately the smell of damp wasn’t. We stuck it for one night and then asked to be moved, which happened without any problems. It turned out when we got into the new room and turned on the air conditioning it was leaking onto the carpet so I suspect this was the issue in the original room. In the end we didn’t really need the aircon so the problem went away. Other than this we could really have no complaints other than the room didn’t have great lighting which was only a problem when we were changing and had to close the blinds to prevent prying eyes on the outside (another drawback of the ground floor). There were 2 queen beds, a fridge, microwave and sink as well as a safe and TV (which was never switched on during our stay). The bathroom was spacious and clean, as you would expect with room enough for 2 people to get ready. As some other reviewers have mentioned there was a $30 a day credit that could be used for breakfast in the Blue Pearl restaurant (not including tips) but we found this to be plenty for 2 adults and the range of breakfast options and quality of the food was very good. Because of this we decided to eat there one evening but found the options were a bit more limited so ate elsewhere for the rest of our stay. We didn’t eat in the other restaurant on site but we did have drinks in the bar where the staff were friendly (which could be said for all of the staff we encountered while we were there) but it did turn out to be quite pricey. A little bit disappointing was the charge of $12 per night for car parking…nowadays you’d expect that to be free. There is also a charge for using the internet connection so we chose to log on elsewhere if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Dana but with reservations”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterPowells
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the lovely Dana Hotel near Mission Beach in San Diego. Overall we were very happy with this hotel, we booked a large bay view suite that had two queen sized beds (ideal for our family of 4). The hotel is nicely located about 1 mile from the fantastic Mission beach (it isn't "on" Mission Beach though) with it's great surfing and sunbathing opportunities - we walked this everyday but it can be hardwork if it's very hot. The location is perfect for Seaworld. There is a little noise from aircraft taking off from the nearby airport as the Dana is under the flightpath but it didn't really bother any of us and didn't affect our sleep;- it was pretty quiet overall. The room we booked was large, comfortable and had a nice en-suite bathroom. There was a fridge in the room which was very useful to store simple things such as milk, fruit and of course a few beers! The beds were comfortable and we had sufficient pillows. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and we had sufficient clean towels provided every day throughout our stay. There are two restaurants at the hotel;- the Blue Pearl and Firefly. We didn't eat at Firefly but had three evening meals at the Blue Pearl. The food there was pretty good quality but the service was patchy to say the least. Our first meal was excellent and at about $90 for the four of us was good value. Our second night proved interesting in that the waitress decided she was going to remove any unnecessary dishes, plates, cutlery etc within two seconds of them being finished with by us (you could argue efficient but I would say annoying). This led us to feel we were being over-watched and scrutinised and I only left a modest tip of about 10% of the bill. On check out on our final day I was horrified to find that my RECEIPT FOR THIS MEAL HAD BEEN ALTERED to add a further 20% to that particular bill. Naturally I queried this with the receptionist at check out but she didn't seem too concerned at something that is probably illegal (in Britain we call this "theft") and certainly didn't offer a refund of the money in question (a relatively paltry $18) and has not contacted me by telephone or e-mail as I had requested to clarify what had occurred. Our third (and perhaps thankfully final) dinner at the Blue Pearl also proved interesting in that there was something wrong with one of every course we ordered between the four of us;- my eldest daughter had buffalo wings that had pure tabasco sauce on them (not the bbq that we'd requested) and hence were inedible. My youngest daughter ordered a toasted cheese sandwich that had peanut butter inside it and no cheese! My wife had a chicken and pasta dish that had no chicken in it whatsover (perhaps a chicken had run through it?). After a few complaints the waiter realised that by this time we were getting a bit piss_d off and offered us free desserts (a nice touch) as a result. What a shambles though. These latter two events didn't really spoil our stay though and we would certainly return to the Dana or recommend it to a friend. Be careful where you eat though!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: smjhunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana on Labor day. We got a last minute special on a suite overlooking the bay (from their own website). Thanks to being an avid follower of TripAdvisor I was aware this hotel had an older and newer part and when I saw a suite offered in the newer section for around $200 a night I took it right way. We weren't disappointed. The suite was beautiful and very spacious with a nice common room that serves as a second bedroom and it's own patio and small kitchen. We ended up with a room on the bottom floor which turned out to be perfect as we brought along bikes and could just ride them onto the patio and keep them there. We also happened to get the corner unit which has an extra large size patio as well. There's also a small refrigerator that we used to stock drinks and bottled water. There is a marina on the property that can rent ski boats and wave runners. There is also a bike path on the periphery which connects to the other areas of Mission Bay like Paradise point via the numerous bridges. For the most part you can bike all around Mission Bay via the connected bike paths which is good if you have small children and want to avoid traveling on any busy streets. The pool was nice too but calling it an infinity pool is a bit of a stretch. There's also a free computer with internet connection in the lobby which we made use of. The only cons are they want to charge you for internet use in the room (and it is only wired with a short cable provided as well) and for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimDSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite, the room was perfect and the bay view was awesome. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “UNACCEPTABLE NOISE THROUGHOUT THE EVENING AND THE NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: colocalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room close to the pool and they made a movie projection in the evening until 10:30 without giving us any notice, neither on the phone when I booked nor when we arrived (and there were only 4 people watching the movie, so 4 people happy for maybe 50 rooms which were spoiled by the noise). In the middle of the nights folks were swimming and laughing in the pool. There was no gardian to make sure it doesn't happen. Then when we mentionned it to the office the next morning she said the manager would have a talk with us and make us an offer. He didn't do anything and we never met him. The following night the party and all the noise were around the other pool ! We would not recommend this noisy hotel. And the rooms were not yet ready at 3:00 pm when we arrived (I knew it as I had read on the reviews but I was still hoping !).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BeachDude22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our anniversary and decided to go back to The Dana...a hotel we started going to when we dated. We stayed in the new building. The original building is just plain old and musty. The suite we had was a deck suite and was on the 2nd floor. It had a huge deck that overlooked the Bay and it had a path out front that we often rode bikes on and roller-bladed on. We skipped Sea World, but saw that they have a free shuttle, which is nice because the Dana charges $12/night to park. We loved our room. It had a separate living room and bedroom, kitchenette and large bathroom. We got a great AAA price booking directly with them. it was cheaper than Priceline or Hotels dot com. I am sure we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful, relaxing and fun getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kirksten
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend with my girlfriends here in September and we were so impressed by the cleanliness of the whole hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the overall service we received while staying at the Dana. The location is amazing as we sat out on the balcony sipping wine at night and enjoying the view, and enjoyed the convenience of being close to a lot of different locations. It was so relaxing!! I will make sure and book here again next time my family's in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Desert sands to ocean sands”
Reviews.Author: Kellyguth3
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old, 2 year old and I decided on a last minute trip to the water before school started in August. We read reviews on-line and saw The Dana! We drove in late on a Thursday evening around 9:00pm and my husband checked us in. We had booked a room with harbor views and they upgraded us because it was our first time staying there to a suite over looking the bay. The price was great since we booked on-line. The causal dining was still nice and the staff was very friendly. The heated pool over looking the water was perfect. The parking was $12.00 a day but we had a place to park and the area was gated...and did I mention we could have walked across the street to Sea World...it is also $12.00 to park there and they have a shuttle from the hotel so don't get charged for parking twice. The resturant also let my husband order food to go even though they had been closed for 15 minutes, room services ended a little early but The Pearl was very good to us.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hidden costs, no MSNBC, great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: HurricaneCarol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for seven nights, 2 of the nights my daughter stayed with me. It is in a lovely location and I was on the top floor ot the newer building overlooking the bay. The rooms are fine but I would like to see the carpeting replaced. It seemed moist and a little grungy in my room and the outdoor walkway carpeting outside the rooms was full of stains. No MSNBC on cable, and a limited amount of channels on the TV. Breakfast was delicious and very well priced in the Blue Pearl restaurant. Internet and Parking are extra, 12 dollars for parking a day and connecting to the internet with my laptop 10 dollars a day, for the price I was paying for the room I found this a bit exorbitant. It even costs extra to rent a shaded cabana at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Why go to Hawaii when you can stay at the Dana in San Diego?”
Reviews.Author: entertainersales
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for a hotel based on my experiences whether good or bad but I feel impelled to share the wonderful stay at The Dana Hotel in San Diego. The service, room, restaurant and view are all 5 star. I don't know what The Dana is rated but if I were giving it a rating, it would be at least 5 star. A real "10" on my scale. I really didn't want to come home after my stay at The Dana and with SeaWorld right next door and a shuttle, we never had to use our vehicle during our stay. If you are like us, the last thing you want to do is drive after commuting everyday for work. Everything nearby including renting a bike - biking riding (which we did) and a 28 mile ride around the bay (we didn't do the whole ride but we did 14 miles) and riding around the beauty of the bay/beach is magical. I really didn't know how much there was to do in the area as well as right at the hotel. We sat in the hot tub in the evening watching a movie on the big screen outdoors next to the pool. That along with a cocktail, it just doesn't get any better. Although we don't have children, they seemed to be having a blast as well! It's a great place whether you are a family with children, or if you are at The Dana for a romatic birthday weekend as we were. My partner said it was the best vacation ever and she felt like a queen for the weekend. Go and enjoy, pamper yourself.....we will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like coming home”
Reviews.Author: hendy66
Reviews.Content: Our family has been coming to this hotel for over 25 years. It just keeps getting better and better. As it has expanded and undergone rennovation, the warmth and genuine care of the guest has remained intact. We always feel welcomed and cared for. There is a new section with great views of Mission Bay, comfortable and attractive furnishings, complete with a new lounge and bar area, pool and jacuzzi. We love the feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good food , great location”
Reviews.Author: asquith2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana for 5 nights from 16-21 Aug. loved the position of hotel, close to Sea World and right on the marina. The kids loved the pool and spa. Had great breakfasts and dinners every day at The Blue Pearl Eatery.Would recommend to anyone looking to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeling soon?”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltourist
Reviews.Content: We only had a couple of days in San Diego and wanted to stay on the water. We booked a "Bay View Deluxe" room at The Dana and were well enough pleased. Check in and any encounter we had with hotel staff was first rate. I did get the sense that the hotel was prepping for some renovation work as the room, while very clean had sort of a Hawiian theme that seemed a bit dated and the exterior hallways were in serious need of cleaning as were most of the non landscaped areas. Of the 2 location restaurants, the Firefly is closed on Monday causing some inconvenience and the Blue Pearl (I think) offered good food but was noisy. Items of irritation were the $12 per night for parking and the $9.95 daily charge for internet access. (These days?! Come on guys!) There is also a $10 per day fee to access a fitness facility that is not on premise. But it's San Diego and there are plenty of areas to explore on foot. All in all our stay was fine, but not memorable. Knowing San Diego well we will probably choose another property for our next visit. In this part of town there are many fine choices all line up to explore.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: L.A.Guy
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed here for a 2-night stay while we visited San Diego. I booked throught the hotel website, which is a lot better than going through Expedia or Travelocity because they give you a plethora of options on what kind of room you can reservice. I took the advice from a few online and upgraded to the newer Bay View Rooms and was impressed. We were given two queen beds as requested with a nice balcony overlooking the bay (there was even a wedding going on right in front of our room one day). The room was clean with great ammenities: fridge, flat screen tv, kitchenette with sink. The pools were really nice with pool side waiter service which we took advantage of. We were also able to watch the Sea World Fireworks show right from the property on Friday night. We didn't have a chance to eat at the two restaurants on site or order room service, so I can't compliment on the food but if you do go to restaurant.com and buy the gift certificates, it will save you a lot of $$ of heard. I would only give two small suggestions: 1) get rid of the $12 per night parking fee, kind of unnecessary. The street outside has no parking after 2am so we didn't have a choice but to pay it. 2) if you're going to offer a flat screen TV in the room it might be wise to actually have a HiDef feed going into it. The standard def channels looked like crap on it. Other than that, we had a great time and am looking forward to coming back again and trying the water activities at the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Afterhours23
Reviews.Content: We booked our room with a Marina View and it was very nice. Close to the Marina Shop if you need beer and wine (there is a frig in the room). The Blue Pearl had a great dinner menu and we had a wonderful meal (our waiter had a great personality). The room was clean but the carpet had paint spots on it from a recent repaint. The location is perfect for Sea World (we sat by the Marina to watch the fireworks) and only 3 miles to the beach. We will stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: vegasbnd
Reviews.Content: I was very suprised. I wanted to stay there because it was close to Sea World and 20 minutes from my main objective Del Mar. I had a premium bay room on the 3rd floor with an outstanding veiw of mission bay. The room was big for a hotel and a micro/ Fridge was a great touch. I only had on interaction with the staff when I called and said my AC was not working to well. Within 10 minutes someone was there drained the line of the AC and I was in buisness. The breeze of the bay at night was all I could ask. But the walk to sea world is little longer and in the humid weather I would not recommend for parents withany kids under 10. Just a great hotel for the money and location. Only complaint is 12 a night parking that is lame

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel that is near Sea World with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: deniseg1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana at the beginning of the summer. We were pleasantly surprised on how nice the room was. It had a wonderful view of the marina and a great big balcony. The best part is that it is walking distance to Sea World. They also had a tram that went back and forth all day. The staff was also very helpful and even helped us find good takeout restaurants. I would definetely return to this hotel and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl040
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July. The weather was great, the pools were fantastic, front desk, room service and consierge service were very good. Highly reccommend this hotel for anyone looking for a reasonable priced holiday. We stayed in a non-view room , which was very clean and nice and close to the family style restaurant. There is a free shuttle to Sea World and you are only a mile from Mission beach. We did need a car to get to the Zoo and Legoland. Hotel is right on the marina that has a little convenience store which was great to pick up juice, milk, cereal etc.. If you have an alcoholic drink by the pool be prepared to pay a ridiculous amount for the privilege. Overall a great stay for this family and we would definitley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but all depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: binmadrid
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the Dana with our 2 children (9 and 11) for 4 nights, at the end of our 3 week fly-drive holiday in California and Arizona. We were looking for an upmarket place in a good location (nr beach, Sea World), with lots of space and nice views. So we booked a Bayview Suite in the newer buildings, and weren't disappointed......clean, spacious, lovely views of the Bay, good swimming pools. BUT I definitely wouldn't have wanted any of the rooms in the older part of the hotel, for all the reasons mentioned by other reviewers. So be careful which room you're getting. And DON'T make any international phone calls - a total rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “The Ripoff on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: megzsocal
Reviews.Content: OK, it wasn't THAT bad. However, there are a few things that made me unhappy about this "resort" (and I use that term loosely). All in all the hotel was clean, located conveniently next to SeaWorld, and was in a "quiet" location, away from the hubbub of the beach. It is in a really pretty setting, right on the bay with it's own docks, 2 heated pools, water activity rental center and more. So what's the problem? Coming from a hospitality work background, a few things were off. The Bad: -They charge you to park in their parking lots. To me, this is outrageous and I'm not really sure if other hotels in the area do the same. You're already staying in their hotel, have paid the room rate for the day and if you drive in, you have to pay an additional $12.00 per day to park AT YOUR HOTEL! -Their rooms are inconsistent. We stayed in the 500 block of rooms. The room was clean, but the case goods were dated and old looking as was the rest of the decor. The television in our room was an older, non-flatscreen television with pretty terrible Lodgenet reception (lots of lines and static). When we went to the pool, we noticed the more prime located rooms near the pool were much more updated looking with newer tv's. Would be nice for them to offer the same comforts to all of their guests. -The Blue Pearl hotel restaurant was overpriced. The food wasn't awful, but it wasn't anything special either. Good if you're hungry and cranky and want to eat immediately. We got to the restaurant around lunchtime, I guess, and I'm not sure if the employees are comp'd meals from the restaurant or if they order them, but the flood of employee lunches was backing up the kitchen, making for a pretty long wait to get our food. My advice would be to extradite the guests orders, not the employees. Did not eat at the Firefly restaurant, but it seemed upscale and probably not really "family friendly". -There aren't any real perks. You have to pay to use the wireless internet (free in laundromats nowadays) which will run you a $9.99 per 24 hours. No complimentary coffee/tea or complimentary breakfast in the restaurant in the morning (also pretty common with many middle-range chain hotels these days). There wasn't HBO or any other movie channels in the scant television channel selection. The pools are free to use and there is also a free business center you can use if you need to log in to the internet without paying the fee. The water activities seemed a little bit expensive, but not terrible...and probably very doable for a couple or family with a bigger budget. -The housekeeping staff, although effective and good at their jobs, are quite loud in the morning, shouting to each other from across each side of the building. I was woken up both mornings from this and the sounds of doors bouncing against the latch locks as the housekeepers entered and exited rooms. The Good: -Free shuttle to SeaWorld. Then you don't have to pay to park ANOTHER $12.00 at SeaWorld! Shuttle times are limited and seem to get full, so if you're there when it's busy, probably best to get to the shuttle area a little early. -Pretty and peaceful setting. The garden area and tropical pool areas are very pretty as is the rest of the property...riddled with tons of palms and an array of exotic shrubbery. -Comfortable (but kind of old) beds. The pillows were nice and squishy, just as I like them...not too hard or flat. -Clean (this is a biggie for me with any hotel). I found some dust on a lampshade, but the bathroom was spotless and the carpet didn't have any debris on it. Sheets were clean and room was already made up upon checking in early. -2 heated pools and jacuzzis (really nice if you want a quieter swim as usually one of the two pools is a little less busy than the other). -Nice soap and in-room coffee amenities. To sum it up, we reserved our room through SeaWorld as a package. We paid a little bit for the room plus the SeaWorld tickets. I would suggest if you are truly interested in staying at the Dana to reserve your room directly through the hotel website or through their phone system and request a newer room or spring for the room with a view of the pool or bay. Plan on paying for the parking expense if you are driving in a rental car or your own vehicle. If you do not have a car, ask the concierge or front desk for a bus schedule. The buses looked pretty clean and the routes seemed to run through most major areas of interest. The beach on the bay isn't really swimmable, so if you want lots of beachtime, try heading up the road closer to Mission Beach and check the hotels there. Not a terrible experience, but not a romantic, thrilling or exceptional one either. The word "resort" has connotations of luxury, convenience and inclusiveness and The Dana didn't have much of any of those things.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Galleon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for 6 nights and it was absolutely fine. It isn't the nicest hotel I've ever been in but in terms of value for money it hits the mark. Our room was on the small side for 2 adults and 2 teenagers but had a fridge and a microwave and was directly across from the lovely marina. And you can just step outside your front door and watch the fireworks at Seaworld! The pool area is great, plenty beds & towels and a jacuzzi so kids were well pleased with this. We only ate in the Blue Pearl for breakfast which was fine, standard american breakfast. I did get caught out with the breakfast deal in that when I booked through Expedia I thought I was getting breakfast for 4 but the deal was actually an allowance of $30 per day. This could have been a problem if the teenagers had got up out of bed every morning! As it was, the two of us had a lovely peaceful breakfast and got coffee & toast to take back to the room for them, all within our budget. If you are on this deal, also be aware that you pay your gratuities even if within the budget. It terms of the area, you can't really walk to anywhere but Mission beach is only a few minutes drive and its only about 10 minutes to the city centre. For shopping, we would recommend the Fashion Valley mall over Horton Plaza which we didn't like at all. The Zoo is great, as is Seaworld and its also worth a trip up the coast to La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: Keener42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for six nights at the end of July beginning of August. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but the staff at the desk suggested that we have lunch and he would put a rush on our room. By the time we were finished eating, sure enough our room was ready and within a 1/2 hour of unpacking we got a call from the front desk wanting to ensure that everything was okay. We stayed in the newer part of the hotel which is called Waters Edge and had a large bayview room with two queen beds, a pull out couch (twin) and kitchenette. I would suggest that you book your room in the Waters Edge if you have more than two people to a room as the older part of the hotel appears to have smaller rooms. The bathroom was large enough that a couple of people could get ready in there without bumping into each other. Also quite liked the natural shampoo and soaps that are provided. And the room was very clean. We had booked the bed and breakfast special and received a $30 credit daily - this was enough to feed two adults and two kids (ages 8 and 10) a very good breakfast (menu had everything you could want for breakfast - granola to bacon and eggs) at the hotel's casual restaurant The Blue Pearl. Staff at the Blue Pearl were very kind and friendly and the food was good casual fare. I have to say that the concierge at the hotel made a good vacation great. She was fantastic and offered great suggestions for beaches, restaurants and also helped us rent a car. My husband had mentioned that we were going to the beach and while we were having breakfast I got a call from her offering two boogie boards for my daughters to use for the day. Impressive. Also you can buy discount tickets from the concierge to many of the local attractions. The pools were clean and attended by wonderful friendly staff that were ready to help you with anything. You must try the ceviche at the Firefly which is the formal restaurant at the hotel. While at the pool, you can order food from the Firefly (or the Blue Pearl) and enjoy it poolside. The gardens are beautiful, lush and well maintained. Our toilet got plugged and when I called the front desk , they immediately apologized for the inconvenience (okay, WE plugged the toilet!) and sent someone over right away. Location is pretty good - walking distance to Seaworld and a longer walk to Mission Beach and Belmont Park. But anything else such as the zoo, you will need a car as transit requires a couple of bus transfers and frankly you can rent a car for pretty cheap. Yes, parking is $12/day but we only rented a car for a couple of days so it didn't seem too unreasonable. I have travelled a fair bit on business trips and personal trips and have to say that the Dana was one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. And a lot of it has to do with the friendly staff - and I mean everyone there was friendly. We will definately be back (San Diego is a wonderful city!) and would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “It is a fantastic place for vacation and kids- remarks submitted by children, 11 and 5 years old.”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy6513
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed another fun summer vacation at The Dana again! My family and I have been vacationing here for 5 summers now. We consider The Dana to be our home away from home. We also try and stay here whenever possible a few weekends throughout the year. We have built great memories here with our children. We enjoy staying in the 2000 building, bottom floor. Reason being, our children can open the sliding patio door and run out and play in the grass area, they can play catch, watch the boats go back and forth in the bay, plus we are able to watch fireworks nightly from Sea World. They can also spend endless hours in the swimming pool. We always look forward to our arrival date knowing that we are in store for a superb, relaxing and fun vacation here but when our departure date arrives we are all very sad to leave and go back home. Staff is always smiling, friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygrlnla
Reviews.Content: My 4 year old son and I loved our stay at The Dana. The staff was so accommodating and friendly. The arranged special shuttle drop off and pick up times at Sea World based on our schedule. It was so relaxing at the hotel that it was hard to leave. The activities were great - we rented a paddleboat and wave runner. The hotel had movies at the pool at night which was much fun with a small child. My son will say his favorite part of the trip was sitting with Jon (employee) and overseeing the pool.

Reviews.Title: “We had an awesome view from our room”
Reviews.Author: CarolynHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Bay view rooms on the 3rd floor with a balcony with chairs. We had an awesome view of the bay and could see the fireworks at Seaworld every night. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful with information on what to do and making reservations at the Top of the Market for our 33rd Anniversary. Breakfast at the Blue Pearl was included in our Bed and Breakfast room. We were very pleased with both the food and service. We stayed for a week and would definitely return and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nurseb711
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Dana and were truly sad to leave. It was one of the most memorable stays that we have experienced. This was our first trip to California and the staff was always helpful answering our many questions. Our only regret is that we do not live closer so we could visit more often!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RocketJunkie
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but a good value if you are traveling with children and are planning to spend the day out on the town or at the parks. They do have two pools and two restaurants, plus shuttle service to Sea World and Amtrak. The rooms were well furnished and had a working A/C!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite worth the price. Look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Mpersh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of July 2009. I decided to stay here based on a friend's recommendation. I traveled with my spouse and wanted some place near the beach, some nightlife, sea world, and wanted a place we could walk to dinners, etc. We rented a car and walked as much as we could, which was a bit of a hike down to Belmont Park and the Boardwalk along Mission Beach. ok if not traveling with kids. Overall Biggest Pro: Location. Close to Expressway, beaches, Sea World. 15 mins to really anywhere (Gaslamp, Airport, La Jolla, etc.) Overall Biggest Con: Room. See many reasons below. Check-in Relatively quick, friendly staff. Room Likely my biggest disappointment. We stayed in the 800 bldg. Bottom floor, another mistake. Stay top floor! And be sure to check your bottom floor windows are locked. Ours were not. Recently renovated but VERY cramped if you get a king. Lumpy pillows, heavy nasty bedcover. Barely enough room to walk in front of the amoire. No luggage rack to put a suitcase on. No balcony or area to put your wet suit/towel if you are on the bottom floor. No fan for the bathroom, constantly steamed up all the mirrors. Window A/C unit, BLASTED you with freezing cold air out of the shower. Super annoying. Heavy LOUD doors. Constantly woke us up. As well as the staff starting to empty garbage and clean rooms super early. Big negative. 10$/day internet. A rip, in this day I hate being charged for internet. One of our outlets didn't work. Lampshades were cardboard and all bent/torn up (not a big deal, but so cheap!) Nice fridge and microwave to use for snacks. Amenities Nice pool areas. Neither were too crowded. Only used once though. Pool bar complete rip off though (10$ for a frozen drink), go to the marina deli next to the property and fill up on drinks for your fridge. Grounds nice/clean. Not really a fitness center, don't be fooled. We didn't use and just ran outside along the marina. Don't spend 10$ on breakfast there, go next door again to the marina deli, stock up on cereal/milk or get a great bagel sandwich for 3.99$ Best deal around the bay! We never ate on property, no reason to. Across the street you can get fish/chips too. Rented wave runners on the bay, that was fun, staff was nice there too. Bargain for a better rate :) Walk to Sea World. Only 15 easy minutes, and shuttle times are not really that covenient, unless you need to as you are traveling with little ones. Mission Bay and Mission Beach are so much more dirty, boring, and crowded. La Jolla is a cleaner beach though much smaller. Go there if you can, for sun, etc. Jeff's Burgers is tasty! Finally (sorry its long - but hopefully helpful!) the first couple nights we stayed at Gaslamp Holiday Inn on the Bay or something. Honestly, the beds were cozier, free wi-fi, fitness center, and closer to finer dining and bars. 15 mins to pretty much anywhere there too... might consider staying there again. They had this hotel beat, it was super quiet when it counted (as the only time we were in our room was to sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms and Giant Rates”
Reviews.Author: rosareilly
Reviews.Content: This is a MOTEL style hotel. The rooms are very small with lots of big furniture and so it felt very crowded. The linens were poor quality: filmy sheets, old, lumpy pillows, and ugly, heavy bedspreads. Dana Mission Bay charged way, way too much per nite ($220) and we felt taken advantage of. The more reasonable cost would have been about $75 - 100 per nite less. Surely there is a better qulity hotel in the area for that pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place!! We would stay here again! No question about it.”
Reviews.Author: brandimn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip and we had a wonderful time. The Dana is so beautiful. We stayed in a non-view room because we were not planning on being in the room too often. Plus, we were trying to save money somewhere since we were already spending a lot of money at all of the amusement parks and other attractions. We were completely satisfied with the room. It was very clean and the bathroom was newly redone. The vanity area was very roomy with two sinks and a large mirror. The bed area was a little cramped because of the overly large armoire. The property was so beautiful. There are palm trees and other landscaping everywhere. Also the location was great. We were really close to everything were wanted to see and the area is easy to get too. We loved San Diego so much! Oh! I only have one complaint. The doors are very heavy and slam very hard. Our neighbors would get up pretty early in the morning and every time they would leave the door would slam. It would wake us up every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and planning to come again next year”
Reviews.Author: cinderella1106
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for our 3 night stay. We stayed in room 601 which appears to be the newer section of this gated private hotel. The weather was beautiful, woke up to hearing seagulls. We had a mini fridge and micro in our room. Double sink and nice size mirror. Cleaning staff were very nice and friendly. We ate at one of the one site restaurant called the Blue Pearl in the mornings and our food was great and the service was excellent. Mke sure you see La Jolla, CA. It is within 15-20 min drive and is absolutely the most beautiful beach and water we have ever seen. There are some reasonable restaurants within a 5 min drive of the hotel. Teenagers rented a jet ski and played in the pool. Music at the pool really was relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: sah06
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, and have been travelling all over the world spending holidays in hotels with hole in the floor toilets or in pure luxery. Thiis year we where going to have vacation in the USA, at the end of our vacation we were having talks about spoiling ourselves at The Dana which was higly recommended. Three weeks in USA, and The Dana was supposed to be our higlight of all hotels we had been to during our vacation in USA. Entering the hotel around 3 in the afternoon, no room ready. When ready, 12 USD a day in parking fee besides the 198 USD a night. Breakfast not including, or let me say; Each adult gets a coupon for USD 15 for breakfast, 2 adults and 3 kids then have to pay for breakfast that costs over 30 USD. Did i mention that the prices at the restaurant are formed so you have to pay if you order a omelett, juice and cooffe? Service at the front desk; called once for getting information about ther shuttle to Sea World, they let me wait until I hang up after 3 minutes. Called again 10 minutes later, same thing happened. Third time the guy at front desk answered; "It has gone", and hung up on me... Where is the; It has gone and the next will go in blablabla minutes? And what is this not finishing a phone call - service? For 210 USD a night (including parking but not all taxes...) In the room; bedsheets were full of holes, the toiletpaperholder was falling out of the wall....... Three nights later we were glad to get away, the total cost of 237 USD a night we felt was a big overprice for an overrated hotel. Sorry Dana, you where just a big dissapointment for us travelers from Norway. Yours sincerly Sven Andre Haug Godvik NORWAY

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view but had to stand on the hallway to see fireworks”
Reviews.Author: SueTGGR
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and big. It was a short drive to SeaWorld. They do have shuttles but in June they had AM shuttles to take you to the park and PM shuttles to bring you back. Being that we checked in about 3:00pm we had to drive over and pay the parking fee. We could have walked but we had been walking around Disneyland most of the morning and didn't want to walk the 10-15 minute walk. We knew we were going to do a lot of walking around the park. The fireworks were nice but we stood out on the stair well to get a view as our rooms faced the bay (the opposite direction). The balcony we had was wonderful as our son went to bed and we enjoyed quiet time while he slept. It was interesting how our room and balcony was situated as there is a public parking lot with fire pits off to the side of the hotel on the bay facing side. We could hear and see the people in the parking lot and at the fire pits but not right in front of us. It was better than any reality show. ;>) I had no problem with noise at night or the next morning. We only stayed one night but it looked like we could have spent a few days exploring all around.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana was Divine and didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: PianaMama
Reviews.Content: After spending hours online trying to find a nice, safe hotel that could give us relaxation while still being kid-friendly and in the vacation budget, we booked the Dana. The room was clean, quiet, spacious and had an amazing view. The beds were very comfortable. The pool had great sand area for the little ones to play while we lounged with drinks from the pool bar and the surrounding gardens and marina were beautiful. The staff were very friendly and eager to assist. The hotel location made it easy to get to SeaWorld (free shuttle), nearby beaches, and access to freeways. The casual restaurant had wonderful service and great food for reasonable prices. The formal restaurant had a wonderful outdoor patio dining area and great ambiance - just would've liked real "kid" food on the menu. We loved it and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended...”
Reviews.Author: yeulife
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 10 hours before arriving with my family. Not knowing what to expect since one night charge was so inexpensive ($97 + tax). We were very surprised at the accommodation. It was excellent!!!! The front desk was fast and very helpful. The room was clean and well-worth $100/night. The view from our room was spectacular and 15 minutes walk to Sea World. I highly recommend this place if you travel with children.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in the San Diego area!”
Reviews.Author: GWushington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to San Diego at least four times each year and the only place we recomend us The Dana. The staff is on top of their game and is available to help at any time. The rooms are always clean and the beds are comfortable. The location you couldn't ask for a better spot if you have kids or if youre looking for a romantic getaway. I've recommended this hotel to all my friends and now I don he same to you. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is a Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: IamMrsC
Reviews.Content: We knew immediately that we would again stay at the Dana when we visited San Diego. The location makes it a short trip to San Diego attractions, and the hotel is superb. The rooms, pool area, Blue Pearl restaurant, and staff are excellent. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is a great place to stay if you are visiitng Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: myarusinsky
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a great place to stay if you are visiitng Sea World or just want a place to stay overlooking Mission Bay. The staff was prompt and helfull. We are looking to return next year and spend more time around the hotel and enjoy its nighttime activities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Troplicaltales
Reviews.Content: My brother was in town for a couple of days recently.And I decided to treat he and I to a stay on Mission Bay.Selecting "The Dana"was one of the best travel choices I have ever made.I am a writer,and periodically I stay at local hotels for the peace and quiet.Especially if I have a deadline to meet. This stay was for pure relaxation and time with my brother.From the time I entered the main lobby,I knew I had picked a winner.The front desk staff were a joy to deal with.Everyone with a smile,and so very helpfull. We were assigned our room which was a "Bay View"catagory.I could not believe it when we arrived at the room.It was "Bay Front".We were only a few yards from the water.The view was incredible.The room was very spacious,and included a refrigerator and a microwave,coffee maker, and complimentary coffee and tea.Our room was ground floor.So we could walk right out on to our patio,and then a few more steps to the sand.We could not have asked for a better location. The hotel is literally on Mission Bay.Located very close to Sea World and Belmont Park(a local amusement park,with roller coaster and other rides).It is also close to 2 major freeways that will get you any where in San Diego that you may want to go.Very easy access to all. Room service is provided by their on site restaurant"The Blue Pearl".We ordered several meals from room service,and the quality was great.It was always delivered promptly,we never had to wait more than 20 minutes. The hotel has a very nice swimming pool,excersize facilities,and even it's own Marina.The grounds are beautiful,and we enjoyed many walks around them.With the bay as a back drop-it just does not get any better.We also enjoyed beautifull sunset's from our patio. The Dana is a jewel of a find.It has much more of a local feel to it.Very different from the larger chain hotels.I am definately going back.And I would highly reccomend this hotel.The Dana has somthing for everyone.There is plenty to do for adults and families alike.You will be in for a treat when you pick "The Dana". Seple Miller Tropicale Tales Author and Freelance Writer

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great service - Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: JustMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our trip through California. Booked in advance and got a reasonable rate with two Seaworld tickets included. When we arrived, the check in was easy and quick and throughout our entire stay the staff at the Dana were very friendly and helpful. The whole complex is clean and well kept. We had a King room with Marina view which I didn't think was worth the extra money. The walls and ceilings are very thin which means it is loud pretty much all the time, especially since a lot of families with kids seem to stay here. Not recommended for anyone who is a light sleeper. Also please be aware that you pay for all 'extras', e.g. WiFi ($9.95/day), Parking ($12/day). Seaworld is about 10 min walk from the hotel - so my recommendation would be, leave the car at the hotel. Would recommend for families with children. Not recommended for the quiet romantice break.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: vkeosian
Reviews.Content: After staying at this place, I called my daughter so we all would arrange to stay there for a long week-end. The hotel has room service, is close to Sea World and golf. Has a pool and is across from the bay where you can rent a sailboat or a kiyack for the day. The two rooms in the suite are separated by a mini kitchen with dishes and a refrigerator. Kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DMSherwood
Reviews.Content: Stay in the new section with beautiful bay views and private patios. We stayed on the first floor and could walk right out onto the park-like lawn.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences in my travel history.”
Reviews.Author: CLWPortland
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed walking through the fragrant grounds of the Dana Inn, and the room was adequate for our needs, but we were unable to sleep through the early morning noise of the loud party hosted by the woman in the room next to ours. It started at 2 AM when the woman arrived with several loud party friends in the walkway facing the marina. After several minutes of shouting about heading for the pool, the group finally left. At 3 AM they came back to party in the woman's room. My initial call to the front desk at 3:05 AM brought a security guard ten minutes later, who asked the group to quiet down. There was only one registered guest to that room, and Dana's policy was to just ask the 3 AM crowd to quiet down! The party did get a little quieter, I mean, I no longer could hear as clearly the intimate details of when the partiers had lost their virginity (I don't think they were shouting, just very thin walls), but it was still loud enough to wake up my 9 and 6 year olds. My husband called the front desk again to complain. Dana staff came back and I assume asked the non-registered guests to leave, because from that point to some time after 4 am, the guests all slowly left--one or two about every five minutes (we could hear a good-bye said at the door as the guests left the room). When we checked out later that morning my husband complained about our interrupted night's sleep, and the Dana staff was clueless about the events of the night before. My conclusion is, if what you value in a hotel is a quiet atmosphere to relax and sleep at night, the Dana is not the hotel for you. Ensuring a relaxing, restful environment for its guests is obviously not a high priority for the Dana Inn or its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overrated - This place is awful.”
Reviews.Author: spierce000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. Stayed in "Standard View" room, 519 after being transfered from a lower level 5XX room which had a damp floor and smelled like mildew. The service was fine. The new room was adequate for a 2 star hotel except for the DNA samples on the bed spreads. The room was old and small with a poor attempt at updating the bathroom to tile and stone. There appears to be a newer building onsite which I assume is the Marina View rooms. If you are into overpaying for a location next to SeaWorld go for it. Otherwise spend the extra money on the Hyatt located across the street. Or save money and stay at a chain hotel. FYI Hidden charges $12.00/day parking and $9.95/day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “dark rooms and just not that exciting”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Dana Hotel for 4 nights in mid-May. I should point out straight away that I didn't have access to a car for the first two nights, which didn't help, as the hotel's location is pretty much only good if you have a car. Only Mission Beach is in walking distance, and even to get there it's a 25 min walk over a not particularly pleasant road bridge. For accessibility, either stay downtown or rent a car. The hotel itself was ok, but I thought it was a bit like a nice motel. The rooms were a decent size, but really dark, and I didn't like the way they faced out onto the balcony so everyone walking past could see in. The bathroom was a bit small and there was no conditioner provided (just shampoo). The fittings and furnishings were a bit poor quality for a four star hotel as well I thought. I ate at the Blue Pearl several times and the food was standard US fare, but wasn't bad. I didn't eat at the Firefly. I would say that the new pool was very nice, very big and well maintained. I wouldn't really have many complaints about the Dana if it advertised itself as a 3 star hotel and cost $90 a night - but it cost $160 a night for me and claims to be a 4 star. I think you could easily find better in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: royalgrl13
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a wonderful hotel that comes with great views of the bay. The rooms are always clean and the staff are very friendly! I have stayed at the Dana numerous times and always enjoy my stay. The rates are reasonable and the food at the two restaurants are delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal views coupled with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: tragland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dana with my girlfriend and I would highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers. We stayed in a room with a comfortable bed, elegant bathrooms, clean quarters and a top notch view of Mission Bay. Though this trip was a romantic venture, the grounds and amenities were well suited for all dynamics. The swimming pool was family friendly and the Firefly restaurant had a well rounded menu for even the pickiest of eaters. When I come to downtown San Diego again, I will be sure to stay at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again... and again... and...”
Reviews.Author: jakobsloth
Reviews.Content: What an amazing setting for a hotel - having stayed in various hotels in San Diego over the year I must say - the Dana is by far the best hotel we have stayed. Oh, and the upgrade to a larger room helped too! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Dana”
Reviews.Author: VacationingChris
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Dana. We stayed in an attractive premium bay view room which looked newly renovated. Our room was in the 2100 block. The large room had a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, sink, and plenty of cupboard space. The room had a large tv, two very comfortable queen beds, a table with two chairs, a sofabed, and a coffee table. The bathroom was medium sized and looked recently updated. The air conditioning unit , unfortunately, was a bit loud. The view from the room was fabulous. The large patio overlooked a grassy area and the bay. The pool areas were clean and very inviting. The grounds were nicely landscaped with lots of flowers and foliage. The staff was friendly and efficient. We definitely look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: summergirlfromDE
Reviews.Content: This place is great! The staff is very friendly. We did not meet 1 person who was anything but sweet. There are 2 pools so it wasn't too crowded. I was there with a girlfriend but there was a good mix of all ages. It's close to everything and very very clean and nice. The rooms were almost like a villa, get the second floor because the roof is wooden and vaulted and beautiful. The restaurants were good (a bit pricey) but I loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: oceanblue04
