We enjoyed the pool and there was even an events coordinator throwing in pool toys for all the kids. Make sure you take the opportunity to rent bicycles to take a ride to Mission Beach and around the bay; it’s well worth it. The staff and accommodations is exactly what you need for a weekend get-away in San Diego. I recommend this hotel for couples, children, and people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Focus”
Reviews.Author: AZFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for two nights in July 2008. Based on other TripAdvisor reviews, we made sure we were on the newer side of the hotel. The room was huge and had an upscale feel, and the view of the bay was very nice. There is a nice walking/jogging path right along the edge of the water. The bathroom was roomy, but it could have used an exhaust fan to clear out the humidity after showers. One selling point we were excited about was the hotel's free shuttle to Sea World. However, it turns out there are three fixed departure times in the morning and three fixed pickup times in the evening. This does not allow flexible coming and going from the park as we had hoped. We tried taking the shuttle the first day, but the shuttle back to the hotel was over an hour late. The next day we drove ourselves to Sea World and paid the $12 parking fee. That night when we arrived back at the hotel, the "reserved" parking area near our room was full! Oh, did I mention this hotel charges guests $12 a day for parking? Another irritation: when we needed someone to reset the room safe so we could lock up our valuables while at Sea World, it took three phone calls and almost an hour of our valuable vacation time for someone to finally show up. Overall, I think this is a nice property and location, but the staff needs to refocus their efforts on customer service if they want to become a great facility. For this price, I expect to be "wowed", and that didn't happen at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: rpuprin
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a lovely facility that is close to the area attractions in San Diego. The beach and Sea World are both minutes away from the hotel. The grounds of the hotel are very inviting for walks. The staff was very friendly. When I found their rates had gone down after I booked, the staff was very accomodating and made sure that I received the cheaper rate. We would stay at this facility again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: Melpomone
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 20th anniversary stay at The Dana. This is the second time staying at this hotel and it was even better than the first time. We stayed on the third floor of the newest building that has a balcony with a nice marina AND a bay view to enjoy our morning coffee on. The room was good size but not huge. Nice bathroom but the tub is very small and shallow. A very relaxing hotel with two pools, spas and an adjacent restaurant. We prefer room service and the breakfast was excellent and not overpriced. The building our room was in sits on a large grassy area right on the bay so it is perfect for a nice stroll. You can rent jet skis at the marina, we will do this next time. One can see the distant Seaworld fireworks from the firefly lounge but we brought wood and enjoyed them closer up at our own firepit on Fiesta island. Get there early and bring firestarter and smores! Yummm. You will not regret a stay at the Dana!

Reviews.Title: “Really two different hotels”
Reviews.Author: widelenser
Reviews.Content: Our small group had rooms in both the old and new sections of the hotel. The accommodations were like night and day. Our room (new section) was large, well appointed and had a beautiful view. Some of the old section rooms, although 75 % of the price, were horrible - tissue paper thin walls and shabby. The housekeeping, throughout, was only mediocre. Cleaning the balconies is apparently not part of the housekeepers' job description; there were bird droppings on the outdoor furniture that remained untouched for the entire stay. There was also poor communication between the front desk and the housekeeping department. Our group arrived at 3:30 PM and not one of the rooms was ready for check-in. The desk clerk said they had been cleaned but not yet "inspected". We waited another half hour. On weekends the Dana seems to be primarily a "wedding event" hotel, and if you're not part of the event you're rather crowded out of the facilities. The hotel just isn't large enough, or well staffed enough, to comfortably cater to both. Over all, there are many places to stay in San Diego that are a far better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and View”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedsOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana on Mission Bay for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. I imagine our review wouldn't be as awarding if we had stayed in the older section of the hotel, but the new section was beyond our expectations. I suggest the Premium rooms (3rd floor, new section) to anyone wanting a truely perfect San Diego experience. The rooms themselves were spacious, comfortable, and very clean. The king premium room had a small counter with a sink, cupboards, microwave, and small refrigerator. The Blue Pearl restaurant had wonderful food, wide variety of selection, and also provided excellent room service. It was very affordable with great costumer service. There is also a more upscale restaurant on the premises with a great view of the bay and has nice eating areas outdoors and inside. The hotel is within a short walk to Sea World, but also provides a very prompt shuttle service. We watched the fireworks from Sea World on our balcony. The concierge services were always available for help as well as the gift shop attendant for sun burn items. The view of the bay was a beautiful panoramic shot to say the least. In the late afternoons, we watched the rowing teams practice from our balcony. We used the Greenride car service to and from our destinations and most fares were $23. All in all, it was the perfect spot and we couldn't have asked for a better trip. We will be staying at the hotel again. We can't wait to go back! P.S. They give a discount for returning visitors. What can be better?

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingduo1234
Reviews.Content: We just got back from The Dana at Mission Bay and had a fantastic time! It is set up like a motel which made it really easy to go to the pool, get things out of the car. Across the street is the Hilton and The dana just felt more quaint. The people working there were fantastic! They were very helpful. The restaurants were great and affordable. Some quick advice: If you have kids, request a room facing the tropical pool. Walk to Sea World. Spend at least a day down on Mission Beach/pacific beach. We had a great time -

Reviews.Title: “The Dana - Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Yourstruly-Wa
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and researched many hotels in the SD area, and chose The Dana for the main part of our visit. It was a great choice. The room was large with a small couch and seating area, a frig, micro, counter and sink. It was spotless and well-appointed, with a first floor premium bay view. The beds were very comfortable and we heard not even a whisper from the adjoining rooms. We could walk from our private gated patio across the grass to bayside and literally watch the dophin play. They offer a free shuttle service to/from the airport and several times a day to SeaWorld, which we enjoyed one day. If you go with kids or teens, do the Dolphin Encounter at SeaWorld for $40 where they get to feed and pet one of the dolphins - a memorable experience but book early. We also did the Old Town Trolley tour of San Diego and upgraded to the Seal water tour of the Mission Bayfront. The staff at The Dana were helpful and professional. Self parking at $12 / day. All in all, a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: slrossi
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a Marina View room. This was not a good value. The view was just ok, but most importantly the room wasn't really set up to take advantage of the view. For $50 more it is probably worth it to get sea view room in their newest wing which all have patios. The public areas were all nice. The breakfast at Firefly was nothing fancy, but very tasty standards were served and made it not worth going elsewhere unless you just wanted coffee and a muffin, etc. My three main complaints given the price point; they charge for parking, have cheap TP, and small/thin bath towels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for our ten year anniversary and had a great experience. We stayed in the Water's Edge part of the resort in Room 1311. The first room we checked into didn't have as much of a view as we had hoped. My husband went down to the front desk and they quickly moved us to a new room with a fantastic view of the Bay. The room itself was very clean and it was nice to have the in-room safe, microwave, fridge, bathrobes, coffee maker etc. The balcony offered a great view and a relaxing spot at the begin or end of the day. We ate at both restaurants and found them both effecient and the food tasty. The concierge was very helpful in getting us discounts on our tickets and helping us out. We managed the public transit system very easily and found ourselves not out too much by not having a vehicle. It is a quick walk to Sea World and everything else is very accessible by bus/trolley. The location was great and there was a little Deli/bait shop just down from the hotel that had any munchies/drinks that you needed. The hot tub was a great relaxer at the end of the day. We loved our stay at the Dana and will definitely bring our family back on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana was amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: caligal2003
Reviews.Content: The Dana was an excellent hotel. We went for a one night stay to take the baby to Sea World. The rooms are cheap, given the prices of other hotels in the area, but the hotel itself is wonderful. The room was very spacious, and there was a calendar of events on the table in the room listing everything The Dana had going on that month. The service was amazing. We first called for a crib for the baby, and they came in under 5 minutes and set it up for us, along with clean bedding. The second call was for assistance in getting the stroller and bags downstairs with baby (I was by myself to check out) and the man who came to help not only arrived in under 5 minutes and brought down the stroller and diaper bag himself, he also drove us to the lobby. The restaurant on the premises (the casual dining one, not the fancy one) was really good, the food was delicious and the service was great and friendly and really catered to our baby. The bed was incredibly comfortable and large and there were tons of extra pillows stashed throughout the room. The Dana is also only a 10-15 minute walk to Sea World, so I was able to walk the baby to the theme park pushing his stroller, which saves on gas, which is a major bonus given today's gas prices!! I did not have one single thing to complain about during my stay! I will definetely be going back again next time I am in the San Diego area!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: balisticbob
Reviews.Content: Bait and Switch...They show you the "new" section on the WEB anbd then give you the old 1970's section when you arrive. They then try to up sell you to the new section for $60 bucks more a nignt. DO NOT stay in the OLD section. It has NO sound insulation in the floors. Take the BAIT....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AZMama7
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, 11 year old and 5 year old spent 2 nights at The Dana. It was a very nice hotel. If you are there specifically to see Sea World, then The Dana is definitely the place to stay. It is very close to Sea World. You can walk to Sea World from the hotel but we chose to drive (2 minute ride ?) since we knew we'd be walking a lot at Sea World itself. We stayed in one of the suites located in the new building. Absolutely wonderful decor. The view of the bay was beautiful. We had 1 king bed and a separate living area with a pull-out couch bed for the kids. Due to my kids getting big I believe that will be the last trip they share a pull out couch bed. Great room. Nice kitchen counter with coffee maker, little fridge, microwave, sink, etc. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: erinca
Reviews.Content: Awesome is really all I can say! Well except for the $12 a day to park your car. The staff was excellent, the restaurants were priced well and the food was great. 2 pools to choose from! I can't say enough about how great this hotel is. I don't think I'll stay anywhere else when we visit San Diego. We walked to the beach, close to freeway but can't hear it. I could go on and on but this is enough!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana at Mission Bay for business in mid May for several days. There were lengthy lines at the front desk because there was usually only one person on staff. The overall staff at the hotel appear to be indifferent. Hotel food was below average. There is an older and newer section of the hotel property. I was placed in a newer room in the 1100 section. My room overlooked a public park which was frequented by the homeless who loiter around the public restroom. The rooms in the 2000-2200 section are quite nice and they have a view of the marina. A positive feature of the hotel was the hotel shuttle, which leaves for the airport on the hour. I would choose to stay at another hotel in a future trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with The Dana”
Reviews.Author: agenera
Reviews.Content: We are residents of San Diego, but booked a few hotel rooms for my family for Mother's Day weekend. Overall, it was the best you can get for the money. While other hotels may be a bit fancier and newer, this hotel provided everything we needed, the rooms were clean and in great condition and the surroundings were beautiful. The restaurants were delicious and well priced. The hotel across the street is more expensive and a high rise building and could not provide the intimacy and the smaller more campus-like feeling. The grounds were well kept and very green, the pools were great and view of the bay was beautiful. They provided rentals for boats, bikes, etc. You could walk to Sea World and the beach, although shuttles were available. Close to the freeways without the view and noise of them. The staff were friendly, professional and accommodating. My only complaint was that the line to check-in went very slow. I would stay there again and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: luv2go39
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at The Dana and had a wonderful time. Our room in the newer building was fabulous, with a great view of the bay. The room was very nicely appointed and had a nice little balcony off it so that we could keep an eye on our kids (old enough to be out by themselves, but I like to be able to check up on them). The staff was excellent and so very friendly. We ate at both restaurants and really enjoyed them both. The Pearl was great for a quickly served breakfast and we had dinner at the Firefly, which we were pleasantly suprised at the quality of food. My children wanted to leave Sea World a little early and go for a swim in the pool. We had a good time there as they could swim and we had a nice time relaxing with a cocktail or two! Overall, my family had a terrific time, the only complaint I had would be the check in time, which is 4 pm. I have never been to a hotel that was later than 3 pm and thought that time was a bit late.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view but sub-par hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookieToronto
Reviews.Content: I booked here after reading good reviews. The hotel's in a good, neutral location (it's about a $30 cab ride everywhere - downtown, zoo, la jolla caves) and it's on a marina and across from a beach. BUT, the hotel is more like a motel because all the rooms are either on first or second floor. I stayed on first floor and there is parking right in front, just like a motel. I was staying alone and felt totally UNSAFE! Plus, the shutters are wood slats that you can see in between so as you walk by you can see into all the rooms. So, if you go back to your room in the daylight (even early evening) you have to sit in total darkness with blinds closed if you don't want people to see in (and they can still see in anyway). The maids will even look in at you in the morning - and they want to clean the room at 8 am! the bed linens are like Best Western style - old fashioned 70s - do not touch! The shower didn't drain so I had to stand in water (and there's more see-through shutters in the bathroom out to a parking lot!). The TV only has about 15 channels and it has a pay-station but it didn't work and I heard someone else complain at reception about that and they acted like Oh, it must've just been your room, but clearly it's at least 2 rooms. They tell you there's a shuttle to take you anywhere but really it's not - they'll tell you it's only to take you to the airport. But cabs are readily available if you rent a car. There's free internet in the rooms or a computer in the lobby, which is good. And there's a path along the water right outside the parking lot, which is convenient. I wouldn't stay here again because it's not that nice, but it was pretty affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy staying at The Dana”
Reviews.Author: travelinseniors
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Dana. We always stay in the rooms on the bay. The rooms are a very nice size and include a small kitchen. The rooms are kept very clean and we've had no problems. We find the rooms to be quiet. We've had nothing but good experiences at The Dana, the people we have come in contact with have always been cheerful and very helpful. The hotel is easy access to the freeways and for a visit to Pacific Beach, which we always enjoy doing. We've enjoyed the walking trails around the area very much and it is just across the highway (via stoplight) to Sea World. This last visit we decided to walk there and it's just a short 20 minute walk. Highly recommend The Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: suethem
Reviews.Content: My family and I experienced something no one can ever imagine. This hotel is dirty as hell. Especially the pool and spa. The hotel provides no attendant at the pools. I found real [--] in the spa. My son and I were inside the spa over 30 minutes. I actually hold a piece of [--] on my palm. I complained, of course. Guess what? They did not even empty the spa. They just poured lots of bottles of Chlorine. Now it's hafl chemical and half sewage. The manager never called me back and apologized. Also the hotel rooms do not have a safety box, and it's right next to a public parking lot. No guards, no gates, no nothing to secure your safety. They even charge me $12 per day for parking. Since there is no security, you should park at the public parking lot. It's a bad hotel, not even worth a star. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel , but do not ask for bowls for icecream”
Reviews.Author: janey_12
Reviews.Content: We ( Husband, 2 kids and I) stayed at the Dana on our visit to San Deigo and desipite previous reviews we had a great time. We booked a Marina View Room as part of a Bed and Breakfast Deal. We were given an upstairs room that was clean, quiet and with a great view of the Marina. Although not too roomy, we didn't mind as we would be out all day. These room are motel like , but the beds were comfortable and bathroom was clean. Some of Marina rooms are walk from the reception, but this may help with the quiteness of the room. The pools were clean and the kids had a great time swimming in them all day. There is a bar at both pools so guests can have a drink or two. The are two restaurants that serve meals all day. The Wildfire is a great restaurant but is pricey. I got the feeling that there are not too keen on kids as the chef refused to serve bowls of icecream for dessert . However that said they make a fantastic creme brulee! The Blue Pearl is very much like Dennys, but it serves good , fast and yummy breakfasts. Please note if you book the Breakfast Deal is it for this restaurant and if you have children with this deal they are NOT included. If you mistakenly go to the Wildfire ( like we did one morning) you get a $5 credit on your breakfast meal. Overall we had a great experience at The Dana. Maybe to get a better experience here, request a top floor room, as far from the pool areas and go out to San Diego / Old Town for Lunch and Dinner. Great restuarint for kids is UNO Pizza at Mission Beach. I found this hotel to be great value and parking is $12 per night... not $25 like some other hotels in the area. We will be coming back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay with a Few Gripes”
Reviews.Author: co_fragment
Reviews.Content: Generally a good stay with a few gripes, most of all really enjoyed San Diego! The Good: *The standard room was really nice, clean and modern, with a large comfortable bed and large LCD tv. A/C and shower were good - the price wasn't too bad either. *Tried the Blue Pearl restaurant, staff were nice and food was pretty good in quality and price (for a hotel). They also had a more pricey one called Firefly, but didn't try it. *Ordered the free shuttle back to the airport on departure and it was there and ready to go on time. *Walked to Seaworld in about ten minutes, although they also run a shuttle three times a day (ask the concierge for times). *The pools looked really nice but didn't fancy them as the air temp was about 65F. The Bad. *On arrival at SD airport we called the hotel and were told by staff to wait in the wrong place for the complimentary airport shuttle wasting about an hour and a half, although after that were told to get a taxi which they refunded. *One night around 4am heard a gnawing either on the roof or in the ceiling which was really loud. I put up with it maybe an hour and finally called reception told them there was something trying to chew it's way in. Was told that maintenance wouldn't be in until 8am and that they'd take a look - we didn't leave that morning until 11am and nobody came. When we got back there was no real sign of anyone checking our room out. My partner called the front desk to find out what had been done - their reply was "We don't get animals on OUR roof" and that was it. Most of their staff seemed fine, so I won't judge them all by this one guys attitude, but to say it stank is an understatement. Other notes of interest: *When booking, pay attention to which rooms you book, the premuim rooms are all in a newer larger building with good views over the marina, the standard rooms are layed out like a motel (external corridors, no balcony, etc) - although inside were of a good standard. *Check in really is at 4pm and wasn't negotiable, unless you pay $60 a night more for a room upgrade. Those are magically available. *The area shuts down after about 6pm, so if you've not got a car you're limited to the hotel restaurants (and the other hotels nearby) or public transport out of there. *If you've not got a car you've a couple of choices because you're not in walking distance of anywhere except Seaworld. 1. Taxis - if you're loaded. 2. Buses - $5 all day pass - good for all buses and the red trolleys.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC bay view”
Reviews.Author: Siam255
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new wing of the hotel that was built in 2004. The rm that we stayed in, Deluxe Bay View, was soooo beautiful!! It is totally worth the $$!! And I believe it's the first hotel that didn't cost an arm and the decor was modern and looked new... not dreary and old. If visiting the zoo or Sea World, this is DEFINITELY the best place to stay. The restaurants aren't that great but there's plenty around there that'll do. Right on the property, one can also rent and enjoy some water activities. Whenever we go back, I'm definitely looking to go there again. Just be sure to book it online... when I called in, it was more expensive than doing it online.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dirty, standard rooms - stay away”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSwenny
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in the two standard rooms we had for us and for our kids April 10-11, 2008, and we felt deceived. The advertisement on the hotel's website shows a photo of a modern looking lobby area. The modern part begins and ends at the lobby area. The standard rooms are actually motel style -- not a traditional "hotel" arrangement at all. The standard room conditions were atrocious. Stains on bathroom walls and door jambs, pubic hair from last guests around bath tub, bedding in our room had not been changed since last guests checked out, shabby and dirty carpets, old wall paper peeling away, messy low quality paint job with paint on fixtures and anything abutting the walls, scarred patched walls, wall light fixtures (some with actual working bulbs) askew, bathroom door hinge pins rusted and nearly out of the hinge, and hand lotion and fingerprints all over blowdryer in bathroom. These are just some of the things we immediately experienced upon checking in. The hotel staff was very polite when we called to ask if there had been some mistake, but there was no mistake. They apologized that the rooms had not been properly cleaned before we were shown to the rooms. No amount of politeness made up for the poor room conditions. After being unable to reach a manager, we asked the customer relations person to send housekeeping to clean the rooms while we went out for a couple of hours. There was no perceptible improvement upon our return, so it appears the Dana has an extremely low standard for cleanliness and hygiene. There was even a cloth napkin from a prior guest's room service meal still on the floor at the table after housekeeping supposedly cleaned the room. Use of vacuums in the room by housekeeping seemed to be optional, and it was not opted for in our case. When I spoke to a manager after the "special cleaning," we had to ask for new bedding to be brought to the room so we could change the sheets used by prior guests ourselves. I asked if we had been issued lower quality rooms because we had booked through a third party, hotels.com, and she assured me that was not the case and all the standard rooms were appointed exactly the same. How sad for this motel and all those who make the mistake of booking a standard room here. The only positive points I can think of are proximity to Sea World, the pools were decent, and the staff was polite but not particularly helpful or effective. This was the worst hotel experience I have had in 15 years. Ironically, the room rate was much higher than the Hyatt Regency at Garden Grove we had just stayed at for the prior three days. The Hyatt was terrific in all respects. Our last two days of vacation at the Dana in San Diego was a huge step down, and unfortunately we had to pay about 35% more for the privilege of taking that huge step down. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greatvacationsrus
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Dana Hotel during the last weekend of March (2008) and we had a wonderful experience with them. The room was exactly what we needed and we were just outside the gate of one of the pools, which my 6 y.o. son loved. All of the staff were outstanding, from hotel employees to the restaurant staff, housekeeping etc.. Everyone was very accomodating. The hotel is walking distance to Seaworld and there are also shuttle buses available if you need a ride. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and I look forward to visiting the Dana again in the future. The Janaways R.I.

Reviews.Title: “Dana the best in mission bay”
Reviews.Author: Trebeca
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, beautiful view of the Marina, nice areas, very clean, excelent service, nice room (we also received an upgrade), everything perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, but a couple deal-breakers”
Reviews.Author: 22jayjay
Reviews.Content: The Dana has put a lot of effort into renovating this older property. But it's hard to overcome certain, badly designed features. First the good stuff: --Excellent staff, helpful concierge. --Great location if you want to visit SeaWorld, Mission or Pacific Beach, Downtown, the zoo etc. Not too far from any of this. --Many updated features like granite bathroom countertops, stainless steel mini-fridge, clean chairs, newer furniture, etc. --Key-access gated parking lots --Firefly Restaurant (onsite) had upscale food & ambience, good service --Family friendly pool areas But the bad: --The standard room is extremely small. We had 2 queen beds (comfortable). But the walking space between the foot of the bed and the large armoires was about 24 inches it seems. For 7 days, this narrow path was our main walk-way in the room. --The electric outlet for our TV was loose and sometimes it had to be jiggled to get the TV to turn on. --Spots of black mold in the grout in the shower. Everything else was very clean as far as I could see. The bedspreads were dark patterned and the carpet was very dark. Loud, dark patterns always make me wonder what they're trying to hide. --Walls are rather thin. And the heavy mission style wooden headboards pound against the wall when neighbors get frisky. Kind of annoying for 10 minutes, everyday at 10 pm. --Blue Pearl Restaurant (also onsite) OK basic food, but overpriced because there's no ambience, just ho-hum service and nothing special on the menu. If the re-do was as clean and dramatic as their lobby area, I would have been impressed. But what you sense in the lobby is not what you feel in the rooms. This hotel was less expensive than some other options in the area, so I can't ding them on overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: mello614
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel via Travelocity a month in advance as I knew things would get hectic for the following week (spring break). I received a confirmation and the money was taken from my account etc. The plan was to drive down from Washington state. I emailed the hotel to let them know we would be arriving late on the night we were to arrive and received a reply saying no problem. We arrived at 5 A.M. due to traffic and bad detours--we were totally exhausted and only wanted to sleep as we had been driving since 9 AM the previous day. I go to check in and was told that we didn't have a room--that somehow something had happened maybe due to construction in the hotel but there was no room for us. I was beyond upset and furious as well as frustrated. The front desk lady was basically just trying to say "well sorry--here is a voucher for a nearby hotel for tonight. I called Travelocity to see what could be done and they said we couldn't get a refund for 7-14 days. So now I am stuck I have no room and the voucher was only good until checkout which was in 6 hours. I didn't have any extra money for lodging as i had paid it already and it looked like we would be staying in our little car for the rest of the trip. We went to the other hotel and slept for maybe 4 hours and received a call from the Dana saying they had a room now. The room was supposedly an upgrade with a marina view but it was pretty small. The paint was cracked and peeling on the ceiling, the entertainment center rumbled wildly when anyone passed by outside--so bad that I thought it was an earthquake. We purchased a movie to watch and the channel was so fuzzy you couldn't hardly see it and when i called maintenance the guy said nothing could be done yet they still charged me for it. They also charge for parking daily which i thought was a bit much. The people here need an overhaul in the customer service department to say the least--while i was complaining to the front desk lady about not having anywhere to go and needing a resolution, the security guard stepped forward at one point and said "nothing can be done--you need to leave" I will never stay here again and will tell anyone and everyone i know to avoid it as well. This was not my fault in the least bit- i did what I was supposed to do--booked in advance and to be treated with disregard was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerArizona
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review last week shortly after returning from my cruise and a stay at the Dana; however, I do not see it posted here. I was so impressed with the customer service and location of the hotel to try again. I stayed at the Dana on one of their "cruise and snooze" packages, which allowed for me to leave my car parked there while on my cruise. They shuttled me over to the cruise terminal at my appointed time and although, could not pick me up right away upon return, happily reimbursed me for my taxi ride. The location of the hotel and grounds was just lovely. I thought it a great value for what I paid. I will definitely stay at the Dana again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Iowatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Dana over spring break in March. We upgraded to the bayside room (newer room) which was large, very clean and had a great view of the bay/marina. I think our experience would not have been so positive in the standard no-view room. The pools were nice as we used both. The exercise room needed some help as the equipment was old and run down and the room was humid. The TV in the room didn't work well either. I had booked in October when parking was free, so when we checked in, the parking fee of $12 per night was waived. We walked to Seaworld, which wasn't too far from the resort. The staff was wonderful - I'd highly recommend this resort in the newer section.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: SillySallyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 1 night but we really enjoyed ourselves! The staff was friendly and went above and beyond for my husband and me. We had 3 different meals here at 2 different restaurants and all were excellent! The Blue Pearl seemed understaffed for breakfast but it was fine. The Restaurant by the pool was awesome, a little pricey but worth it. Loved the view, absoultely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed The Dana”
Reviews.Author: SFRookies
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Dana couldn't have been better. Only a 2 night stay but enough to want to go back. We did upgrade to the newer Bayview room which were fantastic. The staff was superb at both restuarants and the food was better than expected! How wonderful to enjoy breakfast outside on the patio at the pool in the glorious California sun, a great start to the day. The shuttle bus driver was fantastic and couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful as was the concierge. The front desk staff were helpful although one male front desk employee was a little less than friendly, but that is only one person and not a big deal...we all have our moments. I think perhaps some of the rooms in the older section might not have resulted in the same excellent overview as I love a view and we had a great one. Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “probably better deals out there”
Reviews.Author: xkcd
Reviews.Content: The staff messed up my credit card transaction. There was some big screen movie playing at night by the pool (thought it was noisy neighbors). Amazingly loud. I had to get out of there. Felt like motel 6. I'm never staying here again. I guess other people had better experiences than me so book at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “dana on mission bay”
Reviews.Author: BENIPAYOPHOTOGRAPHY
Reviews.Content: Stayed: Feb 19-22 2008 Just got back from our trip to San Diego. We stayed at Dana Mission Bay for 3 nights. I actually looked at the pictures on this site and on their website to see how it looked like. Unfortunately, I did see the good side of the buildings but not the older side. So this is actually more to show you guys how the rest of the building looks like and my amateur review of the hotel. Good: Customer service was great! I actually booked on the wrong dates but Gary, the front desk guy, booked me in without any problems. I have to say that these people are really very good. At the restaurant, their service was excellent too. The manager, ANna, was going around making sure everyone was happy. They really make you feel like it is a four star joint. Food was good too. Location was also good. However, we were too busy to enjoy the bay since we were out all day. By the time we got back, it was dark already. Perhaps, during the summer months with longer day, a guest can have more time to enjoy the sunset. The room: Its renovated with granite counter tops and nice looking tile in the bathroom. Microwave and small fridge are included. The room looks good (see pictures). BAD: Nothing serious! I thought that the price for the hotel was a bit much. The place looks like it should be $75 to $89 per night type of a place. Not that it run down but just comparing it to other 3 star hotel that I've been too. Most of what you will pay for is the location (see pictures). WATER was too hot. If you got kids, watch out. HOWEVER, their bay view rooms are located in the newer building, which looks pretty good (did not go inside / see pictures) Overall, this was a nice place to stay in. Quiet and comfortable bed to sleep on. The hotel is really trying to be a four star hotel. The service is a four star but the place is a 3 star because its an old building looking like an old motel but beautifully remodeled. If you choose pool view, 1st floor is best since it has a patio. If you choose marina view and actually want a view from your room, go to the second floor not first. Careful of the hot water. Marriot is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mrnmrsk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Dana for a quick get away and LOVED our experience there. Our room over looked Mission Bay with a comfortable balcony (you can't beat the view!)and was very clean and well appointed. We loved the robes and slippers that were provided and the upgraded bathroom ammenities. We also loved having a microwave and fridge in our room! The staff was very friendly and remembered us from a previous visit in December-which is ALWAYS a nice treat. We wanted do visit Sea World and were able to purchase discount tickets directly from the hotel and just walked right in the gate when we got there. That was a nice treat too! I think this hotel is a wonderful place to get away in San Diego and will stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “family field trip”
Reviews.Author: bonitaCalif_
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and checked in, the service was top notch! Finding milk and cookies for the kids and wine for the adults was perfect after our long day at the zoo. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the restraunte. Took a beautiful walk around the grounds and just enjoyed everything about our stay. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Dana”
Reviews.Author: starlynn
Reviews.Content: We booked a pre-cruise stay at the Dana on Mission Bay Jan. 31-Feb. 2, 2008, as part of a vacation package with Northwest Airlines. The room was clean and comfortable, and there was adequate seating for reading and playing cards. We also enjoyed the trail along the beach, directly behind the hotel. The hotel shuttle was quick and convenient, and we were able to visit the zoo and get to the cruise terminal without renting a car. We were happy to find two restaurants on site, and dined at the Blue Pearl several times. The food was quite good. We had cocktails at The Firefly one evening, but did not eat there because we had made other plans. This was our first visit to San Diego, and we'd be glad to stay at the Dana if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: melmom04
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Dana. We are a military family and were travelling with our three young children for a Sounthern California trip to Disneyland and Sea World. The location was great, the hotel was very peaceful and serene. The staff was very helpful, and my kids had the best time swimming in the pool. Definitely request a room with a view of the Bay. It's breathtaking. We were so sad when it was time to leave. We wished we had skipped Disneyland and spent all our time at Sea World and the Dana. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at The Dana for family gathering, Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelers_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana September 2007, we flew out to San Diego to visit our children and grandchildren. The hotel sits right on the bay beside a marina, its very close to Sea World and the beaches on the bay and ocean. We had a bay view suite..very smartly decorated with a really large patio and windows....to watch the sail boats and sunsets....the suite was just gorgeous and the bathroom spa-like....the kids loved the pool, jacuzzi and pool beach...they have a movie night by the pool on the weekends...we sat around the pool had drinks and snacks. Sea World is just around the corner...we took the free shuttle. I had some back problems...a nice young man (bellman) noticed I was having some difficulty walking...he got the golf cart and took me to the casual dining restaurant...he also picked me up and drove me back to the room...the hotel staff is wonderful..the kids got some buckets for the beach from one of the pool attendants...I was so impressed with the service we received while staying there...we also enjoyed a nice dinner in the Firefly. We will be back again this coming September. We plan on getting the same room to watch the rowing teams in Mission Bay and catch a few more stunning sunsets...this is a great hotel for families or a couple looking for a getaway..thanks for the wonderful vacation in San Diego...Peter and Jeanne Williamson, Florida

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: Carl-n-Summer
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a work trip. The Dana is a little older, but has been kept up very well--I think the rooms and public areas must have been remodelled recently. It's a charming place, right by a marina on Mission Bay. The on site restaurant is not gourmet, but it's very good. The bar/grill (Firefly) was to my tastes better than the regular restaurant--had a great time there each night after work. There are nice walks along the water you can take right from the hotel. I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views!”
Reviews.Author: plmom
Reviews.Content: When I travel to San Diego, I always book with the Dana. The staff is very professional, and the rooms are very clean. Each time I book, I ask for a room with a view of the bay (They have many that face the bay). It is georgeous! The pool is heavenly for relaxing at the end of a busy day. I have never been disappointed with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved THE DANA”
Reviews.Author: BEE3159
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a beautiful hotel with wonderful accomodations. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was wonderful and we enjoyed our stay. We will definitely book The Dana again when we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ORANGE90867
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequently in San Diego visiting our kids who live there. We stay at The Dana everytime we go, which is probably seven or eight times a year. The hotel is located in a perfect spot on Mission Bay. The rooms have balconies that overlook the water. The staff is always helpful and friendly. It is a very relaxing place for us. They even have a marina that we have rented boats at to go play on the water. We have been going to San Diego for 30 years and once we found The Dana we haven't stayed anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Great Room, Great Staff and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: DocBailey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I very much enjoyed The Dana. Our room was spacious and confortable not to mention the amazing view of San Diego Bay. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and courteous. Everyone there made it a point to make our stay wonderful. We dined at both of The Dana's restaurants. The Blue Pearl has a great breakfast and we really enjoyed everything we ate (and drank) at the Firefly! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to get away for a few days and enjoy a amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here whenever I can”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Dana for at least 20 years. It has evolved from a pretty dingy motel to a very nice hotel. The draw for me has always been location. It's right on Mission Bay and the grounds and views are beautiful. It is surrounded by parks, so you can walk along the waters edge for miles. There is a new section that looks very nice, I always opt for the older section made from old 2 story motel buildings. They've been radically redone and the furnishings are top notch. Get a marina view or pool view room. the gardens are gorgeous with lots of birds of paradise and other tropical flowers. Pricing is beginning to get to the top of what I'll spend, but service is always fantastic too. The staff is very welcoming. I've been here 3 times in as many months, and when I'm in San Diego I will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway at an overpriced property”
Reviews.Author: kanaia
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 3 star hotel. This property needs work and they are charging too much for what it is lacking particularly for VERY SMALL ROOMS. I was very surprised as compared with the photos online then I realized the photos were with a "fish eye" lens to give the impression they are larger. We were supposed to have a "pool view". If you squinted with one eye inbetween large trees and think foliage you could see some water in the pool so I guess technically it was a pool view but that was very misleading. There was no pool view yet that is what I paid for. Electrical outlet covers were not screwed into the wall (wires showing), the heating unit (wall unit) not sufficient for high ceilings/always cold, there was paint splattered on mirrors, walls, etc. and the worst thing was you had to let the water run for 15 to 20 minutes to get it even slightly warm and then not really warm enough to shower. If you braved the less than warm water it then sometimes would suddenly turn scalding hot. We were burned several times like this. Then there was the not so forthright issues. We called about the water but nothing was done and of course they had no rooms to move us to UNLESS we wanted to upgrade for an additional $80 per night. Parking suddenly wasn't free ($12 per night) after I was told it would be on the phone but other guests did get free parking. Also, I was quoted a rate including tax, etc. which went up $25 at checkout. When I questioned this they said that was just how it was and they'd talk the reservation person. When I asked it there was anything I could do (talk to the manager) they said no. This was supposed to be a romantic getaway but for the price the rooms were very small, not well kept as far as maintenance and there were hidden costs and unhelpful staff. Spend the same money somewhere else as this wasn't worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogie01
Reviews.Content: My family spent 2 nights at the Dana Inn and it was probably the worst experience in a motel we have ever had. We were there on a vacation and although it is close to SeaWorld (where we were going) there are many motels that are close and this shouldn't be a factor. When we arrived we were unaware of the $12.00 a night charge for parking (space was not limited because I counted 30 vacant spots in just our section). A few of our problems were: The toilet paper roll made such a noise in the room it sounded as if the wall was coming down. One night, I put popcorn in the microwave and blew a fuse in our room and the one next door. On our last night (Saturday) we were awaken at 1am by partiers in the room next to us. When we called the front desk the employee that was sent to talk to them told them our room called about the noise, and after the employee left the tenants beat on the wall yelling profanity at us to get up. After about 45 minutes of noise and listening to someone throwing up outside, another room complained . The front desk sent another employee to "warn" the partiers that they would call the police. This worked for a short time because they moved the party to another room but came back after a short time later. We were up from 1am until 4:30am because of the noise next door and The Dana's lack to take any action. This motel needs to decide whether they are going to be a facility that has parties, gatherings, etc. or is a place for families that are vacationing. Whatever they choose they should really discourage the other from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good people, nice place with a time share feel”
Reviews.Author: r2d2Seattle
Reviews.Content: I had a function to attend in Downtown San Diego, however, I wanted to stay close enough yet detached from Downtown. This particular hotel is in very close proximity to Sea World, the Zoo, downtown San Diego, and the beaches that one would not have to strain too hard to plan the day. They offer shuttles to and from the airport and many hot spots with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. They have two decent restaurants (The Firefly and The Blue Pearl) with really friendly and corteous staff as well. The price is great. They also have rentals (bike, kayak, jet ski, etc...) which makes for an easy entertainment. The beach was within walking distance. Their two outdoor pools and jacuzzis are just temperature perfect even for the blustery day that our trip has been blessed with. I would definitely come back the first chance I get. The only imperfection I can think of was the guest printer malfunction which they readily compensated for with their kind assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about the complimentary shuttle at the DANA”
Reviews.Author: rockette
Reviews.Content: When I made reservations I was given a phone number to call the Dana shuttle to pick me up from the airport. I did and was told the shuttle would arrive in 1 1/2 hours (90 minutes). Driving time is about 15 minutes. Strike One. Next day I asked what time the shuttle would take me to the cruise ship pier. The Carnival Spirit was the only ship in town and debarked at 4pm, for security reasons they wanted passengers on board no later than 3pm. Well, the Manager of the Dana tried to tell me debarkation time was 5pm not 4pm and he said: you go on the Norwegian ship. Well, I dont know what planet he is on, but he was wrong on both counts. Strike Two. The only shuttle from the hotel to the pier was going at 2:30pm, which takes 15 minutes and if there is a traffic problem you can wave your ship goodbye. Strike Three. While I waited for my taxi at 1pm I talked to a couple from B.C. and they had the same argument with the manager, but he did not care, maybe he runs a taxi service on the side? The shuttle was sitting in the parking lot for hours.... Conclusion: Forget about the shuttle and don't expect the Manager to accommodate you with anything, he is the most inept person I ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: scsw
Reviews.Content: Just returned two days ago from San Diego, where we stayed the first night in a hostel and two nights in Dana. The Dana is a very scenic hotel at a very decent price. My first impression of the hotel, even before I reached, was that it was very customer friendly. When I called saying that I was stuck in Old Town Station with no transportation, the staff offered to send their driver to pick me and my friends up. When we reached the Dana, we agreed that it was one of the nicer looking hotels for the price range we're paying. The rooms are located in different buildings, giving it a tropical terrace feeling. The landscape design is very nice and I enjoyed walking around the Dana. Check in was quick. I took a standard room with 2 queen sized beds for four of us. We slept soundly. Room was spacious and clean. The only complaint I have about the room is that the air conditioning and heater is a tad bit too loud. But once it gets to the temperature you set and shuts down, it's a peaceful night's sleep. It's in a very convenient location - about 10 - 15 minutes walk to SeaWorld. The hotel also provides a shuttle service to SeaWorld. One down side is that the restaurant there, Blue Pearl, is quite pricey. Definitely not for students trying to save money. However, it's located near Pacific Beach (PB) with lots of shops and restaurants. For those without cars, the public transport system in SD is very decent and will definitely get you where you're headed without much hassle. The Dana is a 10 minute bus ride from PB center and buses are pretty frequent. Had dinner at Great Moon Buffet - wonderful American, Japanese and Chinese cuisine for decent price (12 bucks for dinner buffet). There are also boat and bicycle rentals in the Dana itself. For those who are more adventurous, the prices aren't too bad. Check out was quick. However, we left our luggage with concierge for half the day. It took them at least 20 minutes to recover our luggage. They stored it in a different building and I was glad that they came back as a whole. This part spoiled the whole Dana experience for me. Overall, very nice hotel. The staff is friendly, just a bad experience with waiting on the last day. I'd give it a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: blessing06
Reviews.Content: After lots of research and reading the reviews we decided to stay at Dana. We only stayed for a night and we booked two rooms. The rooms were clean, spacious, and decorated nicely. Although the hotel can not control everything, at the price we paid they could have been on top of things a little more. On the first floor in the suites 1000 there is a public bathroom (park) that 4 homeless men decided to stay at. And for a single girl it is not the most comforting. We had paid for a view but we kept the blinds closed most of the time. Also there were kids skateboarding until 12:30 am until we called and complained and then people on the balcony partied until 3:00 am. So we didn't get much sleep. We complained via email and although it took some time, we were happy with the results. So stay on the upper floors and in the rooms 2000 not 1000, (the new section only) hopefully you will have views of the water and not the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: llmedeiros
Reviews.Content: We booked the vacation to relax as a couple with out our kids. We had spent four days prior at Disney with the children. We were excited for a little Rest and Relaxation. We stayed in the 600 building for two nights. The view was nice. However, the alarm in the vacant room next door at five in the morning that was loud enough to wake us up was a bit annoying. More annoying that the staff took 45 minutes to turn it off after I called. The beds were very uncomfortable. The family in the room above us, probably wouldn't appreciate the fact that we could hear their every word due to poor insulation. The concierge was fabulous and the massage that we had was wonderful. However I felt worse the next day due to the horrible beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KaiAnn
Reviews.Content: The Dana on Mission Bay was very nice. It has been remodeled and the lobby and surrounding area looks great. We usually stay at the Paradise Point but the Dana is well priced in comparison and their cancellation policy is much more lax than Paradise Point. The rooms are equipped with microwave, small fridge and a small bar sink. We stayed in the new section and I would highly recommend the new section as the old section does not look good. Try to get a room in the new section on the third floor to get the best views but if you have little ones it's nice to have the bottom floor as they have a nice grass area to play some ball or just sit on the lawn and capture the view. It's very close to Seaworld but not walking distance but easy access to everything. The only down side is that you are unable to hook up your own XBOX 360 or anything that would use the video inputs. They do it on purpose so you have to buy their games and/or movies. So when you have kids and you want to bring their XBOX, Wii or Playstation or a DVD Player you will be unable to hook it up and they do not rent out DVD players (again they want you to buy their movies) which is really petty and ridiculous in my opinion. Use the concierge they were very helpful in recommending places to eat. Overall the experience was great and I read many of these reviews complaining about the staff and honestly I think people demand a certain service but this isn't a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. For the price in comparison to Paradise Point it was good value. Paradise point feels more private and secluded and if you stay at their bay front rooms it's phenomenal but then you are paying over $600 a night it's pricey and the rooms are not that large and not renovated. Even just their bay view rooms are cramped and cost $400 - $500 a night. I got two connecting rooms at the Dana for less than the price of one room at Paradise Point on Thanksgiving week-end and there wasn't a 3 night minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TexasShasta
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Dana on Mission Bay for a family wedding, months before the event. We had so much trouble with our reservation and were so disappointed with the customer service at the hotel, we would never consider a return. Our reservation was for rooms set aside in a block for a wedding. However, while trying to sort out our problems, we heard and observed other guests who were not part of our party having similar difficulties. The staff, whether on the phone or in person, with the exception of our pleasant waitress at breakfast at the Blue Pearl restaurant, were clueless, unhelpful or rude. The property is lovely and the rooms are very nice. The location is great. But none of that offsets our experience with the staff. Fortunately, a nearby property (the Hyatt) helped turn this lemon situation into lemonade. For us, the Dana was not worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Bay View at Water's Edge”
Reviews.Author: tysontrip
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the newer Water's Edge and had a great room. All the rooms face the bay/ marina, are large and have great bathrooms. The carpark is outside the rooms which is handy for large suitcases. We dined at Firefly and had a great meal. It was a longer walk than expected to the Blue Pearl restaurant for breakfast - but it wasn't an issue - the guest laundry was on the way and we were able to do our laundry while we had breakfast. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly. We could easily walk to SeaWorld which is why we booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: sstreete08
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed at the Dana to surprise a friend for her birthday. We stayed in a suite and another room, though not adjoining the suite, was right next door. The grounds of the Dana are absolutely breathtaking and the service was impeccable. We were treated with great care and attention. As I mentioned, this was a surprise and several of the Dana employees worked hard to make it a success. When we were leaving we needed the shuttle to modify the pick-up time in order for us to catch our flight, they did so with no problem. There are two restaurants on the grounds: Firefly which is a sleek, modern eatery in front of the pool area(gorgeous set-up) and Blue Nile which is a "casual eatery" with great desserts! We stayed on the "newer" side as I noted on tripadvisor that there were two sides and the older side did not get good reviews. We loved our stay and I strongly encourage the Dana to change their website. It does not do this hotel any justice!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Bed and Other Problems - Clean, Good Service.”
Reviews.Author: Fatica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Dana last weekend for a wedding that I was attending there. I stayed in a "Standard Courtyard View" room with one king bed in the 400 building which is in the older section of the hotel. Service in the lobby was very good and everything was very clean. The room was average sized but the furniture was arranged awkwardly - with all the furniture bunched in one part of the room so it was hard to walk around but the other half of the room was almost completely empty. The place provided to hang clothes is right inside the doorway and next to the sink. Everytime I used the sink I was afraid I would get my clothes wet or dirty. The most important part of my hotel stay is the bed. A great hotel room would have a bed that you sleep better in than your bed at home. Our bed had a stiff mattress with a too-small fitted sheet that slipped off the mattress in the middle of the night - there's nothing comfortable about that. The only pillows provided were the fluffy cotton or polyester-filled kind. Overall, I would not recommend The Dana to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Dana miss this one”
Reviews.Author: pc43
Reviews.Content: Stayed in new block, top floor and views are awesome. Hotel clean if a tad sombre in decor, and service we received was good. Only faults could find are that Firefly restaurant would not make any substitutions to its menu - Blue Pearl rest. was most accomodating; and energy efficient bulbs used in rooms are too high a wattage giving stark light with no atmosphere. It is not cheapest place in San Diego, but has some class.

Reviews.Title: “We Want To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Letsagogo
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews written about The Dana we were somewhat hesitant to book our stay there. But the close proximity to Sea World conviced us to give it a try. What a wonderful surprise!! We had 8 family members booked into 3 suites in the new section. Each suite was spacious, clean, well stocked with amenities, and quiet. Our views of the bay (and the sunsets) were gorgeous. We ate dinner at the Firefly, used the pools, and had dinner delivered one evening from a local restaurant. The staff were courteous and helpful. And we were only 5 minutes from Seaworld! Everyone from the baby to the grandmother (that being me!) went home with happy memories of another successful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff. Very clean rooms. Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Lorusquartz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Dana during our honeymoon. When you first arrive on the property, it doesn't seem like a three star hotel. The rooms are small, but very clean. The bathroom is huge, though. After the first night I had a chance to walk behind the property and see the marina rooms, which are more. The view is beautiful. Very blue water and hills in the distance. Looked like a post card. The two restaurants have wonderful food. I actually like the Blue Pearl better. It is more casual and the choice of food is better. The people working there could not be nicer. The front desk will tell you how to get to each place you want to go in the city and they have worked out deals with the Zoo and other destinations for a flat rate if you are taking a cab. The Dana is across the street from Sea World. It is a nice walk. We've decided to go back every year on our anniversary because the staff and the people make you feel like you're a part of the family.

Reviews.Title: “Dana is Superb - Tony, Yorkshire, England”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTony
Reviews.Content: I did a huge amount of research on San Diego hotels before picking the Dana. Although it had mixed reviews, I felt on balance, it would provide what we wanted...and we weren't disappointed. We made sure we were in the new block, so can't comment on the older blocks. The room was big enough for 2 adults in a queens size and 2 children, 1 in a queens size bed and the other on a sofa bed. They are 15 and 13 and we still had plenty of room. The facilities and location were both excellent, and we were there for 10 nights. Our only minor complaint was the wait to get served for breakfast, but it wasn't a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: MichiMet
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting but fabulous four nights in Las Vegas, we arrived at the Dana in San diego to stay for 3 nights to visit Seaworld and San Diego Zoo. found our room to be rather average and the shutters on the windows block out virtually no light at all. You also certainly get the feeling you are living on top of other people at the hotel. This is a good spot if you are going to Seaworld, really close to it and has a free shuttle, but is not really close to anything else. Also if you are going to stay here I would recommend pay the extra money for the newer rooms as they looked much better. the restaurants are okay and good service, but I would recommend the Hyatt restaurant which is pretty much across the road - we had an excellent dinner there and also went back there for an equally great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “just got back.. dont listen to the bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: microcapper
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a great 4 day stay @ the Dana. We wanted to be within walking distance to Seaworld and the walk was 10 minutes. VERY EASY!!! We stayed in the new section and found our room to be very comfortable FOR 6 people!!! (baby slept on the floor). We did have one or 2 issues with staff but we found them VERY accomodating. Shuttle service to seaworld ,airport was a bonus!!!. I must admit the othe side of the hotel..the older side does look rather shabby, but the new side was great!!!! Also the pool area while there were alot of kids... WHAT DO YOU EXPECT NEXT TO SEAWORLD....RETIREES???? i did not find the music loud at all..I CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a great San Diego experience”
Reviews.Author: mrubiwara
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to Seaworld and away from the downtown scene for most of our stay. Our first night was at the Solimar Hotel in downtown which was excellent. At the Dana we learned that we had been given an upgrade to the newer section after originally being booked in the renovated older section. Each contact we had with the employees was excellent. We had to complain about the initial upgrade because they had put us on the first floor with immediate access to the park. Unfortunately the park attracted some homeless people and we didn't want to look at them from our window. They immediately put us on the second floor overlooking the Bay and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. It's not an inexpensive hotel in the summer, but we were prepared for that. In short, great service, excellent food at both their restaurants at a fair price, easy access to boat rentals and two very nice swimming pools. the other nice thing was that we were 15 minutes from Belmont Amusement Park on Mission Bay so we had some great moments there as well with our 7 yr-old and 12-yr old daughters. Can't complain about a thing, and we would return again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Two Miserable Hotel Experiences in One”
Reviews.Author: davefdavef
Reviews.Content: Getting your money's worth at The Dana is a full-time job--more like a miserable and protacted tech support battle than a relaxing vacation. Some basics first. The hotel is next door to SeaWorld, which means it's packed with families of screaming kids. Actually, The Dana is really two completely separate hotels--an old one and a new one--on the same property. So there are two restaurants (one Denny's-like and one fancy schmancy--both very good), two pools (both crowded, with loud music starting at 9am), and most importantly, two entirely different hotel experiences. The old part of the hotel is pretty much the worst decrepid motel you can imagine, where you can hear screaming kids in adjacent rooms at all hours, see light under your doorway all night, with the bed right up against the door. We switched to a newer room (the more expensive ones) after one very miserable night. The new rooms are large, quiet, and gorgeous, with balconies overlooking the bay. But here's the catch. Everything that doesn't work (the air conditioning, the light that won't turn off, etc.) requires day after day after day of calls to guest services, waiting on hold, waiting at the front desk, talking with an endless stream of downright nasty and incompetent hotel manager-types, waiting around for hours in the room for repairs that never happen, when all you want to do is get out and enjoy San Diego and to come back to a room where the basic necessities you're paying so much for actually work. It is for this reason that a stay at The Dana is a very unpleasant experience, and one that will leave you still needing a vacation. It's probably best to avoid Mission Bay altogether, which is generally a run-down somewhat seedy area of San Diego. And definitely avoid The Dana!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sea World...Service not so good.”
Reviews.Author: mikegodphx
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location if you are going to Sea World. It is literally less than 5 minutes away via car. Also, if you are driving in from Phoenix like me, I-8 basically dead-ends into the hotel. We stayed in the bayview area, which is the newer part of the hotel. We had a ground floor room which was awesome for the kids. We sat on the back patio and they played in the park right behind the hotel. Mission Beach is also a very short ride away, just across the bridge. There is a great place for breakfast in the Wave House right on the beach. You can also walk around the marina at the hotel and there is a small store that has a deli for morning breakfast or a light lunch and it has a small grocery area. The room was very spacious and I have no complaints there. Also, the room service was prompt and the food was good and not too overpriced. The problems that we had was service by the pool. It was extremely painful to get service there. It should not be that hard to get a beer and a glass of water. We went there several times and it did not matter, the service was always sparse and slow. i would stay there again for sure, but my first choice would be something on the beach for the kids. The rocks of the break wall are not that friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Dana, Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: chrisndawns3
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, including 3 boys (ages 8, 5, and 18mo.), just returned from a 4 night stay at The Dana. We have stayed at other resorts in San Diego in the past (Paradise Point, Catamaran, Loews Coronado), and this has been our overall favorite. We had a premium bayview room in the 'new' or Water's Edge section of the hotel. The room was very good size and slept all five of us comfortably...2 queen beds plus a sleeper sofa. There was a kitchenette with a small fridge and microwave (which was a necessity with an 18 mo. old). We were located on the 1st floor and had a large patio with a great view of the bay. A previous review stated that their review would have been negative had they been on the 1st floor, however, for a family with small children, we enjoyed the fact that our kids could go in and out from the patio without worrying about balcony heights. The patio was enclosed with a gate that led out to a grassy area. Yes, occasionally people passed by our room, but it really was not a big deal. The bayside pool was great, water temperature was perfect, and the poolside food from Firefly was fantastic. It was a great way to relax between 11 hour days at Legoland and Sea World. By the way, as other reviewers have stated, even though the hotel is very close to Sea World, I would recommend driving to the park as the last thing you feel like doing after a full day there is walking back to the hotel. Now, all of this does come at a price..we paid $309/nt for our room (which included breakfast for 2 at the Blue Pearl). That being said, San Diego is an expensive destination in the Summer, and I found this rate to be comparable, if not less than other hotels on the same level. I absolutely agree that the Waters Edge rooms are worth the extra money, especially with a family! We will return to The Dana in the future for its central location, great rooms (Waters Edge), and overall family friendliness!!

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: bickey11
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BELIEVE WHAT YOU SEE IN PICTURES. The Dana looks gorgeous in pictures, but in reality there is only one building in the hotel that looks like the pictures. The majority of the buildings look like low income housing units. The rooms themselves are cramped and DARK, i was there for a wedding and had to apply my makeup in the car because the lighting in the room was AWFUL. We were placed in the back by the secondary pool which was actually quite nice for children. They had pool toys and a sandy area for the kids, it's also where the pool bar is located. The Infinity Pool in the "UPSCALE" section of the hotel complex did not have a bar or refreshments, but rather was close to a restaurant and was not kid friendly. The rooms were fairly clean, the A/C units were installed close to the floor, so they really didn't cool the room at all, but the floor right next to it was nice and crisp. The location was GREAT for Sea World, they have a shuttle but the hours are limited on it. Kind of a far walk to Mission Beach, if you want to be close to the beach, I'd recommend staying at The Bahia, which is slightly cheaper and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the new section”
Reviews.Author: Nitrobrune
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Dana involved a business conference we were attending at the hotel. Please note something very strange - there aren't any bathrooms in the conference center or in The Firefly restaurant. You have to walk across the patio to the Lobby and use the restrooms there -- very strange and inconvenient. We stayed in the 600 building (old section) and were very disappointed. Our room reeked of Lysol spray when we first checked in. We had to air it out before we could even go inside. The room was on the first floor and we felt if you opened the shutters, everyone walking by could just look right in and see what you're doing. Absolutely no privacy if you want to enjoy the parking lot view or get some light into your room. The room was very cramped with way too much furniture crowded everywhere. The desk clerk said we had a kitchenette which I had to laugh at when we discovered that was a small refrigerator sitting on the floor with a microwave on top of it. There was no closet, instead a separate armoire took up valuable floor space and had a broken door. The TV stand was huge and tall as the clothes armoire with drawers under it. The bottom drawer was broken and had to be lifted each time you wanted to close it. The wall unit air conditioner was located in the dressing area next to one of the double sinks. So you froze while getting dressed. The room was so crowded (2 queen beds, table, 2 chairs, bench, 2 armoires, nightstand, refrigerator, microwave) that two people couldn't walk next to each other when going from the bed to the bathroom. I can't imagine staying there with more than 2 in a room. One really annoying event happened each day. Our maid would change the radio station on the clock radio and turn up the volume to some Mexican mariachi music. If we didn't remember to turn it down and put it back on smooth jazz EACH DAY, we were jolted out of bed in the morning. She also failed to leave coffee cups (paper) each day. The new section looked nice with very large patios. If we return next year for the same meeting, I hope we can stay there rather than in the "slums." We ate at The Firefly several times and liked the size of the dinners. They offered small, medium and large plates. We found the flatbread pizzas offered under "small" plates to be more than adequate for dinner ($12). They had several very good toppings ranging from steak to shrimp. They also offered macaroni and cheese at $9. We had a dish of this one night and thought the flavor was good, but it was extremely dry, maybe due to our eating at almost 9:00PM. The second time someone in our group had it, it was creamy and flavorful and also earlier in the evening. Service was slow. We do not recommend trying to walk to Sea World. It isn't just across the street as someone said. We tried to buy our tickets in the Lobby as we were told we could do. The consigierge was in training that day and no one else was able to help us. We decided to drive over and pay $10 to park. The hotel offers a shuttle, and it only runs in the morning and the evening but it's easy to spend the whole day at the park. Lots to do. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful most of the time. It's a shame they just don't get rid of these old buildings and replace them with some wonderful new rooms. Instead, they remodeled the rooms and filled them with oversized inexpensive furniture that isn't holding up very well. The location is good, but do stay in the new section if you go. It's worth whatever extra you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: maxBrighton
Reviews.Content: Yes it looks great on the website, yes the rooms are gorgeous, beautifully decorated but understand you are in a conferencing/wedding venue and that all around you are happy couples/companies partying outside your hotel room. We booked the most expensive rooms at 350$ per night (two rooms as we have teenagers) for 4 nights and every night something happened right outside our window. When driven to talking to the management he informed us that we were the ONLY people that had EVER had aproblem. My advice would be, if you want to stay at Disney got there, its cheaper and probably quieter!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time -Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: RoseCityTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new portion of the Dana on Mission Bay last week. The room was very nice with two queens and a sleeper sofa, with small fridge and microwave. The room was not huge, but large enough. Nice patio with two chairs and a recliner chair and a view of the Marina/ Bay. The desk employees were always nice and helpful. I did not get a chance to view a room in the "old" part of the complex, but could tell it was much older. Reserve a room in the "new" part. The complex was very nicely landscaped, and the "free" breakfast for two coupons for use at the "Pearl" restaurant was a nice plus -- the food there was quite good. Sea World is 5 minutes away, and it is an easy drive to downtown and little Italy from the Dana. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Toughtest 9 Days in a While”
Reviews.Author: firegod21
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after booking back in October. The hotel had sent us a pamphlet showing how beautiful everything was.
