I could not understand what was so bad about the "old side" UNTILL......We arrived. Room was smaller than out bedroom at home, dated, smelly and downright scary with the woodshake fire hazard roof. Recent remodel consisted of new carpet and paint. All walls were a diffrent shade. Bathroom was cramped. Went to the front desk and complained. Terrible customer service. Finally offered $40 a night upgrade to new side. Went and checked it out. Called wife and told her to pack up stuff and kids we were changing rooms. New room had king and fold out couch. Room was beautiful could not get any better. Beautiful view of bay. And the homeless people living in the park. And the fire pits used by rowdy drunks. Oh well. Pool was nice. No enforcment of pool rules so it was a dumping ground for parents to send kids. Hotel charges $10 a night to park. Was told it was a new system. I picked busy times in Lobby to complain and usually got my way. Hotel comped parking but is so limited you still ended up parking and walking a ways. Not fun with 3 small kids. Credt card was charged out at front lobby as the charged us a $100 per day incidentals charge as well as the $40 a day upgrade. Again I complained enough and hotel comped room and refunded charges. Racked up after 9 days. The web site does not show the old side at all. Stay in the new side if you go here. I suppose I expect a little more after spending over $4000 to fly myself and wife and 3 kids down there for vacation. I do recomend the jet ski rentals $100 an hour. Overpriced, yes but was a blast. Dont bother with room service it sucked and was overpriced. The dragonfly by the pool was a nice elegant romantic resturant the drinks were strong and food superb. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: lvemt1
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here for Jun 5th through the 7th and had a family emergency at the last minute, having to cancel at the last minute. Canceling less than 24 hours notice, they charged me one day stay. I attempted to contact the hotel, letting them know of my troubles, and they were of no help, restating their cancellation policy. I find this very troubling that one experiences an emergency, and the hotel only cares about one thing, $$! I will NEVER book here again, and I suggest you rethink booking here for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Dana Inn, San Diego, Zoo, Legoland, and more!”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaMeNutts
Reviews.Content: San Diego was a lot of fun. We did a lot during our stay. The dates of travel were Dec 26, 2005 through January 1, 2006. I know this trip was awhile ago, but I thought the details might still benefit some people. Day 1 -- we flew out of O’Hare in Chicago. We flew Southwest Airlines which really stunk. We had to be up at 6am to catch our flight. We landed and took off at least 4 times during our flight there. It was a real pain in the butt. It was almost like riding a bus because we kept stopping to let people on and off in different cities. Also Southwest Airlines doesn’t reserve you a seat, they have a first come first serve type of thing. I highly recommend going online 24hours before your flight to get your boarding pass. If you get pass A you have first choice. Then pass B and then pass C. If you are traveling with a large group of people (We had 4) you want to have pass A so you can all get seats together. That was really a pain to have to try to find internet access at our hotel to print boarding passes so we could get pass A so we could all sit together. But luckily our hotel in Cali had internet with printer. After arriving in San Diego at 2:20pm (cali time) we has to take a bus to the car rental place. I believe we used Alamo. We didn’t have our car until after an hour because they had such poor planning going on there. The line was out the door, and they didn’t have enough cars for people who had already reserved them. We reserved ours at least 6months in advance and there was still a problem. After the rental car mess, we finally made it to the hotel we decided to use. Dana Inn on Mission Bay. This was excellent! We LOVED the tropical cabana look of this hotel. After a long day we decided to head out to find food. We ate at Guava Beach. Everything tasted like fish, even the French fries. Day 2---San Diego Zoo---a major let down. Ever since I was a little kid, my mom and I wanted to go to the San Diego Zoo. It was nothing like I had seen on all the Travel Channels and such. I would probably never go back. Personally I think the Brookfield Zoo in Chicago is much better. I even think that our tiny zoo in Kalamazoo is pretty close to the same. It wasn’t anything spectacular as far as zoos go. We ate breakfast at a place called Jimmy’s before going to the zoo, which their food was good. The zoo had good food too, considering it was zoo food. Then we went to Baker’s Square for dinner, also very good. Day 3---For breakfast we ate at an interesting place called “Hide Away Café” and it was wonderful food! We went to Legoland in Carlsbad. We had called before we left to ask if we had to purchase a ticket or if we could do a shopping pass. They let us in on a shopping pass which was between 1-2 hours (I cant remember). They held our charge card incase we didn’t make it back to the gate before our 2 hours ran out. Mom and I went shopping while Dad and my Husband went around exploring the park. This pass was awesome because we were able to roam the park and go shopping, we just couldn’t ride rides or see any attractions. When it got close to our 2 hours time limit we went back up and told them we had more shopping to do so they extended it 1 hour. This was perfect. We were able to take pictures of all the cool Lego things and finish our shopping. It was free, and definitely worth the time since my Dad loves Legos as do my nephews. We also visited Carlsbad Premium Outlets. We ate at Ruby’s Diner, but the food was horrible and I actually think it is what contributed to me feeling sick for the rest of the day. We also went shopping at another place later that day and then everyone ordered Pizza, which I didn’t eat because of feeling sick from Ruby’s Diner. Day 4--- Denny’s for breakfast! Then to the Wild Animal Park. This was WAY better than the Zoo. They had an awesome safari ride through the open savannah where the animals roamed. It was really cold in December though, so bring a jacket. We also got to go at Sunset and it was really pretty. Also, we waited in a line that took about 2 hours to get through to do this, but it was the best thing at the whole park. We also ate lunch there which cost $55 for 4 people to eat hamburgers! Very expensive, but the food did taste good. For dinner we ate at Sizzler, which is always good. Day 5--- Probably the worst day of the whole entire trip. We ate breakfast at Cocoa’s Café, which was good. We went on the Hornblower Whale Watching Tour…please see my review on this. It was horrible. Everyone was sick on the boat, including my mom and I. We only saw 1 whale, which took forever to find and wasn’t even easy to see. We did see sea lions which was cool. But not worth the amount of people being sick and the amount of money paid. When we returned back to our hotel we had to spend most of the day lying around recouping from the trip. Hubby & I walked around the Bay and hotel taking pictures while Mom laid in the bed sick. Later after everyone was feeling better, we went to Horton Plaza, which was awesome. We ate dinner at the Panda Inn there and it was very good. This mall was great. Day 6--- Old Town. Breakfast at IHOP. We went through all the shops at Old Town. It was very neat and worth the time. We ate lunch at a place called Cyote Café, because we wanted “Authentic” Mexican food….and it was not good at all. Wouldn’t eat there again. For dinner we went to Tony Romas and the food was good there. We went to a Peir 1 outlet store, which was really awesome and had a lot of good deals. I would def. return there. We packed our bags to go home. Day 7---Went back to Jimmy’s for breakfast. Then later that afternoon went back to the Gaslamp District (Horton Plaza) and had lunch. We had to leave today, so we just walked around for a short time and then returned the rental car. That was the end of our trip, except for the lousy flight home on South West Airlines!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price (stay in the NEW SECTION!)”
Reviews.Author: Court_SF
Reviews.Content: There are two parts to this hotel--the old side and the new side. Going from one to the other is like crossing the metaphorical tracks to the bad side of town. We narrowly escaped being on the old side--the hotel offers a rate for SDSU, and my sister, whose graduation we were attending, suggested that we stay here. The rate was sold out, so we paid something like $20-40 more to stay in the new section of the hotel. TOTALLY WORTH IT. You will be tempted to save the money, but trust me--get a new room! They are fairly large, newly constructed, and have nice bathrooms. Ours was on the third floor facing the bay. It had a lovely view and balcony, and even a little skylight in the bathroom. Also, free internet access and a kitchenette. We visited the other side of the tracks because some family members got the good rate. Rooms are small, dark, cramped, and depressing. They are old and ugly and slightly reminiscent of the Bates Motel. Stay away!!! The restaurants were pretty good, the Blue Pearl is basically a Denny's (good for breakfast), and Firefly is the hotel's attempt at modern cuisine (better for small plates and cocktail than a meal, IMO). All in all, the new side was pretty nice, esp. for the price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stat at THE DANA”
Reviews.Author: blucy22
Reviews.Content: The hotel has two sides: one newer beautiful side and one older side that should be torn down. Unfortunately, we stayed on the older side, the beds were horrible and the a/c never seemed to cool the room. The plus sides, were that the bathroom was nice and we had a great view of the bay. The pool on the older side is also great with a nice spa. On our last night we ate at the Firefly which was fabulous: service and food were both fantastic...as well as the ambiance. We had breakfast at the Blue Pearl every morning which was part of our package and it was excellent. We will return to the hotel but will only stay on the newer side.

Reviews.Title: “will return. great value. nice location”
Reviews.Author: happinessruns
Reviews.Content: i was a bit concerned based on some reviews here, but i found the hotel to be just fine. yes, the decor was a bit outdated, but the room was clean and well stocked with coffee and towels. the bed was comfortable. the staff was helpful and professional. having a shuttle from the airport is an added perk. the firefly is a lovely restaurant in the day and at night. i would most definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: TAMN8R2
Reviews.Content: My cousin had her wedding reception at The Dana and all of us from out of town decided to stay that night at the hotel. The reception was superb! They did a wonderful job with the decorating and were very attentive to all of the guests. Our rooms were in the smaller building, looked "older" that all those beautiful white buildings you see in the photos. However, there was no problem with that! The bride and groom stayed on the other side of the resort. Our rooms were just fine! Nothing to complain about, the bathrooms were a little weird, not in a bad way, they were just odd. We had breakfast at the restaurant there, the food was great. The view is absolutely amazing. I will, most certainly, if I have an opportunity, stay at the Dana again. I might check into the other rooms, not for any reason other than for a change in experience.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: beccabob97
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Dana Inn. We had booked 5 nights at a comfort inn at Hotel Circle and hated it. We drove around on our first night and came to the Dana Inn. They were booked but had openings after the weekend, which is what we took for the last three nights. We were so thankful. We were in an older section overlooking the bay. It was a fairly dark room, but clean and nice. The beds had double sheets (to cover the blankets) and the bathrooms were very nice and clean. In the older section where we were, it had a view of the bay but I didn't feel able to use it because the window opened to the walk way. Since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, this wasn't as important as the cleanliness. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but heard it was good. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The pool area was very nice. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: gogrammygo
Reviews.Content: I had read many of the reviews on Tripadvisor before choosing The Dana on Mission Bay. Being from the Midwest and knowing nothing about the San Diego area, Tripadvisor was a great help! Our choice could not have been better. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the Mission Bay. The room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the plantation shades at the sliding balcony door. The room was clean and most surprising, very quiet at night. Up until about 9:30 or 10:00 you could hear jets taking off from the San Diego airport, but after that it was so quiet. The bathroom was well outfitted with hairdryer, makeup mirror, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Bathrobes and slippers were also provided. One of the hotel's two pools was just a few steps away. The food at the Blue Pearl was very tasty and the friendly manager was very helpful answering questions about local attractions.This hotel is located in the perfect spot for Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and all the beaches. It was only a short drive to Cabrillo National Monument or Point Loma lighthouse. I would very strongly recommend the Dana on Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax with kids”
Reviews.Author: KatSG
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and will absolutely stay there again. We have a 3.5 year old and a 9 month old and we wanted a place where we could stay in if we needed to. The property is well-kept, our room was very comfortable, and we spent a lot of time just relaxing at the hotel. Our room was in the "older" updated part of the property, with a patio off the room next to the pool. This was perfect for us because we could put the kids to bed then enjoy a bottle of wine on the patio. The staff was attentive and accomodating and everyone was patient and sweet. The conceirge helped us find something to do when the forecast called for rain all day. The hotel's bistro was well-prepared to deal with kids and very accomodating. The food wasn't great (don't bother with cocktails--stick to beer and wine), but the portions were generous and who cares as long as no one looks twice at your screaming three-year-old? We also had food delivered to our room two nights, which was very convenient. I've become suspicious of people on this site that complain that hotels are trying to be upscale but fall short. Anyone who is expecting luxury for less than $400 a night is just cheap or delusional. The Dana isn't trying to be something it's not. It's a very comfortable hotel for families or people who want something better than Motel 6, want to be close to attractions, take a dip in the pool or hot tub, and still have money left over to do fun things.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Lucas_Brice
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I should say that there are two parts to The Dana, a newer section and an older section. We stayed at the newer section. I have read here that the experiences of people who stayed at the older section are not necessarily the same. Having said that, our stay at The Dana was a good one. There were virtually no problems with the room. My wife was attending a conference at a nearby hotel and I mostly stayed in the room during the day, working on my laptop. When we got to our room I was dismayed to find there was no desk in the room. Yes, there is a round table with a couple of chairs but the table was too high for me to use it to type on the laptop, so I had to use my lap. This was disappointing but ultimately, I worked around it. The other thing that we didn't like was that the bathroom was as dark as a cave. One of the lights was out, but I could see that even if the bulb had been replaced, it still would have been pretty dark. If you are a woman and you want to put on makeup, you're going to miss not having a bright bathroom, although there is an enlarging mirror. Okay, other than these two relatively minor things, the we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and nice. The staff was friendly and when we needed things sent to our room, they arrived quickly. There are two restaurants and they are both excellent, and reasonably priced, especially when compared to some other hotels named Catamaran whose restaurant prices are really high. The Dana is the closest hotel to Sea World and it was nice being able to drive back from there and only having it take about 5 minutes. You could even walk to Sea World from the hotel; the walk takes about 15 minutes. The view of Mission Bay out the window was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: juxie
Reviews.Content: As we have three children, finding a hotel that has standard rooms large enough for five is tough and limits your selection. I was able to book the Dana for Presidents Day weekend through their website. We booked a King room in the new section with a sofa bed. We drove down to San Diego and spent the day at Sea World the went to check into the room after dinner that evening. THE ROOM: We were given a room in the new section (as requested) overlooking the Marina. It was nice and large. I called the front desk and requested a crib (had forgotten to do that when reserving a room) and they delivered on within 15 minutes (which is much faster than other hotels have been). The "double" sofa bed was actually only a twin, but that was fine with us as we had brought a blow up air mattress for my son. There was plenty of room for everyone we could still move around. We had a nice balcony with a table and two chairs. The bathroom was spotless and really nice with a natural skylight and wall lights (no florescent lights). The toilet had a quiet flush on it and my son loved that there were q-tips and cotton balls in the bathroom along with the shampoo, mouthwash & conditioner (little things impress 9 year old boys). There were also two robes and slippers for use. There was a nice sink in the bathroom with a fridge and microwave (they even had a recycling bin under the sink). It was very comfortable and quiet (although you could hear the airplanes from time to time). THE POOL The kids loved in. It was heated with nice views, good size jacuzzi. The pool on the old section was also nice, although no views, but they had ping-pong and other games as well. The bar would put any drinks in plastic cups for you so you could take them to the pool area. THE CONS Not many, and we were there over presidents day weekend, and the were fully booked. No rooms available at all. Our room was not cleaned until 3:30 in the afternoon - which was a bit late for us as we left in the morning before 8:00 and were back to relax and clean up for dinner at 3:00. THE RESTAURANT: BLUE OYSTER Breakfast is available at the Blue Oyster in the old section, and definitely has a dated feel to it. The food was okay. Nothing great, but average hotel breakfast food. The service was slow (had to ask for things several times, including coffee refills). Would not go out of my way to eat there, but it worked for breakfast. Would defiantly stay there again when we return to San Diego. The staff (excluding the Blue Oyster staff) were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dana is Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde”
Reviews.Author: ryan360guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Using TripAdvisor to search for a comfortable, clean hotel with nice pool for my daughter to swim in. When we arrived at SAN, the complimentary shuttle to and from Dana had already left. So we called the hotel to ask when the next shuttle will come to pick up from SAN. She said, everyhour on the hour. We couldn't wait there that long so she told us to take a taxi and they will reimburse the fare (not the tip). When we arrived, my wife and daughter didn't look impressed because it reminded them of a motel or a bungalow. The bldg is mostly made out of wood except for the new section overlooking the bay. The staff was super nice, especially Kevin the bellman and Ana the mngr at the Blue Pearl. They both went out of their way to accomodate us. Kevin gave us a ride to Sea World after we missed the shuttle again. The swimming pool was great. Anyway, the rooms we booked thru Travelocity, came with free breakfast for two everyday. Priced at $169/night w/breakfast or $159 w/out (thru Dana). The only problem, it's a set menu of 2 eggs or pancakes or french toast, then 4 sausages or 4 bacon, then hash brown, and toast, then coffee,or tea or juice. So for the next 3 mornings that's what we ate. It kinda got old after the third day. Imagine if I booked for 5 nights. Yikes! If your going to order pancakes or french toast, you'll overload on carbs for sure because you'll have pancakes, 4 pieces of toast, and hashbrown. That's why the second day we ordered eggs to balance carbs with protein since we were going to get toast and hash brown anyways. The two breakfast was enough for the 3 of us to share. Back to the rooms. The first night, it was terrible! Travelocity advertised the rooms as new rooms overlooking the marina. When we got there it wasn't the new section but the refurbished. The room was small and cramped with 2 queen size beds. There was no vent blower in the bathroom except for a tiny window near the ceiling. My wife hated that since she had to follow right after my using the restroom. Guys you know what I mean. And did I say it was a small room? The refurbished room was noisy because of the wood structure, and wooden hallway. We were on the bottom floor so we can hear our upstairs neighbor with toddlers who kept running back and forth, and playing with the noisy, banging cabinets. Our room sounded like a bowling alley. The walls were not very sound proof. We slept terribly. Everytime someone upstairs had to go to the bathroom we can hear their footsteps. Even very late at night we were awoken because of the footsteps. The next morning we complained and told them we were checking out to another hotel (a brand name hotel). We also told them that when we booked the rooms it stated "new" rooms. We showed them the print out from Travelocity. So she said no problem she can give us the new section rooms overlooking the bay. The new section is really nice, roomy, quite and wonderful view of the bay. It's made out of cement and had an escalator. The beds weren't all what i've read in TripAdvisor. It was clean but average. By the way, the newly refurbished room we originally booked overlooking the marina was actually overlooking the parking lot which overlooks the marina. If an SUV parked in front of your room on the first floor, then you'll be overlooking the SUV. All the rooms use a pull-out cabinet that has a spring like action when pushed back-in makes a banging noise. So at one point, we heard our neighbors from upstairs, downstairs, left side, right side all opening and closing their cabinets. The sound proofing was not up to par. Parking is free and the location between LaJolla, Old Town, and other tour sites is great because it's situated mid way of these sites. The Firefly restaurant was above average, except for their $6.50 dry chocolate cake. I think it came from a Safeway or Albertson. My wife and I shared the "paella" which was excellent. Probably one of the best. (We're from San Francisco, CA) My daughter ordered cheese pizza shaped like a fish from the kids menu. She said it was the best pizza ever. If you like Mexican food make sure to go to Old Town. You can also visit the first Mission built in the area -Mission San Diego . In the future, I will put more weight on how many stars the hotel is rated instead of the reviews. The Dana is a 2 star Inn. I guess reviews are all relative to ones expectations. If your staying at the Dana, make sure to stay in the newly built section. If you don't, I think you'll be disappointed. One more thing, we we're told by a nice fellow from a rental car to check on-line for great discounts, before renting cars. We rented a compact car for $31.99 per day, The Dana was renting it for $39 per day thru the same car rental. But we were told afterwards by the person in the rental place to check on-line. We could have gotten the special for $24 per day (all unlimited mileage).

Reviews.Title: “Great For Families With Small Children..Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: My3sonsMom
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay here.....we booked for 4 nights and did the whole Sea world/ Zoo trip. My kids loved the whole experience Our check in was delayed and a bit slow but the staff was very courteous the entire time. We traveled with several other family members so I was able to see all types of the rooms. If you can afford it you are WAY BETTER OFF staying at the new section. The view is great and we booked a bottom floor room with 2 beds and a sofa bed. We have 3 small boys under the age of 5 so the newer section was a lot nicer due to the larger room and each has its own balcony. I selected the bottom floor because the patio had a small gate around it with its own private gate to exit your room onto the marina side. This afforded me extra peace of mind that my 3 year old would not push a chair to the rail and jump over the private balcony. My husband also had a bungee cord in the car and we just tied that around the latch of the patio gate which kept my little ones safe inside our room area. The service at the Dana is excellent...I felt like royalty because any time I called the front desk or room service ...they addressed me as Ms. Hunt before I even identified myself. The only problem I did encounter was when the crib I requested came the man set it up in a flash and once he left I saw a jagged broken wood spoke that would have surely caused loss of an eye or worse...when I called they rushed over a playpen instead...which wasnt as good as a crib...but my baby seemed fine once I used our own bedding. ALSO THE ROOMS NEED MORE LIGHTING...VERY DARK. But newer nonetheless. THE DANA NEEDS TO CHECK UP ON THEIR MAID SERVICE...SHE COULD HAVE DONE A WAY BETTER JOB AT TIDYING UP. The restaraunt food was very good at the Blue Pearl....perfect for families trekking off to Sea World...they even have an aquarium with all the Nemo fish inside it that my boys flipped out over. BE SURE TO CHECK FOR OTHER RATE PACKAGES ON THIS SITE THAT OFFER THE BED AND BREAKFAST SPECIAL.. wE ORIGINALLY booked thru the hotel site ...then I noticed a better rate with breakfast at the restaraunt included at the same price...I emailed Becky at the hotel ..she was awesome and she granted us the same rate with breakfasts included. The portions were HUGE and we just spit it with our younger kids with plenty to spare. WE spent $199 a night with 2 breakfast passes each morning thru the hotel...it was a great stay! If you need another hotel choice to consider...I was looking into the Bahia...I saw it across the bay from our patio room and it looked really nice on the beach room side. Also they have a fun looking old fasioned ferry boat that cruises the bay every night thru that hotel...we enjoyed watching it from our room and could hear all the disco music and lights going as it paddled by..we wished we were on that dancing and having a cocktail but had too many kids with us :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nelleke
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I have really nothing negative to say about this hotel. The staff was above average, always willing to help you and make you feel comfortable. Our room was great. Had everything we need, very good bed, very clean, many extra's and a good view on the marina. The pool was also good. There is a jacuzzi. And there is a towel service at the pool. And a lunch ordering service. The Firefly is one of the two restaurants at the hotel. It's a trendy restaurant and the food was above average! The hotel is close to Sea Word. A free bus is going to and from Sea World a couple of times a day.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a little pretentious”
Reviews.Author: JWUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days over New Year. The hotel has a great location if you want to be near the sea but don't expect to walk to anywhere else from here it is isolated. The hotel has two sides to it. The newer section where we stayed was new, clean with nice views. The rest looked somewhat wornout from the outside. The breakfast at the Blue pearl was a standard affair. Don't bother with dinner there. The whole place has the feel of somewhere that desperatly wants to be 4 or 5 star but can't quite make it. Rather overpriced for what really amounts to a good motel in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FromTheBu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the newer area of The Dana, and it was quite nice. I was on the ground floor and the room opened to the bay...delightful. The room was spotless and the furnishings up-to-date. As others have stated, you must have a car if you are going to stay at this relatively isolated property. But, hey, it's Southern California...of course you need a car! My only complaint was that the free wireless did not work in my room (I guess you get what you pay for), so I had to take my iBook to the lobby for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: toorollingstoned
Reviews.Content: Our son was graduating Marine Corp. basic training and I booked the hotel for my family based on the reviews on this website, (love this site!). My family can't stop talking about the wonderful time they had and what a great hotel it was. They upgraded our room, without a request from us, to a water view for no extra charge. The staff was extremely professional and courteous. The room was to die for with very elegant appointments and touches. Don't hesitate, book a room today.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LLTVancouver
Reviews.Content: Attractive setting and a very nice property. The location is not within walking distance of much except SeaWorld, but a short drive from many attractions. Two nice places to eat on property. Two pools are very good, esp. the newer one. Free shuttle to some locations. Readily-available internet in front lobby. Free newspapers. Some days are substantially more expensive than others. So-called view units would be worth the extra, were it not so substantial also; "garden units" are just fine. Front desk can be less than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: theridleys
Reviews.Content: Took our granddaughter to San Diego for the weekend from L.A.f by train. She loved it. Booked the Dana even though some of the review were spotty. Arrived late and check in was a breeze with the clerk really trying to accomodate our request for a king bed plus a sleeper sofa for our granddaughter. Got exactly what we asked for - it was in the new section looking out on the bay. Beautiful room - lovely view - perfectly manicured grounds and friendly staff. Would recommend to anyone. The Blue Pearl Restaurant was a little bit of a hike but with reasonable prices, abundant well prepared food and very kid friendly. The Dana (plus Shamu, of course) made the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Excellent Environment”
Reviews.Author: EthanJay
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers exactly what its pictures show: comfortable environment, two swimming pools, bay view rooms that overlook that harbor. It is true that rooms in the older section are not as nice as the new ones -- but they are not as expensive either, which is a bargain considering the fact that these rooms are on the same property as the more expensive, newer ones. I find the quality of the older rooms acceptable, though not spectacular. There were reviews written about the noise levels - we didn't find it to be that big of a factor as other guests really respected each other. We only heard other guests as they were getting out of their car or passing by our room. This property is best if you have your own car and want free parking as well as peace and quiet when you are at your hotel. This setting juxtaposes the hotels by the beach, which allow you to just step out of your room and go to the beach. Those hotels have a relatively noiser environment and parking there costs extra. The Dana is actually only five minutes away from the beach, so every time we wanted to go to the beach and eat there, we just drove there. The only challenge was to find parking, but that wasn't too difficult either. Make sure you go back to the site often to check the room rates - they change it from time to time, so be sure you get the lowest rates when you check in. The big plus is the fact that there is a computer AND a printer at the front desk for guests to use -- the obvious downside is the fact that there is usually somebody using it. I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of the beach all the time and have a big party. The two-story motel style buildings also provide a nice communal environment.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: KD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Dana in Oct 06 & like others I felt it was a bit over-priced for what it was. We ended up in the older section, even though I requested the newer section. Rooms were ok, view was nice of the marina (you pay extra for that). Mostly it was quiet, except when people were walking past on the balcony, which seemed to vibrate through our room. If you were on the second floor you have to lug your cases up the stairs. We tried both restaurants while we were there. Felt the Firefly was over-priced for what it was. Seemed the waitresses were more interested in their social gathering that serving us most of the time - we felt we were interrupting when we needed something. The other casual restaurant seems to employ more mature workers and this was certainly reflected in their attentiveness compared to the Firefly. You would need a car if you wanted to try other restaurants. Both pools looked nice. Free internet in the lobby was a nice touch for those without laptops. Overall, probably wouldn't stay there again as I felt it was too over-priced for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: aussie82
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the dana hotel however my room wasnt ready till 4pm. So what we did was go over to sea world and had fun! It was beautiful in the dana in, their pool, the sorroundings was nice. They had free net access and cable tv (including mtv). The rooms were clean, comfy beds and good food services. Their menus were nice and breakfast was yummy! Down at the lobby is also a nice gift shop for san diego souveniers. They have a free shuttle that goes to sea world and if you do stay at the dana sea world is a MUST! :) Its a 10 -15 min walk to seaworld if you decide to go on foot. I miss that place already but I wish they had more shops there.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foxbudd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the newer section of the hotel which it would seem is the place to be! Very clean, smart and spacious. Patio overlooked the bay and the tramp with his thong on which made for abit of entertainment! Great location for relaxing, running, cycling etc but need a car for resturants etc. Seaworld is right next door and you are pretty central to most things so a good location. I would definatley stay again but only in the newer rooms (1000's and 2000's).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the Dana”
Reviews.Author: traveler06
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new section of the Dana last week. We found the room to be a good size and nicely done. It was nice to have a fridge and microwave. Comfortable beds, and the evening turndown service was a nice touch. They also provide slippers and robes. The concierge and front desk staff were helpful. They offer a shuttle to the airport, Sea World and Belmont Park/Mission beach. We ate at the Blue Pearl and Firefly and both were good. Firefly has a much more interesting dinner menu and has nice outdoor seating near the pool. There are two pools - one in near the main lobby and one in the garden area. We also saw the older sections of rooms when walking by, and these are also fine, just the views and locations of some that are not as great. I would suggest to pay extra for the newer rooms. I can understand why some people complain about the older rooms because of their view/location or lack of. But, overall this is a decent hotel. Sea World is about a 15min walk. You can also walk across the bridge and up to Mission Bay Park/Belmont Park/MIssion Beach. Pacific Beach is further north. There are more restaurants in this area. I would suggest a car if you are wanting shopping, attraction and dining choices.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Katyblue
Reviews.Content: The website photos and information give a very different feel to what it actually is. We wondered if we were at the right place. We anticipated this hotel to be the luxury part of our vacation. Very over-priced. The boardwalk along the marina is very nice and peaceful, but that is open to the public anytime and they didn't have to pay $250 a day to use it. There are two very nice pools in different areas with a different "feel" to each of them. We enjoyed the evening fireworks view as we enjoyed the pool. Very, very nice. Are room was basic and small. Again over-priced for what it was. Overall, the pool areas very nice, and the property is quite peaceful- if that's what you're looking for. The nearby properties had more activity and access to the bay's beach. If we wanted some activity or interaction with others, we had to leave our hotel to get that. We felt a bit isolated from the fun. Overpriced for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Eurofolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early August at the start of a Californian roadtrip with our two kids 8 and 10. We got the corporate rate and were roomed in the refurbished wing for two nights. A great view into the bay and direct parking in front of each block, but in the end this was a little too much of an upmarket motel. It lacked a soul - compounded by three weddings on the Saturday - (though who would get married on a lawn with a view of the bay, but a family barbecue going on just 50 metres away and people jogging through the back of your wedding video). The room was fine, but not spectacular. Restaurant was ok, but the breakfast cafe somewhat downmarket, big portions with slow service. Good small pool. The unrefurbished wings, however, looked just a little dodgy. Location-wise great for seaworld and about 15 minutes drive to the zoo. Some cycling and boating on site. Not much contact with the staff, though they seemed friendly enough. Not sure I'll be back in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Shirley222
Reviews.Content: The Dana was very disappointing. I think it is definately over priced for what you get. We enjoyed having a beer with Matt the pool bar attendant, and the kids enjoyed the pool, but that is all this place had to offer. We felt isolated there too having to drive everywhere. If you want a meal off site, you have to drive. If you have never been to San diego before, i'd recommend staying where the action is in the heart of the city. The embassy suites looked great when we drove by, so did the Marriot Marina, that area is so pretty and convienient. The rooms at the Dana were very average, nothing to impress. If you just want to sit around a pool all day and just use your room for sleeping then maybe you would like this place...for $100 a night, it would be worth it...but its definately not the luxury hotel you see on the website...far from it. We were prepared to pay the money thinking we were going to get something really nice, but we were very disappointed, its a budget hotel with a hefty price tag.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: Honeytripper
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews I've read there are two camps: those who enjoy the Dana and those who do not. We fall into the first category. We paid a good price and were given a nice room in the older part. I was expecting the older section, and was pleased that they put us in a room with a view of the marina. I found the location convenient and the pools are fun for the kids. I had ordered 4 day bus passes from the transit system and they were handy, once I figured out how the bus routes worked to and from the Old Town transit depot. The restaurant staff at the Blue Pearl were very pleasant and the service was fast. Our maid kept forgetting to refill our coffee packets, and didn't seem to know the difference between regular and decaf, but other than that the service was fine. It was enjoyable to have a drink by the pool, though there is so much to do we didn't have much time for lounging. I found this to be a good hotel in the moderate category, close to the beaches and SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average hotel for above average prices”
Reviews.Author: pmcewan27
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 kids (6 and 3) stayed there last week for 5 nights (Thu-Mon). Room was clean. We paid to stay in the newer part of the hotel. Room was nice with a view of the marina. There's not a beach there. Pool was nice and warm. There were 2 weddings on during our stay so it was pretty noisy. Hotel restaraunt is extortionate. I'm used to staying in Hilton/Marriot hotels and it was on a par with a basic one of these. I wouldn't go back as I don't think the price is justified. Our kids liked the pool but we could have got a pool at a much cheaper hotel with quality ona par with the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “We were fooled by their beautiful hotel pictures”
Reviews.Author: meva93065
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 3 day, supposedly relaxing "get away" to San Diego. I booked our stay based on the pictures on their web site. The web site showed a beautiful newer resort...this is what we got: 1) A friendly front desk attendant who looked liked she just rolled out of bed with a dirty, wrinkly blouse, 2) a very smelly room that was in the old portion of the resort which resembled a Motel 8 but with Hilton prices, 3) the room was located next to an extremely busy street which sounded like a speedway, 4) the bathroom which consisted of a very unfriendly children shower (my 5 year old pointed out that the shower is so dirty that she won't get in, unable to move shower head to avoid unvoluntary hair wash for my children (shower caps not provided by hotel/motel), 5) spider webs on ceilings and a couple of spiders in room, 6) told front desk of problems - they told me that they would move us for an upgrade fee - which I refused. My family and I hoped that the noise level will decrease as the night went on...wrong! We literally did not sleep all night. At daybreak I went to the front desk and told them that this room was totally unacceptable. Without another word from the front desk attendant, they moved us to a somewhat nicer room (no traffic noise and a tub/shower combination). Took shuttle to Sea World. On return, shuttle was 20 minutes late picking up. There were about 40 guests waiting for the shuttle that held approx. 25. Needless to say many had to wait for a second pick up. We were definitely fooled by their pictures on their web site. Will not ever again stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and badly run”
Reviews.Author: O2BatC
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Dana in July. I was booked there because it was the overflow hotel for a conference at the Hyatt Islandia across the street. At the conference rate, we were only able to get rooms in the older part of the hotel. The newer building may be nicer, but as for the older part, it's basically a fifties-style motel trying to pass itself off as an upscale small hotel. The service was very uneven, at best. My shuttle driver from the airport was delightful, but the front desk staff were hopelessly incompetent (did not know whether my state tax waiver form was needed; did not tell me that the room was on the 2d floor, or how to work the key; did not know how to retrieve voicemail messages on the room phone). When my room was made up the morning after my first night, the maid left only one bath towel and one face towel in the room. She was very nice when I asked for more towels, and brought them right away, but I can't imagine what she could have been thinking. I had dinner the first night at the Blue Pearl; it has a basic middle-American menu, with nothing to interest anyone with a sophisticated palate, and the BBQ chicken salad I ordered was awful - way too much cloying BBQ sauce. (I didn't eat any other meals at the Dana, because the rest of my meals were through the conference.) The room itself was worn and unattractive, and although it was reasonably clean, there was a very large area on the carpet near the sink that was soaked through (with water, I hope). The air conditioner had a very insensitive thermostat, so it alternately blasted cold air (effective, but noisy) and did nothing. I would not recommend this place unless you have kids and want to be close to Sea World, or have a boat and need to use the marina. Even then, you'd be better off at the Hyatt Islandia, so I would not book the Dana unless you get a really big price break by doing so.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana was First Rate”
Reviews.Author: LardieBoy
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews about the Dana , we travelled with our kids and in-laws . We decided to go for a suite in the new buildings they went for a room in the old. For the extra money the new buildings are well worth it , however the overall Dana experience wasn't marred by the room in the old bit. The whole experience was fantastic from the email before we left home asking if there was anything they could do for us to the one waiting for us on our return asking for any feedback. The hotel has the best of everything , if you want a family diner it has it , if you want a more intimate restaurant t has that too our you can eat on the terrace near the pool. The 2 pools are very different one lively with a bar and tv's the other more sedate both very suitable for kids. The service was fantastic , they couldn't do enough for us. There was also bike and boat hire at very decent prices If I went again I would definitely pay the extra for the new building

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelneedy
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel IF You have the right room. If you pay for a Bayview room, be sure your room is at the far end of the 1000 building or in the 2000, otherwise you will get a view of the parking lot and highway with a glance at the bay if you stretch your neck. The Bayview rooms are very nice inside, but the outside area around the OLDER, paradise pool is much prettier. We had a great time at the Dana, but some of the rooms are just over the parking lot or public park where numerous NONhotel guests hang out on the weekends. Be sure you are specific about your view. I would probably take an older, lesser room to get that wonderful view of the older garden or paradise pool...very lush and beautiful. The walk to the marina is nice. We preferred the older paradise pool over the bayside one due to the beautiful, tropical greenery, the ping pong table, and the overall atmosphere. It was more secluded than the bayside pool. Overall, we had a great time and will probably stay there again if we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiguy931
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the buildings. When you look at pictures, they show you the NEW tower. Thats where check in and the store is. What they don't show you is where over 75% of the guests stay. Welcome to the motel section. Old brown shingle buildings which look like a motel. The rooms have okay accomadations, but the bathroom takes up over a quarter of the room. The rollaways were the worst. When you lay down, you feel no matress, just springs. I couldn't sleep, so every night I would climb into the tub and watch movies. The area was okay, but when your staying at a motel, and right acrss the street is the Grand Hyatt, it is kind of depressing. It was a walk from Sea World (Only a block), but a while from Downtown and The Zoo and Coronado, the first place we stayed, much nicer of course. The pools were okay, and the hotel was right on the Harbor, with boat rentals and everything, so that was good. Otherwise it was just okay. The restaurant was like a denny's, and the only time firefly (the hotel restaurant) was open was for dinner. I most likely will not stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: hannja14
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights around the 4th of July. Our stay was very pleasant. Rooms in new section were clean and nice with beautiful view of the bay. There is a town park adjacent to hotel with a large grass field that we enjoyed. I can understand how some guests would complain about noise at night but with a/c on we were fine. We had a picnic at this park and enjoyed a beautiful sunset and watching the boats come home at dusk. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was advertized”
Reviews.Author: csylviareed
Reviews.Content: I was very excited for my family vacation at the Dana last May. Unfortunately, it was not quite the hotel we thought it would be. The pictures show beautiful, new-looking buildings - which they do have - but we booked online and ended up with what looked only slightly better than a Motel 6. The room was small and very dark. It had a "pool view," which meant a small window that barely opened and was completely shaded by plants. It was especially insulting to discover we were placed in these rooms right before they were planning to remodel. There was lots of noise going on from workers tearing up rooms next door. Then, at 9pm on the last night of our stay, we recieved a call from the front desk asking if we wanted a 'complimentary upgrade' to the other building for that night. Upgrade? We thought we were going to be in the new building the whole time! A little forthought on the part of the front desk would have prevented this situation. When we declined to switch rooms on such late notice, the desk worker asked me to come sign a waiver so that if we were injured as a result of the remodel, they would not be held responsible. Again, we declined. To their credit, they did end up giving us one complimentary breakfast the next morning to make up for the disturbance. Also, the location was beautiful! We went for a walk all the way over to Belmont park area in the evening and felt very safe in the neighborhood. The hotel also had a great shuttle service to nearby Seaworld and the airport. The grounds were gorgeous and well kept, and the two pools were very enjoyable. I cannot reccomend the Dana, but if you do go insist on staying in the new white buildings. Who knows, you could have a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Loud!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (myself, husband and 2 boys 10 & 13) just returned yesterday from our annual SanDiego trip. We used to live there so we are familiar with the area hotels and are very particular to where we stay. This year we decided to splurge on a Bay View Room in the New Buildings at The Dana for 5 nights. We were all looking forward to relaxing and enjoying our ground floor suite, the boys would play in the grassy area while my husband and I would sit on the patio reading, watching the boats go by, admiring the beautiful sunset with a glass of wine etc.....Well turns out we couldn't relax with all the thumping, running, jumping, doors slamming, cabinets closing, showers running, babies crying, toddlers screaming, parents yelling..... I think you get my point. The Dana spent how much on these two new beautiful buildings? but failed to make them the least bit sound proof ! What a big dissapointment. I had ended up using Tylenol PM and EarPlugs just to get some sleep. (even my 13 year old had to wear earplugs so he could sleep) The hotel was booked solid so there was no switching rooms, plus who knows we may have been worse off moving. Upon check-out when asked how everything was, my husband told the gal and she just kind of gave him a blank stare. All of the others who have given this hotel excellent reveiws must be hard of hearing or just don't value peace and quiet. I would not recommend staying here at peak travel season or if you're wanting a quiet romantic vacation. I don't think staying on the third floor would be much help considering, it wasn't just the people above us, we could also hear the people in both of the rooms on either side. I think The Dana wanted to make quick $ and be competitve with the more exclusive San Diego resortsand hastily and cheaply built these two buildings on their property. As I stated in the title Beautiful but..... Would we stay there again????

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend just got back from our vacation where we travelled around California and stayed in three different hotels. The Dana was like the cherry on top of the vacation. When we first arrived, we were put in a marina view room, which is the older side of the hotel. It was fairly average, but still seemed nice, had a fairly good view and a nice pool close by. We asked soon afterwards if we could be changed to the newer side, and for $40 CA a night we decided to do it. I was very happy we decided to switch. The room was very big, and came with a microwave, refrigerator, 2 double beds, a couch and a nice bathroom. We also were pleased that we now had a balcony which overlooked the bay and the palm trees as opposed to boats. The morning we left we were up early and could hear the seals clearly from our room, which was cool. The service was good, everybody was friendly, and the location was convenient. Sea World is a 5-10 minute walk and Mission Beach is about a 15. I highly recommend this hotel, even if you are planning on staying in the older section.

Reviews.Title: “What kind of room is that!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There web site shows the new side of this hotel. When you get there you will get a old run down motel type room with a vanity made of plastic and to small to hold your toiletries. We had a pool room with a so called patio that had overgrown and dead plants surrounding us. Yuk...it was horrible. Beware, beware ask for the new buidling facing the Marina and be sure to say new or they will stick you with one of the old Marina rooms facing the Marina without a balcony. It is just to confusing. We have stayed in the new rooms with the Marina view and this year asked for a pool room and had a horrible room. Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! WHAT A GREAT FIND!!”
Reviews.Author: aftkel
Reviews.Content: After two nights at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina, we moved to the Dana. It was fantastic in every respect. Loved the location, loved the view, loved the Blue Pearl restaurant. The hotel grounds are beautifully maintained. The front desk staff and concierge were very helpful with directions!! They offer a free shuttle to Sea World--we took this shuttle in the morning, but ended up walking back in the afternoon because we missed the bus. It is an easy walk!! Mission Beach is an easy drive by car. There are two beautiful pools and hot tubs, and our children had a blast there. From our balcony in the morning, we could see dolphins at play in the bay. We stayed in the newer section on the second floor where we had two queen beds and a couch that made into a bed. Room was very spacious. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WIWOL92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for 7 nights to chill out after a month of touring around Arizona and S California, prior to driving to LA for a few days then flying home. We were in a suite in the new building and found it extremely comfortable - if a little expensive. The older accommodation in the hotel looked very 'motel' like and reminiscent from the outside of aged military bachelor quarters. Certainly I would recommend the added expense of going for a bay-view room. The hotel has 2 restaurants, but we only sampled the Blue Pearl, which was very good. The staff there were extremely friendly and the menu had a surprisingly widespread appeal. The hotel is superbly located for access to SeaWorld, with a shuttle bus being run a couple of times a day. They also have a good deal of a 2-day pass at the price of the normal entrance - see the concierge. Would also recommend the $150 per head close encounter with dolphins. My wife and I came out of the dolphin pool on an incredible high and couldn't stop babbling for the next hour. I would recommend it most strongly to anyone who can afford it. The zoo is also well worth a visit and an easy way to see the sights is via the hop-on, hop-off bus. All tickets available from the concierge. Our only criticism of the Dana is the reception/check in. The staff there didn't seem particularly helpful, nor flexible. Without exception, every guest that arrived before the statutory 4pm check in time was told that their room wasn't yet available and to check back at 4pm. Miraculously, at the stroke of 4, all rooms suddenly became available and were allocated to guests! Either the reception staff work strictly to the rule book (job's worth!), the housekeeping staff incredibly all finish their tasks at the same time, or their computer system is pathetic. Whatever the answer, it was a poor showing, which let the overall impression down badly.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jas849
Reviews.Content: This was by far our favorite stop during our San Diego vacation. The only disappointment was not getting into the newer part of the hotel as we were initially told. In the pictures, there is a beautiful white hotel and then to the right, older, ugly brown rows of hotel rooms mostly obscured by the palm trees and landscaping. We were told the newer part of the Dana was unavailable our first day, but would be available for us on the second day. On day two I called to verify the move and was told it would be an additional $70. I told her this was unacceptable, that we were told before even arriving, and reiterated at check-in, that a room in the newer part of the hotel would be there for us at a never mentioned additional cost. The clerk then changes the price to $40. I told her to make up her mind and just forget it. The only problem in the room itself was the dresser cabinets. They sit next to each other. The lower part were the dresser drawers, and upper part was to hang up your clothes. The TV was located in the cabinet closest to the bathroom and directly in front of one of the beds. Those sleeping in the other bed had to strain to see the TV. Not sure why they didn't position one of these cabinets more centrally to make it easier for everyone. With all of that said, even though the exterior of the older part of the hotel isn't pretty, the rooms are still very clean and the wooden window shutters were a very nice touch. There was also a second pool dedicated mainly for guests staying in the older hotel. It was a good size surrounded by comfortable lounge chairs, each with a towel already set out for you. There was also a tiki hut that served drinks. The pool was gated and part of the pool backed up to the backside of some rooms. This would be the place to stay on a first level pool side room, where you could walk right out your back door and across your small patio into the pool. All of this again surrounded by many palm trees for seclusion and for those not looking to get burnt by the sun. Overall, not getting into the newer part of the hotel didn't affect our time there. We were disappointed that we did not have time to rent a boat. This looked like a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: KAL717
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from a weekend trip to SD for mothers day. We chose the Dana primarily to be by the water, the zoo, and based on the reviews here and website. The hotel is more like a motel due to the two story layout but its amenities and service far surpass any motel I ve seen. They offer two great restaurants, two pools and jacuzzis (one pool has a poolside bar/tv, the other pool offers poolside service from the restaurant). By the bay you can rent bikes, paddleboards etc. and there is a beautiful walkway in front of the hotel to walk after dinner or whenever. The rooms are small but clean and very cozy beds. Because it is motel style, it is easy to hear your neighbors coming in and out and i do not recommend being on the ground level...stay upstairs and you should be fine Overall my mom and I both really enjoyed the hotel. It definitely feels like you are on vacation, and being able to enjoy a drink by the pool watching the bay was beautiful. Also very centrally located to other beaches-Pacific Beach, Mission Beach, Sea World, Balboa Park etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a Deluxe bayview Guestroom. The room was great, great views, good restaurants, awesome pools and much, much more! It is definately worth paying thew extra to stay in one of these rooms! the location was great being right next to seaworld and it was also an advantage having a car for we visited places we otherwise wouldnt have been able to as easily such as tijuana, coronado, and more. The pools are great as they are suitable for all ages. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in San Diego. Thanks to the staff at the Dana for making our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, even in the old section”
Reviews.Author: watergirlee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great weekend in SD. Legoland and Seaworld were great. I loved Dine with Shamu. A bit pricey, but worthwhile to see the whales up close. About the Dana, it was a great location. Easy access to everything - 5 minutes to Seaworld. We were hesitant to stay here based on some of the previous reviews about the old section of the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms in the older section. We had the option to upgrade on our second day, but chose not to. In January, I stayed at the Holiday Inn Carlsbad and it was much worse (more like a 1.5 or 2-star). Based on other places I've stayed for business travel (usually 3 or 4 stars like Courtyards, etc.), I would take The Dana over many of them anyday (solid 3-star). I'll agree that the outside of the older buildings did look old and motel-like, though recently painted. However, the room may have been recently renovated. The sink area had granite countertops and the carpet seemed to be pretty new (berber type?). The light fixtures were contemporary with white rectangular shades and brushed metal bases. Outside the room, there was a small patio with a couple of chairs and a table. The landscaping was quite pretty and I enjoyed strolling the grounds. The pools were both nice. I preferred the one by the new section because it was warmer. =) Both pools were large enough to do short laps and were not overly crowded. They put out pool towels on the chairs and replace them when they are used. They also served drinks (at least at the new pool). On the negative side, the walls were a little thin and we did hear a baby crying next door. It wasn't loud enough to keep me awake and I'm a pretty light sleeper. I will say that, walking by the newer section, those rooms certainly seemed nicer. I would definitely stay there again, even in an older room.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get an upper room at the new wing”
Reviews.Author: Berggericht
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Dana. Firstly we got a groud floor room at the older part of the hotel. The room was nice and clean but you could heat the above people (probabyl children) running around. We heard every single step. After complaning to the reception we got an upstairs room at the new wing - a wonderful room, spaceous, very clean and not noise issues at all. We had a very good sleep. When checking in look after the new wing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: merrytime
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the new bay view suites. We wanted the room, and our suite was very roomy. Very nice with a patio overlooking the harbor. We had a den with a tv and sofa sleeper, small frig and micowave and bedroom area with two beds and second tv. No complaints, none at all. Even the soaps and shampoos are top of the line. I asked for extra pillows and towels, they were brought within 10 minutes. Rooms were clean, modern, and stylish. pools looked nice and I used the convenient laundromat. We ate at the firefly twice, and I recommend it highly. Everything convenient and close to the rooms. No extra parking charge. The concierge and I became buddies, he was extremely nice and helpful. We bought our tickets from him for the zoo, and he gave us directions where ever we needed to go. If he didn't know something, he checked on the internet right then, or made phone calls, he even had a book or restaurant menus. I believe his first name was look, and can't remember his last name. Mission beach was not for us although the ocean was beautiful, not our crowd after staying in Laguna and viewing La Jolla beach. Every place we went was close by, 10 minutes or less. We took the trolley tour, great idea! and went to sea port village and took some of the most beautiful pictures. One of the most picturesque places I've ever been to. We ate breakfast at Busters. The food was great and our server was wonderful, can't remember his name. Recommend a rental car, wonderful trip, loved California. Thank you Dana Inn for a vacation my family will remember forever.

Reviews.Title: “Newer rooms with a harbor view.”
Reviews.Author: FS_Junkie_with_kids
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Dana from March 24-26 was fine. I stayed in the newer Bayview rooms which have a beautiful view of the harbor. I saw the older rooms which were okay and a little dark, but still pricey. There is a Hyatt across the street (not on the bay, I don't think). The location is nice for boating and walking or jogging as it's on a jogging path which runs parallel to the water. There is a small grocery/convenience store within walking distance. The nicest surprises were the two restaurants on the property. Our dinner at the Blue Pearl was very good and the Firefly bar/restaurant was delicious (especially for lunch). The two pools looked nicely maintained. If considering a stay at the property, I would highly recommend a rental car, unless you plan to remain on the property. If the later is your plan, the shuttle to and from the airport should work fine.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Excellent Staff & Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Tuckers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Dana Hotel in San Diego. We were in the area with my sons soccer team and several families participating in a tournament. We had a total of 8 families who stayed at the Dana. Not one complaint from any of them. The staff at The Dana is very friendly, helpful and efficient. We had a couple extra requests and they were taken care of immediately. The hotel grounds are clean and well kept. They have security personnel walking around, too. The concierge desk is staffed with some very knowledgeable, friendly people. We stayed in the newer area of the hotel, in the Bay View Rooms on Waters Edge. These rooms are large and all have water views. We were on the first floor, so our balcony opened right up onto the grassy area by the water. There were a couple chairs and a table on the balcony, too. The weather was cold & rainy so we didnt really get to take advantage of our ideal location. There are 2 pools, the one near the lobby and our room was very pretty. It had a nice large jacuzzi, which my kids enjoyed! and the pool was heated nice and warm. They have towels by the pool, too, which was a nice touch. The hotel room (room 1109) itself was really nice. As you enter there is a closet on the right, and the bathroom to the left. A nice touch is the motion sensor light that goes on as you enter the room. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful! Dark slate tile & granite countertop. A ton of counterspace, as well as some shelves to put things. Tub/shower combo. Water got hot quickly and decent water pressure. There was a small kitchenette, too. With a microwave, refrigerator, sink & coffee maker (with plenty of coffee supplied). There are cupboards to store your food items, but no utensils or bowls/plates. Two queen size beds (not the most comfortable, but nothing horrible), and a twin size pull out sofabed. A table and two chairs, nice armoir with tv & drawers for storage. The room has plenty of lamps/lights but none of them get really bright. They had sliding plantation shutter doors, which were really nice! I want some for my house. We were very comfortable in the room! The tv had a movie channel and a Nintendo you could use (I think there was a charge). They had wired and wireless internet in the room, which was nice. We ate at one of the restaurants at the hotel, called the Firefly. Its right by the pool area. The food was good, a little expensive, but good. They had burgers and fried shrimp, salads, etc and its also a bar so you can get a drink and sit by the pool. The rooms on the other side of the lobby are the older, motel style rooms. The families in our group who stayed on that side enjoyed the hotel just as much as we did. They had harbor views and pool views. Some faced the parking lot, but no one in our group had one of those rooms. I did not personally see the insides of those rooms, but they said they looked like they were recently remodeled. The location of this hotel is ideal if you are going to Sea World. You can walk (takes about 15 min) or its a 2 min. drive. They also have a shuttle, but it has only a couple of scheduled drop off/pick up times. There isnt any fast food nearby, you'd have to drive to that. Dana Harbor is right there, for boating/fishing/etc. Not much else within walking distance, but everything else is short drive. Downtown San Diego (Gaslamp area, etc) is about 15 min away. Hotel Circle area is about 5 minutes away. Its right off the 8 freeway and right off the 5 freeway. Negatives: For us the ONLY negative thing was parking. If you leave and come back after 8pm there is no parking near the Bayview rooms. Its a good walk from the other parking areas, so keep that in mind. Check out the website for more info & to see the photos of this beautiful hotel. (--). It doesnt come up on the search engines so I thought I would include it for anyone who wants more info. Oh, and NO I am not affiliated with them in any way, I just really wanted to give an honest, information-filled review of this wonderful hotel. I would stay there again in a heartbeat (but probably only in one of the Bay View Waters Egde rooms).

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: danichlo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two teenage daughters for 3 nights in Feb 2006. The room far exceeded our expectations....it was nicely decorated, clean, spacious and had a small kitchen area comprising of a sink, microwave and fridge. We had a lovely balcony overlooking the bay. This room was in the new bayside area and was wonderful. The staff were friendly and helpful. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. Infact our only regret was not booking for longer as we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “It worked..”
Reviews.Author: cooperswen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana in November. This was our first holiday as a married couple so we booked based on the fact that it was on the water, touted a nice pool in all the travel books and was the relaxing setting we wanted after 4 days at Disneyland. We got in too early to check in and so we decided to head to the mall, the front desk staff was helpful with keeping luggage and calling the cab. The cab ride there and back was a little over $30 to Fashion Valley, the hotel is on the water but very isolated from everything else if you do not have a rental car. When we arrived back to the "motel" our room was ready and we tried to settle in. We sat in the room for a bit with the patio door open to maybe pull out some of the smell. It had a very damp, bleachy smell. We called the front deck to complain about the smell they moved us immediately two doors down in the same building we went to smell the room first and it smelled good but was not clean- we proceeded to the front desk again and they moved us one more time. This time the room did not stink and it was made up. The room was clean. The bathroom left something to be desired and was definatey not renovate just had another coat of paint thrown onto it, but having only the toilet and shower in there was nice with the sink and hairblower outside the door. Other than a few minor things with the bathroom the room was adequate. The bed was comfortable for a double- they could not accommodate our request for a queen as they were full for most of our stay and we had been moved enough. We booked through a travel agent and some requests seemed to have missed the booking. The distance from everything also made the dining an easy choice as we didn't want to call a cab all the time. We ate once at the Blue Pearl and it was adequate, but not spectacular- fine for a cafeteria feeling supper. We primarily ate at the Firefly- it was great. Nice intimate lounge and the sports channel was always on for my husband which helped! The menu had a fair variety, and the "fireworks drink" comes very highly recommended. The motel/ hotel side we stayed on was the old side. It was adequate for the time we spent there. The pools was beautiful our room backed onto the garden pool. The location was great for the view but not the shopping and the eating out- unless you have a car. The price was right under $90 Cdn per night. I would probably not stay there again only for the fact that I'd like to be closer to downtown & Old Town for more dining and activities choices within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! There, I said it again. Recently I spent four days in a Standard Room at The Dana on Mission Bay. Their website touts their recent renovations but it appears quite clear that insulation/sound proofing was not in the renovation budget. Conversations in adjoining rooms could be heard clearly, whether one wanted to hear them or not. My neighbor for two days, obviously a sports buff, watched ESPN almost constantly and responded to exciting plays with a sudden WOW! While some events were less than exciting, women's basketball peaked at nearly 35 WOWs per hour. Other than the quasi-cardboard walls, the facility was acceptable. Doors offered significant challenges, with the patio door the most difficult to maneuver. A little silicone would go a long way there. The painting was likely done during an earthquake, as bits of various earth tones were scattered on adjacent portions of the wall. Fellow attendees spoke highly of the new water's edge section of the hotel and I would encourage you to check those out when visiting the Dana. Bring your earplugs or prepare to be WOWed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised at this hotel as this was only rated a 3 & a half star hotel. The room was fantastic, the view was even better and it was close to all. Very very Happy With This Hotel And Would Recomment to Anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Actually 2 Distinctly different properties. Be Careful!”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: My 11 y/o daughter and I spent two nights at the Dana in early January 2006. I booked a marina view room based on the pictures and descriptions on their web site. Upon arrival at the room, I was extremely disappointed by the motel atmosphere. While the room was neat and updated, it was impossible to get away from the cheap claustrophobic roadside feel. In fact, 'marina view' is misleading since the only way to see the harbor is while outside of the room or standing up bedside from within. Luckily, when I expressed my displeasure at the front desk they were overly generous by upgrading us to a bay view room. Simply put, it was night and day. The 'new' section is logistically isolated from the motel section with what technically amounts to its own pool and common area. The rooms are newly furnished, with perfect views of the adjacent bay. We were situated in a ground floor room and therefore I was able to sit on the patio and watch my daughter as she played in the grassy area between the room and the waters edge. The complimentary robes, slippers, and turn down service seemed to fit nicely in this environment, while perhaps be laughable at the older portion of the property. The Firefly restaurant offered a limited but well produced number of entrees for dinner and an adequate breakfast buffet. The outdoor seating had a real resort feel to it overlooking the pool and marina. To sum up, I would highly recommend the Dana for even an extended stay at the NEW SIDE ONLY. I would strongly dissuade booking in the older portion unless you were entirely prepared for that type of environment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: KYmiddleamerican
Reviews.Content: My entire family (wife, 3 sons (21,18,15) just returned from a week at the Dana on Mission Bay. We stayed in a Bayview guestroom in the Water's Edge portion of the complex. Our room was very nice, with very stylish furnishings, more than adequate space, was extra clean and quiet, and an excellent value. I bought our room thru a package deal on Expedia and there were no surpises at all. The grounds are in excellent shape, the heated pool and spa were wonderful, and the location was ideal. You can make it to downtown San Diego in less than 10 minutes by car. It is very quiet at the Dana, and totally relaxing. The staff went out of their way to be helpful to our family, and I appreciated that very much. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on premises, but they looked great. We ate when we were visiting the Zoo, Old Town, the Pacific Holiday Bowl parade and game, and all the other great places to visit. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat. I did not go into the older units (Marina Cove). It appeared to be an older portion of the Dana, but appeared to be in nice shape. Lots of renovation was on-going on premises. If you go, visit Mission Beach (4 minutes) and Pacific Beach (10 minutes) for shopping and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana!”
