Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip (Nov. 22 - 24) to San Diego with the primary purpose of going to SeaWorld and Legoland in Carlsbad. I must preface my comments by saying that we stayed in the "newer" part of the Dana. The "newer" part is the "Bay View" rooms in the new white 3 story buildings not the "Marina View" in the 2 story buildings (although from what I could see, the Marian rooms looked okay from the outside.) The front desk people were very welcoming and helpful. They also provide you with very helpful directions to many local area shopping, grocery stores, restaurants. I must say that while this is not an extravagant hotel, the rooms were very nice and you could tell that the room was new. Everything was extremely clean and the appointments throughout the room were very nice. Bathroom had granite countertops and nice tiled floors. The beds were very comfortable and bedding of high quality. The room also had a microwave and small refrigerator. The view from the room is very nice and the hotel landscaping is very well done. We used the pool (heated) on one evening and my daughter really enjoyed it. The pool was pretty large and the jacuzzi was also very good in size. The hotel had a bar right outside of the pool area (didn't try it, but looked very nice). This hotel is very close to SeaWorld and you could walk if you need to but the hotel has a shuttle. Overall I thought this was a great hotel in an excellent location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The location is great - directly across the street from Sea World. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. The room was clean. They offer two heated pools and hot tubs. The restaurant on site was reasonably priced and the food was good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & over busy”
Reviews.Author: linlees
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana as it was the closest hotel to Seaworld. It was close and we walked with our 2 kids one evening there & back - it is a 25min walk, the kids were not keen to do it again! We booked a room in the newer section and it served its purpose for us . There are no frills but the room was clean and newly furnished . The decor was dark & the bathroom small but there was a good wet bar with microwave, coffee maker & granite top. We spent Sat afternoon by the pool which was awful! no towels were provided & the hotel had 2 back to back weddings taking place. The band was so loud & the music clashed with the piped hotel grounds music. One wedding finished at 5pm , the other started at the same time so the hotel was heaving with people !! very very busy. We were trying to have a meal in their restaurant Firefly but there were so many wedding guests passing chairs over our heads, smoking cigars & cigarette ends all over the floor. That night the revelry continued to very late. If you are looking for a quiet hotel , I would strongly recommend checking if there are any weddings booked! The hotel is quite small and really this took over every available space as their facilities are all very near to each other. The service by the pool was non existent ( noone there), the service in Firefly was very poor - our meals came up wrong & we told them 3 times but they did nothing to change them. The decor in Firefly was also disappointing , not as nice as the web picture shows. The front desk was unhelpful - we checked in at 10 pm but were kept waiting whilst the check in chatted to his colleagues about Las Vegas. On check out when they asked us for feedback & we told them these comments, they offered to take off our internet connection only ( $3.95!). The Dana could really improve their service, there were old messages left on our phone from the pevious guests, our room was not made up til 3pm, there was no turn down service, the toiletries were cheap & unappealing, there were no bathrobes provided. All the little touches that could easily be improved!

Reviews.Title: “Website not quite 100%”
Reviews.Author: mwcotton
Reviews.Content: I decided on the Dana after much research, I liked its central location most of all and the pictures of the rooms on their website. Well let me say, the website is very deceiving, the Marina view rooms are straight out of a road side motel or military barracks ( see my picture posted) the Bay view rooms are absolutely beautiful but the website makes you think all the rooms are the same. The rooms were clean and the experiance overall was very nice, but I think they should show true pictures and not tell just half the story.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: janinelouie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make sure you I gave a review of this hotel because I spend so many hours looking into where to stay when coming to San Diego. I must have had 6 different reservations at different areas within Mission Bay/Mission Beach. This hotel was great. I can't be any happier than I was. The view is just so beautiful. We stayed in the new section which is all white 3 story buildings. In what I think was a jr king suite. It had a small sink and frig and microwave which was perfect to keep snacks and reheat any leftovers we had from restaurants. The bed was comfortable and the room was large enough for my husband and 7 year old son. The staff was very nice and friendly too. For this part of our trip we were not looking for a large resort, just a clean large enough room, with a beautiful view of San Diego. There was a pool that children and adults were swimming in at all times of day and night. It was clean and heated I'd imagine because I couldn't imagine swimming in it at night because it was cool out yet many people were. I did some laundry too while there because we were headed to Hawaii for 10 more nights. I had to walk over to the older building to do this so I saw what it was like there. There was a pool there also which looked very nice too. As far as the brown buildings everyone was referring to as being awful well I didn't see inside the rooms and yes it would look much nicer if it was brand new and white as the other side but it was by no means awful as people have said. Of course if the hotel was uniform than it would be that much better but believe me the area is just gorgeous. We did eat in both the restaurants that they had. The firefly and the Blue Pearl. Both excellent. What I thought was so great was that on the patio of the Firefly, which overlooks the marina and the pool area, there were nice tables with an open door to the restaurant which also had tables. There were heated torches all thru the patio because it was quite cool in the evening so you could eat outside or just have cocktails in the great atmosphere and it was warm. The lawn at the back of the hotel was big and perfectly manicured and it overlooked the water. You could sit outside your room if you were on the first floor or just sit on the lawn and relax. Bring food or drinks there and watch the boats. There was also a bycycle path that was along the lawn and marina. You could rent them at the hotel. If I were to return to San Diego I would stay here again and definetly recommend this hotel. Yes I would recommend the new section but again, as far as I know the interior of the older rooms have been redone as well so I'm sure that they would be just as nice. If you don't want to take a chance just book the newer section. I did see the Catamaran and the Bahia while traveling around and just looking at them without even entering the parking lot, I was very happy with my choice. The location was much better than these other two hotels and the feel of The Dana was much nicer. We also saw great fireworks from Sea World on our room balcony every night at 10pm. The location to Sea World was a 5 minute car ride. You could walk but I don't think I would. It would probably take 15 minutes but you are walking on a main road. We drove every where and it took less than 10 minutes. Zoo, Beach, Belmont Park. Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “VERY Realaxing”
Reviews.Author: jod2la
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the newer Bayview suite which was very nice, ask for the AAA rate to save some money. Very roomy 2 queens or a king. Kitchenette and nice bathroom. Sitting area with couch that is a queen sleeper, great for the kids and a partition door which gives privacy, and also a sleep in if the kids wake early. Nice large patio with bay views. Resort is super kid friendly, lots of other families. Pool is nice not too many chairs and pool service is not always available. Rent a boat accross the street at Sea Forthe next to the Hyatt Hotel across the street, they had a much larger boat inventory. We fit 9 people on a pontoon boat, very fun and only $85/hr. Mission Blvd has lots of restaurants. Ask the conceriege about the restaurant with the magician on Mondays and Thursdays, well worth it! Very friendly and helpful staff. Overall an excellent stay. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: drumsalongthemohawk
Reviews.Content: As with the other reviews, book into the newer section. Rooms were nice and modern, staff was helpful and courteous. Pool and hot tub nice. They offer shuttles to seaworld and the zoo. Nice location on the bay but have to drive to everything else. Skip Mission Beach and the amusement park unless you like the seedy crowds and smell of marijuana.

Reviews.Title: “The View Makes It Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there July 4th weekend. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The grounds were lovely and well kept. The view of the bay each morning was spectaculor! However, the furnishings needed some serious updating. I felt that I was in a Hotel from from the 70's. Also, being from the south, I was somewhat surprised that the staff would not speak to you at all. Overall, I would definitely go back...it was easy to travel around San Diego from the Bay Area. In the end, the View is what makes it the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: vapisala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana the last week of July/first week of August. We were celebrating our anniversary & traveling with our kids. The hotel was clean- most important thing for me. The pools were great, although they could have been a bit more heated. The pool bar was attended by a very friendly wait staff. The Blue Pearl restaurant was great for a quick bite to eat- and the food was great for what we paid. Think: upgraded Denny's/Norms. The rooms were spacious & overlooked the Marina- they didn't look so hot on the outside, but don't let the brown paint fool you. The "newer" part of the hotel looked nice, but we found that the people on the other side were much friendlier & the rooms were just as nice. We will be booking again, but this time in the Garden view rooms- where you can look out at the tropical pool setting & listen to their wonderful "island" music. We will definately be coming back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved The Dana on Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Dana on July 5th and stayed through the 7th. We stayed in the "new" part of the hotel and the rooms were absolutely immaculate, we had 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper. The arcadia door opens onto a patio overlooking Mission Bay and a great park. If you have children I would recommend the ground floor as your children can play in the grassy area of the park as you sit on your patio watching them. Make sure to bring frisbees, kites etc. It was absolutely wonderful! There are also concrete fire pits located on the actual beach for evening hot dog roasts etc. We are already making plans to come bcak next year with 4 other couples. The pools are great with a pool bar located at the Tropical pool. The ONLY negative thing I can say is DO NOT EAT at the Blue Pearl. The wait staff is inexperienced, and EXTREMELY slow! There were only 3 other couples eating when we were there but our serving time was crazily slow-food cold when served- and a dirty table remained dirty the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: LauLeePop3545
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Dana for one night at the end of a 6 day stay in San Diego. We had previously been staying at the Glorietta Bay Inn in Coronado but had such a terrible experience we checked out early and chose The Dana as the location for the remainder of our vacation. We were in a small but adequate room in the older section. Our room was just a few steps from the pool which was heavenly. A large pool and large hot tub with lots of other families was a welcome relief. There was even a small pool bar area with adult beverages available. The room served it's purpose nicely, two comfortable queen beds, small fridge, bathtub and shower and dressing area. It was the first night we actually had a restful sleep. The hotel staff were in constant view, and very helpful. Lots of attendants at the pool, constantly refilling the pool towel bin. We were told that we couldn't check in until 4:00 and we were offered a pool key so that the kids could swim until check in time. We will visit The Dana again, now that I know how nice it is on "the other side". The new suite rooms are very nice with a bay view. We did have dinner at the onsite restuarant The Blue Pearl. The menu was strange and the wait staff very inexperienced. It was typical fare, nothing really stood out or was special. We were the only diners in the restaurant for about a half hour so I found it strange that we were ignored so much. I also thought it was a bit pricey for what was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Beware- Pictures on website are NOT accurate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I begin to tell you what's bad (and I mean bad), I'll note the good: The on-site restaurants, the Blue Pearl and Firefly are excellent. Food was great and so was the service, nice atmosphere at both. The Dana Inn, however, is another story. First things first - the Dana website is simply inaccurate, it is a LIE. The photos are very decieving and HIDE the half of the hotel they don't want you to see with computerized images of trees (I kid you not). The lobby and NEW half of the hotel are pretty and modern. The other half is not very nice. Many have noted that the upgrade to the rooms made them better on the inside - it didn't. My friend's room was considered an upgrade from mine - their bathroom sink was in the foyer and they did not have an armoire - they had NO PLACE to hang their clothes, just a few drawers. It seems that they just slapped together whatever leftovers they had from the newer side to spruce up the older ones. The rooms felt like a motel off a highway. The price difference between the new side and old side is huge (and neither are very reasonable). Several rooms on BOTH sides face the highway which you will hear at night if you don't turn on the air conditioner. Also - PLEASE BE WARNED their "fitness center" consists of one treadmill, one stairmaster and one stationary bike, period. No weights, no nothing else. It is located off the pool in a room the size of my bathroom. All of this would not bother me so much if it weren't for the horrible service, which both sides have to deal with. The Dana is run by high school and college-aged kids who have not been trained on much of anything. Just one of many examples - my friend's room key stopped operating properly (this happened to all three couples in my group as well as one family I noticed complaining when I was checking in). Rather than fixing the problem, the concierge made him stand on line behind about 10 people who were checking in. This is just insane in the world of customer service. I stayed at the Dana to run the San Diego Marathon, a six night stay. I was given a room on the highway side (my friends, who were spectators and checked-in at the exact same time as me, were given upgrades). I had to fight for a move - the staff stated that they would not accomodate me for at least 2 more days. Eventually I gave up because I simply wanted to unpack already. The hotel staff knew that I was a runner as they gave me a packet upon check-in, but no upgrade for me. It gets better. The ONLY reason why I picked this hotel was for their shuttle service to the race. Rather than dealing with confirmation and payment upon check-in, they had me & 60 others stand on a line at 5am the morning of our marathon (6:30 start) to do this. Then there was not enough room for me in their shuttle. Please keep in mind, they had called me at work in NY THREE times to confirm my 5am shuttle reservation. Yet after standing on line and paying for my ride, I got bumped. I had to take a cab at 5:30am. Then, at check-out, they STILL wanted to charge me the extra fee for the shuttle. I am at a loss for words at what the staff at this hotel did to me. The really sad part is that the location of this hotel is prime and the grounds are beautiful. It has a nice resort feel, whereas most hotels in San Diego feel like just hotels. The pools are nice, although having to use a room key to unlock the pool was a bit obnoxious - I believe that they have a problem with homeless people (I saw many sleeping on their lawns during an early morning run). The Dana has so much potential, but the service was just so poor. In my case, they knew that they had faltered and gave me some $ off on my stay. But this just does not make up for their actions or lack thereof. I have never in my life had such a bad experience. This is what I get for not listening to previous reviews of the hotel - please do not make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty view but looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Trip1234567
Reviews.Content: PROs: Blue Pearl restaurant had good variety menu, food was good, wait staff was very nice. The view from the Marina is lovely. The hotel is conveniently situated - easy to get to Sea World, Zoo, Legoland with quick easy freeway access. CONs: - We did not get the room we requested (suite with queen sleeper in separate area) but nothing could be done when we got there. There are only 3 washers/3 dryers for the entire complex so get there early. One of the dryers has a broken, rusted screen in the back which I didn't see until it had ripped 4 shirts/sweaters. The hotel would not compensate for this until I called Orbitz. Also, the soap machine was out of order through out our stay and you had to get change from the front desk to use the machines. Yet, when I went to get change, they only had $2 worth, which wasn't even enought to wash/dry one load. I had to ask people standing in line for change. The phones were not working for 6 days of our stay - they would ring with nothing but static. We were woken up at 3:00 and 3:30 in the morning by the ringing. The hotel finally disabled calls into our room on day 4 - not the safest answer to the problem. They would not compensate us for waking us up the previous nights. The websites say you can see the SeaWorld fireworks from your balcony - you sure couldn't see it from ours. I think they meant off the back community balcony where everyone walks to their hotel rooms - not exactly the place you would stand in your pjs at 10:00 at night. The hotel seems to host alot of special events - weddings, etc. One night we came back looking forward to a swim in the pool close to our building, but it was full of people who appeared to be from the wedding. We didn't feel comfortable bringing our young children into that atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: lolliedallas
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Dana. We stayed on the marine side. Our room appeared older on the outside- however I was surprised when I walked into the room that it had been updated. Granite tile in the bathrooms. Newer looking furniture and carpet. The update made a huge difference. The rooms were very clean, but they are small. A large family might find this room too small. This hotel is very close to Sea World and to Misson Beach which made it very accessible. Also, the front desk was very helpful and friendly. If you are looking for a five star hotel this would not work for you, but if you are the average person wanted a nice clean place to stay then you will be satisfied. Drawback for me - no bathtub - just a shower in the room. Perks - 2 pools, close to Mission Beach, Sea World, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not the highlight of our stay in the USA”
Reviews.Author: zig-n-zag
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Dana on Mission Bay from a fantastic week in Anaheim by shuttle at 10.30am and was advised by reception that we could not check in until 4pm. We asked for an upgrade (which we were willing to pay for) as the old section looks like a dump from the outside and were told there were none available, maybe tomorrow. To which we responded not to worry about it. We left our bags in their storage as advised by the front desk and when we went to collect them despite having the tickets, they had trouble finding them. We then had to lug all of of our bags to the room the front desk had allocated us only to find that the room key did not work. Housekeeping checked the room and it was not even cleaned, so this meant another long walk to the front desk. They allocated us another room and we had to lug all of our luggage up a flight of stairs. The room once inside was nothing special, but clean and much better looking than the outside of the buildings. We had been allocated a room near the pool which my son thought was great. The next day the nightmare began.... we arrived back at the Dana at 6pm after a day at Seaworld to find that our room was completely empty with no note or message. We rang the front desk to be told that they had moved us to a room in the new section (and we would be paying an upgrade fee) to which we responded that we had not requested this as we were satisfied with the room we had and were not prepared to pay extra. We were then told that our things would be brought back to us straight away. WRONG.... Our next suprise was that they allocated our old room (which were still inside as the room key had worked) to another family. So now our room key did not work and we had to do the long walk to the front desk again. When we arrived there the family who they had rebooked our old room were complaining that there was luggage inside the new room (that they got for the price of the 'old room') that they had been allocated (it was our luggage of course). 4 hours later, with hungry complaining children we finally got our luggage back however we were missing items (sunglasses, shampoo, Coke, part of the outfit of my Daughter's build-a-bear that we had paid a fortune for in Downtown Disney etc) and contacted the frontdesk. We were made to make a list of the missing items and the manager on duty replaced the miscelaneous items and assured us that they would check with housekeeping to locate the other items the next morning. For our inconvenience they sent us a fruit basket (which was a nice gesture). My husband checked the next morning and was assured that they had located items and they would be in our room by the time we got back that evening. When we got back from a day at the zoo etc, nothing had been returned. We contacted the front desk and were told that they had located my shampoo (not the other expensive personal items which we were more concerned about). By this stage I was rather upset and put them on the spot requesting they advise me what they were going to do about our missing items and finally they offered to reimburse us for the value of the missing items. Moral to our stay, never leave anything in the drawers, fridge or bathroom if you intend to leave your room for the day if you stay at the Dana on Mission Bay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: BVieux
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Dana May 13-15th. Staff was very pleasant upon arrival the staff upgraded our room since there was no king rooms to a marina view room. The decore was very nice everything updated. But, very disappointed by the very small shower. Took twenty minutes to get a cocktail service very slow. Would most likely not stay there again would try another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and it was wonderful. I was a little anxious upon arrival as we booked a poolside room and after all the reviews of the old building I wasn't expecting much. Much to our surprise we were upgraded to the new bayside suite which was awesome and huge. We didn't check-in until 8 pm after a long day at Seaworld so we couldn't really see the property until the morning. Our room was absolutely wonderful not to mention beatiful. We couldn't have asked for more. In the morning we went for a swim and the pool was great. It was heated which was nice. We could see the older hotel building and boy were we happy that we stayed in the new building. For the price we payed for the night I would have been a little disappointed to be in the old building. Now if we go back we will for sure pay more to stay in the new building. And we will stay there again! The restaurant (Blue Pearl) was great. We ordered room service that night which was tasty and not to pricey. Breakfast was also very good! The moral of this story is to book a room in the bayside suites or it may not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhhh, it was just OK....Pictures posted of hotel NOT accurate!”
Reviews.Author: Hannahbears_mom
Reviews.Content: I didn't know that if you booked a 'regular room' you'd be put in the old part of the hotel! Whatta crock! I wanted the pretty new part, but I guess you have to pay primo dollars to stay there. The room was small--especially for four people. We ate at the Blue Pearl Restaurant and the wait staff was just spacy! We ate there three times and you constantly had to repeat yourself, talk louder, etc. Maybe in California they all go deaf...the food was delicious though! Word of advice, ask the concierge on places to eat, a lot of times they have VIP seating for their guests and it can cut your wait time in half at certain restaurants (we used this for World Famous on Mission Beach--AWESOME!!!). Our ONE window faced Mission Drive, but the room WAS quiet. The pools were nice and the vegetation lush and very beautiful. It was very easy to get in and out of the hotel, as opposed to trying to get around near the Hotel Circle area. The Firefly Lounge was just wonderful to sit and enjoy a margarita or a glass of wine...which my hubby and I did during our four night stay. The staff (with the exception of the Blue Pearl Restaurant staff) WERE TRULY nice and pleasant. I just think they need to completely over haul the hotel, otherwise don't advertise this beautful sparkly hotel with pretty pictures if you're going to put the majority of your guests in avocado painted, motor lodge looking buildings. Avocado went out in the 70's guys!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay. Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at the Dana.We stayed in the old part of the hotel but were really suprised to find how nice it was.The rooms were small but clean,beds comfy. We were very near the pool which was maintained very well (not many people using it which the kids really enjoyed.) We ate in the Blue Pearl and Firefly on several occasions and found the food very good and reasonably priced. The staff all seemed to be very helpful and professional.It had a great location to all of San Diego and the courtesy bus to Sea World,Airport etc was very handy. The only down side to the trip was getting charged $50 to our room for an international call that we never made, but after a phone call to the reception this was resolved. Overall the hotel was very good and we will be using it again on our holiday next year.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided....but overall ok.”
Reviews.Author: zonamom
Reviews.Content: Okay, so for weeks before my trip I was scared because I had found there was an "old" section of the hotel that the website doesn't mention too much of. Well, I had hoped for a room in the new section but didn't get myself all worked up over it just incase. Well, when we got there the grounds are beautiful as is the lobby and newer section. The older section grounds are also beautiful with the exception of the outside of the buildings. Had they chosen to give the outside a facelift when they remodeled perhaps there wouldn't be such a difference. But they have old brown paint and the roofs are rough looking. Once we got into the room it was decent. I am not complaining. The walls and ceilings are a bit thin as far as hearing your neighbors but that only happened a couple of times. The vanity had granite counter tops and was nice. The bathroom was small, only a shower. The remodelers that were used didn't exactly do the best job painting. There were a few missed places. The ceiling over the shower appeared to have or had some mildew on it. The room was clean for the most part. Nice decorations (mirrors/armoire/chairs) There were a few spots on the carpet. The housekeeping service seemed to come later in the day than preferred. One night we did receive an unwanted wake-up call at 3am but when this was brought to their attention they did offer to buy us breakfast so they did want to make up for it. The Marina is awesome to stroll and take in the view. The Blue Pearl was great both times we visited (some people have mentioned the Red Hen...this is now the Blue Pearl) We had lunch at the Firefly when we arrived. They have a very very small lunch menu...don't know if it's the same for dinner or not. Both of the pools were well kept. Had to call for towels once...and they took forever so we ended up just going back to the room for some). The spa is nice and hot, except they drained it and didn't turn back on the heater one day. Overall I had a good stay. I loved the location to seaworld and the beach. After you get over the initial shock of the visual differences between the new section and the old it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Property, Pleasant People”
Reviews.Author: TheDude
Reviews.Content: Visited the Dana the week of April 17. Had a room in the Bay View (new) section, overlooking Mission Bay. We found our room to be quite clean, housekeeping did an excellent job, the people at the front desk were courteous and professional. On a couple occasions we contacted the front desk, we were pleasantly surprised to receive a follow-up call to ensure our questions / issues had been resolved. Surprisingly, I got a much better deal calling them as opposed to booking via the Internet. Overall, a very delightful stay made more pleasant with the Dana's employees.

Reviews.Title: “dana was just okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned from a long weekend in San Diego and stayed at the Dana. I booked through Expedia with a rental car from Advantage. First bit of advice - do not book through Advantage! They were without a doubt the worst rental car agency I've encountered. Review your bill carefully, they like to charge you for gas upfront and another daily "service rate" (kind of like a AAA service). There is nothing in writing that these fees would be refunded (as the clerk stated) posted in their office or on the charge slip. The clerk offered to hand write on the charge slip that I would be refunded if I filled up the gas tank upon return of the car. I challenged both fees and made them take them off - which I'm happy to say he did. Bad start to my trip though. Now onto the Dana. Absolute difference in level of service upon arrival. The best part of the stay at the Dana was the personnel. Everyone I encountered was marvelous, starting with the crew at check in. The level of professionalism, mixed with a personal touch was much appreciated at all venues - both restuarants, gift shop, concierge and several desk clerks. That said, the rooms unfortunately did not live up to my expectations. The carpets were well worn with "huge" spots. The bathroom just okay. Beds also just ok. The grounds were "cute" - birds of paradise plants everywhere making the facility look a bit tropical. Location to seaworld obviously a positive, but my trip did not involve visiting the park. I chose the Dana based upon price, location to airport and a view of their site which gave me an impression of a nicer facility than it was. All in all - 2 out of three not bad.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful to stay at, restaurants a great, poor water pressure in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Potential”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Dana Mission Bay. The Hotel was nice. The beach is about 4 blocks away. There or no malls around the area. You have to catch a cab downtown or to the Mall and it's about $12.00. Th Hotel has two sides one side is curb side entrance to your room, no veiw of the ocean and no view of the boats. The other side is were you want to be. It cost more to have a view of the ocean this we did'nt know. We went threw a travel agency. The hotel is nice two pools, good food and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated--Website is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not use their website as your best guage! While the photographs are beautiful and the propoerty in general is, the photos only show 1/2 of the rooms...only the most elegant. Obvious marketing stuff, but deceiving. We booked flight, hotel, car and activities through Expedia...that part was flawless. Great location for SeaWorld, Mission Beach and driving north on the 101. What the Dana doesn't tell/show you is that the majority of their rooms are based on a two-story, ugly brown, motel style. The rooms are quite small, the walls are paper thin and the front windows all face a parking lot...definitely not mentioned on the website or by registration staff. The rooms were musty(maybe because of the sea air) and dank. We did love the pool and marina areas and the Firefly bar was very cool as well. The wait staff was excellent here and the drinks were very reasonably priced. Only pool complaint was that there were no towels for 3+ hours and after many calls by many patrons, the requests were still ignored. The only way we would stay here again would be to register for one of the suite rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Three Star?”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn007
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline to find a three star hotel in San Diego. We were excited to see we had three nights at The Dana on Mission Bay. The Dana's website showed beautiful facilities. However, when we arrived we realized The Dana actually has two hotels--a new three star hotel and the old "maybe" one star hotel. We were given a room in the old part. We wanted a new room since we paid for a three star hotel through Priceline. The management told us the old rooms were the ones we could get through Priceline, but we could upgrade for $75.00 a night extra. We didn't want to pay the extra so we slept in the old hotel for two of the three nights. The room was upstairs with no elevator. There was no hair dryer although they did bring one up upon request. The soap from a previous guest was still in the shower. Finally, on the third night we decided to pay for an upgrade. They did lower the price to an extra $50. for us for that night. The room was beautiful and definitely three star quality. Who do we cite for this? Priceline? The hotel for making the website deceptive? If you stay at The Dana, make sure you are staying in the new part--the three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week in March”
Reviews.Author: gopherlawyer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Monday through Friday stay at The Dana on Mission Bay. I am usually very selective in hotels with my last two hotels being the W in New Orleans and Hotel Del Coronado. I was expecting a let down, but was suprised by every facet of the stay. Our room was in the new section (based on reviews and walking through the old section you want to avoid this part) and included breakfast each morning at the Blue Pearl. The room seemed almost new with beautiful woodwork, granite countertops in the bathroom and kitchenette, natural stone tile in the bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The room also had a small balcony overlooking the marina which we did not use due to the weather. One nice feature was the large countertop in the bathroom. The breakfast each morning was free and was clearly an upgrade over any continental breakfast. The staff was pleasant and attentive and allowed us to extend our stay an additional night at the same package rate (we had planned on spending the last night in the Omni). Maid service was good by hotel standards and our one call for a changed light bulb was answered in less than an hour. Bottom line, if you can stay in the NEW part of The Dana this is a great place to stay! My wife asked that I add that it is in a very convenient location; walking distance from SeaWorld, a short drive to Mission Beach and I-5.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I can't believe this place gets good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, am I ever glad we stayed only one night. What a bad experience! Fortunately, the Glorietta Bay Inn on Coronado saved the remainder of our vacation. We booked and prepaid our night with the San Diego Tourism reservation system ("ARES"). I would not recommend doing this in the future. We were 4 hours late arriving into San Diego due to flight delays. Once we finally did arrive we were told that they didn't have the room type that we had booked and actually DOWNGRADED us. Usually when something like this happens you're upgraded. Not us, we were DOWNGRADED to the last available pool side room with 2 double beds (#305) instead of the Marina View room we booked with a King size bed. It was a cool evening so we needed to use the heater. Oh man, the thing was loud and couldn't hold a proper temperature. Either we were cold or we were over heating. I personally didn't sleep a wink. What a waste of money! The paint on the bathroom walls was chipping off and the floors dirty. The fun was just beginning. You would think that we would be able to rest past 8AM wouldn't you? Not there. We had a tree trimming crew right outside our room yelling over their chain saws. What a joke. When we went to have breakfast at the restaurant there was a 20-30 minute wait with no place to wait. So we thought we would sit outside at their tables. Ah, no not there either -- tree trimming again. I suppose we could have sat there but we would have been hit by falling tree branches. I was so angry with our visit that had we not prepaid I would have demanded our money back (which I have never done before in my life). Moral of the story, don't prepay for anything! The Dana will not ever get a second chance with me. I will go directly to the Glorietta Bay Inn where they understand what service is.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, room was fine”
Reviews.Author: threerohdes
Reviews.Content: I think people should remember the mantra, you get what you pay for. I took my children ages 12 and 15 on a 4 day trip to California and we stayed at The Dana. We booked our trip through Alaska Vacations and ended up paying something like $72.00 a night for our room. I had read the reviews and was wary, but our stay there was very nice. The staff is first rate, very polite and helpful, even when dealing with irate people. We were unable to check in at 4 PM, so for our inconvienence we were upgraded to a marina view room. It was still in the older part of the hotel, but for what we paid, it was quite nice. The upgrading in the room was nice, the double vanity in the bath area was very beautiful. The floors in the bathroom are of stone, and the decor was pretty. This is an old hotel, you can't really expect it to be anything other than it really is. The windows could stand to be replaced with somethig more modern and energy efficient, the rooms could use some serious soundproofing and the paint job in the room could be better, but it is a great place to be IF you are not expecting perfection. We loved the tropical pool and grounds around it. We ate dinner one evening at the Blue Pearl, they have a small menue but the food is good. The wait staff was very attentive and the place was very clean and modern. We noticed that the grounds were being cleaned up and replanted, landscaping crews were doing a great job adding lawn and trimming trees. The bar area in the tropical pool area was in the process of being upgraded with new countertops and roofing. We took the shuttle to SeaWorld and walked home one evening. It is a pretty short walk, somthing like 10 minutes. One thing to take note of is that the marina is undergoing some construction, and it does tend to be noisy at times. I would stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive place close to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: dwheatl
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia for about $85 a night for a room with two double beds. The room was small, the bathroom was small (no tub) but the room was nicely decorated and the grounds are beautiful. The pool was warm and lovely; there were several people in the tropical pool even though it was pouring rain. We walked to Sea World and took the shuttle back at the end of the day. Having a fridge and coffee maker in the room made it easy to have breakfast in the room. The casual restaurant was pretty pricey (we went to look at dessert, and a piece of cheesecake was $7, so we left and went to Dairy Queen). The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day vacation over Valentines Day weekend and we we really happy with the Dana on Mission Bay. We had a room in the older section the first few nights and it was fine. We rarely spent any time there. It was clean and the staff was accomodating and friendly. They really went out of their way to make our visit special. The last two nights we moved to a room overlooking the bay in the new section. The suite was incredible! Gorgeous. We spent our nights sitting on the patio overlooking the bay and looking at the boats. It was perfect. All in all, i would go back in a heartbeat. It was hard to leave

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer”
Reviews.Author: sucrahkcir
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 days at The Dana with my 5yr. old grandson and loved the place. Anyone writing a bad review must have been staying at The Dana 'on Mars' not Mission Bay. The room overlooking 1 of the 2 pool/hot tub areas was more than worth the price. Great location, beautiful landscaping, quick check-in/out, friendly service from everyone, free shuttle to and from the Zoo and Sea World- I don't know what else you could ask for. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bay View Rooms-Wonderful..Pool View-Ugggggg”
Reviews.Author: MalibuSky
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was for a "pool" view room, check in went fine but when we walked into the room I was really dismayed. You basically walk into the entry of the room which is the closet (not real closet but a rack to hang your clothes) and the sink area. You then pass the bathroom on the left, which had a only a shower (no tub) and the "loo". We were on the second floor and the room was really dark and depressing, a small window looked toward the pool but we couldn't really see it between the trees. My initial reaction was verified when we walked toward the sink and noticed gunk on the walls. The real problem was the fact that my daughter had her foot in a soft cast and needed to have a bath to soak her foot. It never occurred to me to ask for a room with a bath because I can't remember the last time we went to a motel/hotel without one. When I called the front desk, I was told that they had no other rooms available with a bath except if I wanted to upgrade to a "bay view" room for $50 a night. If i had bee there on a real vacation I would have contemplated the additional money but we were in San Diego for a soccer tournament and I knew we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. They then offered to find something my daughter could soak her foot in and told me they would call back. About 15 minutes later, I received a call indicating they were upgrading us to a "bay view" room at no charge. Needless to say I was quite happy but even more impressed when we drove up to the "new" section of the hotel. The room was fantastic, the bathroom was really nice, the beds and linen were very comfy and the view was wonderful. It was an up-grade that would have been more than worth the $50 they were originally going to charge me. The differences between the two sections were night and day. Bottom line, I would recommend the "new bay view" rooms in a heartbeat, the pool viewrooms.... well let's say, probably not. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the location fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “a great 50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent my 50th birthday at the Dana. We arrived on a beautiful january afternoon. We stayed Jan. 19 to Jan 26th. Our room was in the 800 block overlooking the Marina. The room was pretty standard. We had a king size bed. and double bathrooms sinks. The room was clean and fresh. It was my birthday and my husband arranged for flowers and wine to be delivered to the room. The staff did that and threw in a lovely fruit platter. At all times we were treated well. The desk helped us plan our days. They set up tours for us, give us tips on where the good restaurants were. We ate at the Firefly a few times, excellent food. The bar staff was very attentive, and always had a few moments to chat. The two pools and two hot tubs, were clean and well maintened. We also had breakfast at the blue Pearl. The breakfast was huge, we shared one. There is no extra charge for sharing one plate. They have rental bikes on the premises, so do rent one and bike around the bay.I found everybody as pleasant as could be . We would definitely go back again. we are already talking about going back in Sept. to take in some of the horseraces . Good value for the money. If you want to have fancier rooms. the new section is where you might want to stay. Being across the street from Seaworld, three miles from old town and a bus stop right out the front, the marina and bay right outside the door . Why go anywwhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: USATraveller
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the hotel thanks to Airmiles and for the money we had an excellent stay. Maybe for the normal rack rate we might have felt it a little expensive, however we liked the motel type arrangements as it was different from the "everything looks the same" chains. If you are paying $200 a night get a better deal, we paid considerably less. The location is ideal for SeaWorld. Our room was clean when we arrived and cleaned well in the three days we were there. If you have a heavy suitcase some people might not like the first floor rooms and the whole 20 yards you might have to walk from the car but. I can manage 20 yards and 20 steps so it was fine for us. Pool and gym facilities are pretty good as well Good stay. We would certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “overall very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in November. Found the staff to be polite and helpful. We were in the older section overlooking the Marina. Parking was close by and it was quiet. As others have mentioned the rooms could be cleaner. We found several old french fries on the floor infront of the airconditioner (which had the front cover partially falling off). We left them there to see what would happen. They were never removed in the three nights we were there. Also in the bathroom the corners of the wall above the baseboard were dirty. The on site full service restaurant was excellent. Friendly staff. good food and reasonable prices. All in all we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Southwest Vacations package back in August, 2004. I then decided to read the reviews on the Dana, and let me tell you I was ready to switch hotels. The only thing that stopped me was the positive reviews were so different from the negative ones. I decided when we arrived at the hotel that if I did not like the room, I would upgrade to the new side. When we arrived the check in went smoothly and the front desk person was real nice. We went to our room and it was just great. The room had been updated and looked like the picture on their site. The room was clean and well kept the whole time we were there. I would reccomend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews recently I was very concerned since I pre-paid my reservations. I had a standard room that had been renovated which turned out to be fine with us. We are from Hawaii so being my the marina was a bonus but we spent most of the time at Sea World, Legoland and the Wild Life Park and only used the room to sleep. Please know that the older section is more like a motel room, don't expect anything more unless you stay in the new section which looks awesome! The new pool looks great and would be a nice place to hang out. The marina is great from relaxing, walking or jogging. The location is great, close to Sea World, easy access to the freeways and many commercial places to eat and shop only a 2 minute drive away (Sports Arena Drive). If you go the west on W. Mission Bay drive, you will hit a Mission Beach area (2 minute drive) with a old wooden roller coaster and a small beach community. You can walk, jog or rollerblade down the beach sidewalk. There are small shops and places to eat there also. If you turn north up Mission Blvd, there is a more contemporary beach community area in the Pacific Beach area (5 - 7 minute drive). If you head north further to La Jolla, there is the Children's Beach area (12-15 minutes drive) where the seals hang out on the beach! Ask for directions. If you want a shopping center, Fashion Valley Shopping Center is only 7 minutes away by taking the 8 east. If you want a nice room, get a room in the new section, it you want a standard room, expect a Motel room and make sure you get a renovated room (kind of a sloppy renovation work). PLEASE don't expect more than, I cannot speak for the rooms that have not been renovated! The website info is for the NEW SECTION only! Expedia has a good photo of the standard rooms. Shop around, I got a great deal with the 4th night free! The front desk people were very pleasant and helpful. That's all, hope this helps! Be Blessed!

Reviews.Title: “Pay more this is not a deal”
Reviews.Author: debbiedrury
Reviews.Content: Nothing but problems. Could not check in on time. Room was dirty!! Found old food under beds, carpets were never vacuumed. They didnt disclose there were not bathtubs only showers. I am a small person 5'2", 135 and I could not get my arms up to wash my hair. Maids did nothing but make the beds and leave what may or may not have been clean towels. Advertised shuttles to Sea World but they do not tell you they only drop off in the morning and pick up at closing. They do not run any other time. I will not stay there again. I will pay more and stay where I am not afraid to sleep. The place was just plain old fashioned DIRTY!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From all of the bad reviews that we read on this site, we were a little nervous about our stay...we ended up being pleasantly surprised however! The staff was great, very friendly, which set the tone for the stay. We had a great room with a great view. We had never been to San Diego before, but will definately come back to the Dana. A big thanks to the staff for making us feel so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “New Dana-Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: amcsocal
Reviews.Content: We had just come back from this hotel for a weekend stay. I had reserved 3 rooms, and were looking for a place to stay after visiting Sea World. If you stay at the new Dana, the room was just awesome! They all are bayview rooms, and large rooms. You can actually fit 4-5 people in the room. All of our rooms had kitchenettes, with a balcony, and it had a gorgeous view of the bay. After we were done with Seaworld, we came back to our room, and there were fireworks just outside. We were able to just watch it from our balcony. There was also free shuttle that provided transporation to and from Sea World. We ate at their restaurant, the Blue Pearl and the food was good! Staff was young and very nice! They were helpful with everything we requested! The pool was nice also. Would have loved to stay extra nights in this hotel! It is pricey, but hotels these days are pricey, especially if they have ocean/bay views. Also, this part of the hotel was just opened summer of this year, so everything is new. And their standard rooms are bigger than usual. So, if you can, book the new bayview rooms at the new complex.

Reviews.Title: “Dana is OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dana Inn was pretty good. Loved the location of the hotel - very close to Mission Beach. Hotel backs to the water. There were a couple problems with the room upon arrival, but once notified friendly office staff, technicians were knocking within minutes of call to solve the problem. Very prompt. The location of our room was fabulous. Have a 7 and 2 year old. We were in the 200 rooms, right out our door was rec area with foosball tables, ping-pong, shuffleboard and pool. Make a left about 10 feet was pool - gated, securely locked. The sliding door in room that lead to the patio area had an extra lock at the bottom of the door to secure so TODDLERS are not able to get out. The carpet in the room we stayed in was filthy. Wore shoes on the carpet at all times. The room was a bit smaller than usual, but not tiny. Those was pretty much the only complaint that was not resolved. I would probably return to the Dana however if the carpets were replaced that would be great. The new side of the Dana is immaculate however quite a bit higher priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You're Lead To Believe”
Reviews.Author: Stevek116NE
Reviews.Content: What a dump! After an early evening bumper-to-bumper drive from LA, we pulled into the Dana's reception area and were, at first, pleasantly surprised. It was new, well lit and very clean. We all (wife and two kids) were looking forward to a quiet evening by the pool. The front desk was very helpful and checked us in quickly. We went to our room, which was above the old reception area on the second floor. There was no close parking, so I had to lug our luggage 20 yards from the only available parking spot which was dark apparently due to a light being out. As we came up the steps, one of our backs got snagged on the nails that were sticking out of the wooden railing, ripping the zipper open! Then we opened the door to the room and we knew we were in trouble - the carpets were stained and black with dirt, and the bedspreads were dirty a well with yellow stains! The room was warm, so I turned on the AC and my wife went in to shut the window in the bathroom. As she did, the shutter on the window (for privacy?) fell off, smashing the lamp and bruising my wife! I went to clean up the broken plastic with a hand towel, and the towel turned black from the dirt on the bathroom floor. We used another damp towel on the carpet, which also turned black! We called the front desk concerning the window, carpets, etc., and were told this was the only room available unless we wanted to upgrade for $100 a night! They requested that we stay in the room and they would find us another room the next day (by now it was 10:30 -11:00pm).We reluctantly stayed in the room. The next morning, the front desk, as promised, found us another room, which was a little bit larger, but not any cleaner. The carpets were so dirty, that we had to wear sandals once we got out of the shower otherwise our feet needed to be cleaned again before we could put our socks on! Because we had pre-paid, we had little choice but to endure the grime! By far, this was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in for the money. We spent three weeks traveling in California and unfortunately had to end our stay in a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I read "Very disappointing and misleading" I understood exactly the feeling, and I wished I logged on this site before we traveled. I reserved a room from the "Entertainment book," which gives 50% off selected hotels. I checked the facility online, and it seemed extremely nice. The person making the reservation told me of the great rooms and amenities. After checking in the room (with my husband and my 3 y/o), my husband and I were horrified. The bathroom was dirty, and it seems that nobody cleaned it properly for months, including, but not limited to, the bathtub, shutters, windows, floor (I wiped the floor with a piece of tissue, which turned grey), and the mirror was completely stained. The carpet wasn't vacuumed, and after removing the bed cover, we noticed crumbs and a lot of dirt all across the wall (accumulation of a period of time). I called to complain and was told that somebody will be there to clean. While waiting, I started to clean the bathroom. It felt like a not so clean public bathroom without the paper covers. A maid showed up with a bottle of spray and a cloth. After seeing the room, she went to bring a vacuum and more cleaning stuff. We left the room and let her clean. The place was cleaned very superficially. The bathtub still had hair. I cleaned it with soap and a washcloth, around down and up which turned the wash cloth black. I didn't dare put any clothes in the closet. The smell was unbearable. The air conditioner was so old and loud, I had to use ear plugs. The sheets were not changed the next day. If I knew the real condition of the rooms, I wouldn't have reserved a room. If I knew they had different rooms, I would have paid a little more. Although we were very disappointed from the room, the exterior was very beautiful. There is a nice bar by the pool, and we enjoyed the "Blue Pearl" restaurant. If you decide to use this facility, I strongly suggest that you request and receive a room in the new wing. After checking out, while at Sea World (which is two minutes away), I remembered that I dropped my expensive sunglasses in the room behind the bench, just before checking out, but I attended to my daughter and forgot to pick them up. We came back before heading home and were told that they weren't found. I showed the front desk girl a similar pair belonging to my husband. I went back to the room, which was already cleaned, but they were not behind the bench or anywhere else. What a cleaning crew!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the older part of the motel (wouldn't call it a hotel) is pretty grotty. We stayed in block no: 800+ for a marina view(7 nights) - we only just got a view of the marina. The room was pretty grotty, stains on carpets, dull, dingy and not overly clean, and I did'nt feel comfortable about being on the ground floor here. Big public car park next door, from which anyone can access the Dana. On the plus side the new section with 'bayviews' are very nice as is the new pool and the shuttle service is pretty good. But for the price you pay for the new part of the motel, you could stay at a good hotel. Both eating places 'The Blue Pearl and The Firefly' are quite good. Quite a good location. We booked thru Expedia so be careful about what you want when you book.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the dana inn in august 2004. We stayed for 4 nights. This hotel went beyond our expectatons, the room was spacious, clean and beautifully decorated, the bathroom was especially well done with a luxurious feel to it. The room was part of the newly built apartments, that were completed in the summer of 2004. The older apartments looked ok, (but i would definitely ask for the newer rooms again.) Both the restaurants on site were pleasant to eat in, and the pool area was clean and well maintained. The view from the balcony over the bay and marina was lovely, and only a short distance to Seaworld,( and the hotel offers a free courtesy bus) Great value for money. One of the best places we stayed on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than "Disappointing Dana"”
Reviews.Author: Blurrie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gross. Unlike the photos shown on Expedia. I knew the second we arrived that we had made a HUGE mistake but our room was prepaid and we were stuck. We too had a garden view and after I literally had a fit in the lobby they at least moved us upstairs. Tiny room, some lights didn't work when we arrived - they were fixed immediately, however. Air conditioner merely blew around mostly hot air. Difficult shower, bathroom like a double wide trailer and staff did not change the sheets. They said if you left this little card on the bed they would not change the sheets, however, I did NOT leave the card on the bed and came back to an uncleaned room with the beds merely made. One good experience was Kevin at the front desk who suggested a restaurant, gave us a card to give to the restaurant for special treatment and offered to drive us there and pick us up. Fabulous beachside restaurant a couple of miles away, good service & great food. And, Kevin picked us up as promised. Thanks Kevin for saving the day a little bit. Any price was too expensive for this experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: etc13
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the bad reviews we were afraid to stay here. However the location was close to many activities so we decided to try the Dana anyways. We were glad we did. We had a bayview room that had 2 queens and a sofabed. The room was overly spacious (even with 2 adults and 2 kids) and very clean. Everything was new. The countertops to their mini-kitchenette (microwave, sink, and small fridge), dining table, and bathroom sink were made of granite. The shower walls were made of stone tiles as were the bathroom floors. All the faucets and hardware were by Moen. The hairdryer that was provided was also of good quality. Request buildings 1000 and 2000 since these are the new ones. The other buildings w/rooms looked much older and as other reviewers stated, looked like a motel. We had no problem w/ hearing every little noise as some of the reviews stated. The walls must be well insulated in the new buildings. The new pool was very nice too overlooking the marina. You could see the Sea World fireworks nightly from the pool area and grass areas. We traveled w/another family and requested adjacent rooms. We lucked out and were also on the ground floor which was convenient since the kids liked running around on the grassy area right outside the patio and bay is just beyond the grass. The view of the bay was excellent and unobstructed. Mission Beach was a 5 minute drive away and Belmont Park is next to it too. The Dana Inn had a complimentary shuttle to and from Sea World which was very convenient. This is a great place for kids and families! The breakfast was also very good at The Blue Pearl on-site. But just be sure to request the new rooms...it was very much a case of the have and have-nots.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice spot for Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights Mid-August, booked with a mainstream Travel Company and got a very nice room in the old building facing the marina. This is an excellent family location with nice pools, kids activities, rentals, and very close to everything. The hotel,(motel section) is old but clean, and was a bit noisy with the 2 pools open late and the wooden balconies. The staff could bone up on the local attractions but were as helpfull as they could be. The hotel has only 1 shuttle to Seaworld and had no tour or bus arrangements. (they suggested the local transit bus). The gift shop is WAY too small and carries very few ammenities. All in all, I reccomend the property if you are travelling with kids or just want a nice casual place to stay close to some very beautiful sights. For more upscale visits, I suggest buck up and stay in the new building for aa bit more money. Very nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Btrtrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana in early August. Nervous due to mixed reviews. We were there for our 34th year of marriage. We had booked a package through Alaska Airlines. Check in was very smooth. They told us we would overlook the tropical pool. We were fine with that. The room was clean. Not fancy, but we did not spend much time sitting there as San Diego is filled with too many great activities. We like a shower, so no tub was fine with us. We received a call to be sure our room was fine. Let it be known that the pool closes at 11 pm. First night the noise continued to 11:15. A call to the desk and the pool promptly was closed. The second night, someone came and closed the pool. We did have partiers, but we have been there ourselves and just closed the window and turned on the air!! We liked the fact it was near water and nice paths for walking. Concierge was very helpful. It has easy access to highways. The newspaper was delivered each day to our door. For us that is a treat! Most of all....Enjoy San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in August. Overall very satisfied with the room which was booked through Expedia, and the pool areas were kept clean and stocked with towels. Problems with TV reception took two (very prompt) visits from engineering to fix. Great location for Seaworld which was a 15 minute walk from the room. Missed the shuttlebus back after being advised wrongly at Seaworld, but we should have asked at the Hotel so no problem there.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back”
Reviews.Author: arizonanative46
Reviews.Content: Went to The Dana on Aug 19th for four miserable nights. Started when we got to the hotel at 3:00 p.m. and tried to check in. Were told room wasn't ready but we could wait at the bar. I asked where the room was located, since there is a new section, and was told second floor overlooking the pool. I told the girl I would really appreciate a room away from the pool and somewhat more quiet since we did not children and didn't really want the noise. She rather curtly told me she would see what she could do and come back at 4:00. We waited outside until 3:30 and I went back and spoke to a different girl and our room was ready; the one overlooking the pool. While I was waiting, the couple next to me asked for a room with two queens, which is what we got, and she was given a king. She was told she had been upgraded since they closed some of the other rooms. Lucky her! Get to the room, no tub, moldy shower only. It's very noise from the pool and the carpet was absolutely disgusting. Went to dinner at the hotel restaurant, not that impressive and rather pricey. When we tried to go to bed, the noise was so loud until 11:00 p.m. when the pool closed; but the people in the room below, who had a balcony, decided to drink and talk until about 1:00. Then the people next door banged around on the walls half the night. And the pillows!!!! They stunk to high heaven. Take your own. Next morning, get up plug in the hair dryer and curling iron, and blow the fuse. After 6 minutes of letting the phone ring in the office, my husband had to go down and there were three people standing around; could not understand why someone didn't answer the phone. Five minutes later maintenance was there to tell me we blew a fuse and it was fixed. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, again pricey and not great service. Every night it was loud by the pool; so unless you have kids and don't mind the noise find another area. They new section looked nice from outside, but the old section should be condemned. All the rooms that we passed on our way to the stairs (no elevators) looked as bad as ours. I had stayed at the Dana years ago, and had hoped for the same experience; but was completely let down. Would I stay there again, no. Would I recommend it to anyone, no. The Dana need to completely remodel the older section of the hotel if they expect to keep people coming back

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Dana in a poolside room from Aug 15-18. Although our room was "refurbished," we were not in the new wing. It was NOT worth the money we spent on this poolside room. It was mostly clean (except for the shower head which looked a little moldy). However, the paint job was bad and in some spots peeling. The carpet and the bedspreads were in good condition, but the room had that old Motel feel (which it basically is). I don't mind a motel if that's what I am expecting. However, from their website, you have the feeling that you're staying in a first rate hotel, which the older wing is definitely NOT. We paid the same money for a room at the Hilton in Universal City, which was luxurious. The good points are that the room had a sliding door that led to the pool (very convenient). Also, the pool was clean and heated. The Blue Pearl restaurant had good food, as well. If you're content staying at a motel for top-notch prices, then this place is good for you. I won't stay there again, though.

HotelInfo.Name: The Dana on Mission Bay
